Reviews.Title: “Cute and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: renzwiers
Reviews.Content: The location is first class and the hotel is very comfortable and cozy. Situated a 10 minute walk from the Moulin Rouge in Montmartre, everything is within reach...Le Petit Train as well as the Hop on Hop off doubledecker tour buses stop right near the Moulin Rouge. The Metro stations are also nearby. If arriving by train at Gare du Nord, the taxi ride is short and not very expensive. Hotel des Arts is in a typical narrow street in Montmartre and the entrance is anything but imposing. However, inside you'll find friendly staff, pleasant interior, a small elevator (only enough room for one person with luggage at a time, but it beats walking steep stairs), and best of all, nice clean rooms. If we ever return to Paris, this is where we'll be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: jenny_orme
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as many reviews reported it as being quiet and favourable in other respects. However our experience I am afraid directly contradicted this. Hotel des Arts is located in a narrow, steepish street, bustling with people at all times of the day and night. The reception was friendly enough, the room was very small and dark with poor lighting - quite claustrophobic; the shower even smaller (perhaps the smallest cubicle I have ever used). There was no mirror or proper lighting in the bedroom so we had to share the mirror in the bathroom for hair, shaving, make-up and every other luxury! The room overlooked a very small dark square of a yard. The daylight was somewhere up above. This wasn't a problem; what was a problem was that during the night the moving of what we think was rubbish bins in the yard below exploded into our consciousness at least twice on each night, giving me quite a fright the first time it happened; the noise was so loud that even ear plugs had no effect. People talking in the lobby at all times of the night, woke us and kept us both awake. Then at 6.30am on the first morning we were awoken by a member of staff shouting "taxi". Wrong door; wrong people. The second night the chamber maid unlocked the door and made to enter our bedroom whilst we were both in bed in the morning; she thought we would be at breakfast. We were not amused. In all the hotel was very expensive (in our view) for what it provided - minimum additions; even the one bottle of water on the desk which we drank the first evening was not replaced for the second day. The old bottle was simply left there. We could not help reflecting that this would never happen in even the most basic of bed and breakfast accommodation that we have experienced elsewhere. We are sorry but we were somewhat disappointed over all.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Arts”
Reviews.Author: LukaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel located in a great part of Paris near Sacre Coeur on a decent hill. Our initial room was a disappointment, but were moved with no drama the next day. Breakfast was a little limited with pastries served cold. Hotel staff were very helpful and all we encountered were very comfortable speaking English {much better than my french attempts}. Rooms are smallish but clean and tidy, shower and bathroom facilities were excellent. Restaurants nearby were great and not expensive (wine and beer was expensive) but local wine shops and small supermarkets have inexpensive options. The area is sometimes noted for scammers, beware the friendship bracelet sellers in the gardens below Sacre Coeur, keep clear. The rest of the area was fantastic. Hotel des arts is, I think, well worth a stay for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel especially for it's cleanliness throughout. Our bedroom was small, approximately 9' x 13' but it was well laid out giving us ample space for all our needs. The bed was very comfortable and the decor in the room was very nice. We did not have a view from our room as we looked onto a small yard below,but we preferred this as our room was very quiet due to being at the back of the building. The dining area was small but very well organised and spotlessly clean. There was a good variety and plenty of food provided for breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the day prior to our departure they organised a shuttle bus to pick us up at the hotel for the following day to take us to the airport and it only cost us approximately 3 euro extra than it cost us making our own way and we didn't have the hassle of finding the right bus and a taxi or having to pull our luggage behind us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Gerard M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an extremely good location - just minutes away from the Sacré Coeur, the Moulin Rouge, the Montmartre cemetery and situated just off the bustling rue des Abbesses, where there are many bars and restaurants. It's very accessible from CDG airport - just hop on the RER B to Gare du Nord, and then take the 2 to Blanche. It's well connected to other places in Paris, with both line 2 and line 12 of the metro as well as numerous buses such as the 95 which will take you directly to the centre and tourist spots such as the Louvre. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They completed formalities quickly and efficiently on arrival, and our room, which was situated at the front of the hotel with a view out to the street, was spacious and comfortable. There was little to no noise from the street at night, and we had no problems sleeping. A big plus was having a safe in the room. A kettle would have been nice in the room, but I know this isn't generally available in Europe. The bathroom was also a good size (with bathtub) and very clean. Clean towels were provided. Both the staff and the information desk had a good range of information available on Paris in general and Montmartre in particular. It's a small, family-run hotel and this is apparent in the high level of individual attention shown to guests. We were also able to leave our bags at the hotel after we checked out until we were ready to depart. Would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to a friend who will be staying there this month. The rates were extremely reasonable, and if you book online, even better! Definitely check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Norwegiantourist_10
Reviews.Content: A small hotel centrally located on the slopes of Montmartre. We had a double room facing the street with the added bonus of a very narrow balcony. (Not for those with fear of heights :-) ). Breakfast was OK and the room was clean and well equipped. The elevator was tiny but of course we were happy there was one at all. The bathroom was equally tiny but clean and tidy, everything worked. The obnly thing that made me a bit uneasy was a man patrolling the breakfast room. He was obviously an employee but I never discovered why he was there. Still you can do far worse in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LiLaLou27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February with my fiancee, and had a lovely time. The staff are really friendly and helpful, it has a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and the location is great - 5 mins walk from the metro and the moulin rouge, 2 mins walk from Amelie's cafe Les Deux Moulins, and 10 mins walk through the lovely winding Montmartre streets to Sacre Coeur and some of the best views in Paris. My only gripe would be the size of the room - it was THE tiniest hotel room I've ever stayed in, and it was write a squeeze with both my partner and myself plus 2 small suitcases! However, as the room itself was lovely and clean, we had a great view of the Paris rooftops (and the Eiffel tower in the distance!), and we actually spent very little time in there, then this is really only a very minor thing and had no effect at all on our stay (except for a few typically grumpy comments from my other half ;o). So, to sum up, I will definitely be coming back to Paris - and this hotel - sometime very soon!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm W
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our two night stay and allocated a double room (we had booked a twin). The staff apologised for the mix up and said that we could move to the twin the next night and offered a bottle of champagne in compensation. Sensing we weren't too pleased, 10 minutes later they offers an alternative, a double room each next door to each other. The hotel entrance and lounge is very classy and attractive, with great art, furniture, and a juke box playing french chansons. The rooms themselves don't quite live up to the expectations raised on entering the hotel. They were fine, but no more than average. the location is superb. Just a few minutes from the Sacre Coeur, but very quiet. This is vey good value and I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Picks20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Des Arts after it was recommended by a friend. It is really easy to get to from Gare du Nord and close to a few metro stations. The neighbourhood is really nice to stroll around and we ate in several of the local restaurants. The Sacre Coeur is around a 10 minute walk away. The hotel itself had very friendly staff who were happy to recommend restaurants and even reserved tables for us. It's on a lovely street and some of the rooms including ours had a nice balcony which opened onto the street. The downside of this hotel was for the price, our room was quite small and dimly lit, although it was clean and well presented. I found the bed was very hard and the sheet and pillows weren't that nice- I prefer a duvet or more substantial blanket so I didn't sleep very well. The bathroom was nice and clean and the shower was great. Overall this is a nice friendly hotel in a really good location, however the room lets it down a bit for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: AitchJayPee
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for just the one night. Our room was large, with two sets of French windows opening on to the street, and a perfectly good-sized bathroom which was nice and clean. The street was surprisingly quiet overnight so we slept well and the staff were very accommodating the next day when we wanted to leave out bags there before travelling home in the evening. If you're looking to stay in this area of Paris you can't go wrong with the Hotel des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dilowe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and it could not have been better. The hotel located in a fun neighborhood with lots of shops and cafes that were nice but not expensive. You will need to ride the metro to get to most tourist destinations, but it's easy to do. Our room was on the front and we had a quaint street view. There was a little noise from the street below on a couple of late nights, so if you need perfect silence to sleep you might not like it. I would stay there again, I I hope to be able to because we had such a great time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the most romantic area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Des Arts for three nights in Feb 2012 based on the good recommendations of friends, and were not disappointed. We found Hotel Des Arts to be a cosy hotel with a bohemian feel. The room was small but more than comfortable with lovely french windows that opened out onto the street and helped the space feel larger. Stand out features of the hotel were the breakfast that was included in the price (Chocolate croissants, camembert, etc) and the location (only a minutes walk to the cute bars and restaurants of montmartre. I would definitely stay at Hotel Des Arts again and would suggest to anyone wanting to experience the "Amelie"/ "Moulin Rouge" feeling of Paris to stay here also.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the heart of the arts district”
Reviews.Author: wanderingant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights during the Holidays. New Year in Paris is something! And to have the plus of a comfortable stay in such a wonderful rea of Paris, with its typical bakeries, grocery stores, vegetable markets, a block away from the Moulin de la Galette and within walking distance to all the awesome arty places Montmartre has to offer, makes this small personal hotel the place to stay. Affordable rates, good breakfast, kind staff, you name it! I have recommended it to many friends and they all share my views. Plus it is in the hotel in the area of "Amelie", thus movie fans will have the chance to visit the locations where the movie was shot, such as the Cafe,where this charming character works.

Reviews.Title: “UN PLAISIR”
Reviews.Author: Davide B
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and nice staff / Very pretty and quiet hotel / Clean / Hotel in the very heart of Montmartre, close to the Butte, restaurants, brasseries and shops, and about 5 minutes from the Underground station. Beautiful atmosphere. The neighborhood is very lively and typically Parisian. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: KarenL863
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here as a base for our adventure from Feb 15th 2012. Great hotel, very close to metro station Abessess. Our room was smallish but perfect for our needs. It's also a five minute walk (if that) to the Place De Tetre where all the artists do their portraits. Also 5 minute walk to sacre Couer. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless, power shower was best I have encountered in a hotel. Housekeeping like invisible elfs, we made our beds but when we came back they were perfectly remade!! Breakfast was ample, choices were fruit, baguette, toast, yogurt, brioche, muesli and a huge variety of jams. Also cheeses and nutella by the truckload!! Hosts were very attentive. Lots of shops to wander around right on the doorstep. Plenty of choices of takeaway food also. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed a little gem”
Reviews.Author: MrsSFisher
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got it right with their mix of quality and price, excellent rooms with very comfy beds, room size was big enough with good bathroom and nice toiletries. We found the hotel to be very quiet. Our twin room which we liked was on the 6th floor with no traffic noise or noise from other guests. The lift goes to the 5th floor so the 6th wouldnâ€™t be suitable if you had any problem with steep stairs. The room was nice and warm and you could adjust the temperature of the radiators if you wanted. The free internet was really useful and worked well. The location is great for eating out at night, spoilt for choice where to eat. Metro stop Abbesses is a five minute walk . Breakfast was plentiful at 10 Euros a head. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Arts, Paris”
Reviews.Author: WUKCHWI
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for one evening, the location is excellent, close to plenty of bars, cafe's and restaurants, shops and the Metro for Blanche & Pigalle. The room was adequate for an evening however there was no air conditioning which proved to be an issue as the room was so hot in the evening it was uncomfortbale to sleep. Staff were very friendly and check in / out was good, 24 hour reception! Overall a pleasant stay and very good value for money. We did not sample the breakfast so cannot comment on this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Montmartre, less than 5 minutes from the Metro, quiet and comfortable, friendly staff who speak excellent English. Would have no hesitation recommending this place, will be staying here on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A super little find!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen M
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - close to lively streets, with shops, cafes and restaurants, but yet very quiet to sleep at night. Situated on the same street were 2 retro 1962 shops, a pleasant change from the standardised chain stores of the British high street. This typified the area... the more you explored the more you found. The hotel itself was just what was needed - the rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable and although small, we weren't looking for a mansion! We would certainly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Fozzie888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and were really impressed with the hotel, especially considering the price. The location is good - a few minutes walk from Abbesses Metro, not far from Sacre Coeur and with lots of lovely local shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel is really well presented, with a welcoming charm to it's decor. The staff are really friendly and welcoming and they speak great English if your French isn't up to scratch (understood when I asked for a plug converter!). The room was fairly small, as you'd expect in Paris, but comfortable and it was lovely to have a bath after a long day shopping and sightseeing. Lots of nice touches - nice quality shampoo etc. and a little box of chocs for Valentines Day! The breakfast was typical European - croissants, baguette, cheese, yoghurt and cereal. Overall, we had a really lovely stay, I think this hotel offers great value for money and will definitely be recommending to friends and family, and will stay here again ourselves when we go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosaleen B
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 6 Rugby fans who have been going to Paris (for more times than I can remember now) to support our Irish Team. We have stayed at this hotel many times. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Breakfast very nice. Staff very helpful and friendly. Very well located for sight seeing. Metro station close. Would reccomend highly. We'll be back (hopefully one day we'll win a match)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tangerinedreams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is warm and welcoming and in a great location. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. The reception staff are really helpful. We had a great time and would recommend the hotel but would probably rent an apartment next time we visit Paris - we prefer a little more space! If you're an Amelie fan, the CafÃ© Ã  Deux Moulins is about a minute's walk away. We had breakfast there. Such fun!

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Present, topped off by this great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jesslar
Reviews.Content: This was such a charming hotel, quiet, helpful and a gem in Paris. I stayed here for my 21st birthday with 6 others of my family. We ranged from 21-72 and I have to say it catered to all of our needs! Breakfast was lovely, rooms were exceptionally clean and the view from the room of the Eiffel Tower in the distance topped it off for me. I would like to thank the reception staff for being ever so helpful, with any need that we had during our stay, and I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey22
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 3 nights for a birthday trip. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the rooms were warm and cosy which was welcome as it was absolutely freezing in Paris while we were there. The staff on Reception were very nice and friendly. Room and bathroom were small but fine for a short stay. We stayed in Room 63 on the top floor and could see the Eiffel Tower from our window. It was a bit noisy at night as you could hear people going in and out of other rooms. Breakfast was limited, mostly croissants and jam, bread and yoghurts but what was there was nice. It would be nice to have a hot drinks machine in Reception. We got the train from the airport to Gare du Nord and then two short metro journeys, getting off at Blanche with a 2 min walk up the street to the hotel. Hotel close to Sacre Coeur and some nice little shops on the way up the hill. Would recommend the Basilic restaurant in Montmarte but it's also definitely worth a visit to la Relais d'Isle on the Ile St Louis. We went for lunch after visiting Notre Dame and it's definitely worth its rating on Trip Advisor. Plenty of places to eat around the hotel though if you don't want to venture too far afield. All in all a good choice for a short break that won't break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: elgladdo
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was just what I have been looknig for. I took my partner for a romantic break and this was the perfect place to stay. The hotel is in a cute little side street just off the main street in the montmarte area, so it's near to lots of eateries, shops, cafes where you can sit outside and have a drink and people watch. Its a 3-5 minute walk from two metro stations. Absesses or Blanche. To get from the airport I would recommened going to Absesses station from the airport, theres 2 changes but it is so easy to walk to the hotel from there. If you go to Blanche you have to walk uphill to the hotel which would be a bit of a nightmare with a suitcase. We used the metro to get around all the sights-it was really easy. The rooms in the hotel are pretty small but lovely and clean. They all have a bathroom, but only a bath with a handheld shower which was one of the downsides for me. We were in room 63 on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The lift goes up to level 5,and a staircase to level 6. There were little shower products in the bathroom which was a nice touch. No tea/coffee making facilites in the room. We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel, but only because there were so many nice little places in the area to eat. Theres a great little bar up the street from the hotel, just on the corner (forgot the name) but its a great tiny place with a fab atmosphere. I'd also recommend a great Italian called La Caratello - the hotel can book it for you and its only a 3 minute walk away. I will definitely return to this hotel, we loved it, loved the location and it was excellent value. If you go on their own website, email them to get a rate and quote "tripadvisor" and you'll get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “A valued for money hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarySY
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, nicely decorated, and the room space was acceptable for a hotel in Paris. The staff was friendly, free wifi and pc in the reception for common use. And the location is good. Not in the touritsic part of Montmarte. I very much enjoyed my stay there. I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonorn
Reviews.Content: great little hotel in a quiet street. the room was bigger than i expected (relatively small but i was lead to believe that all rooms in paris were tiny), clean, tidy and with a nice bathroom, it had everything we needed, although i never did work out how to connect to the wifi. we didnt have breakfast in the hotel as there were lots of lovely places to eat nearby, but i thought the price for the rooms was great. Monmartre is a great area, with lots of cafes, bars, lovely food shops etc and a great friendly armosphere. Its very close to the slightly more seedy red light district but that is easily avoided. About 6-7 mins on the metro to arc de triumph and then you are in walking distance from all that central paris has to offer. we had an amazing trip with the hotel des artes as our base, we would love to visit paris again soon and will stay at this hotel when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_White
Reviews.Content: The owners have got the mix right. The rooms are compact, but comfortable and everything just works. Nice staff too.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadwith4
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel; quite, but surrounded by lots! Just before Christmas our group, 2 families that included 9 people spent 3 days at this hotel. It was a wonderful experience for our 5 teenagers; the ability to wonder around the area shopping (cheap), eating (reasonable) and feeling the pace of Paris. The hotel breakfast was good by European standards. The hotel staff was multi lingual and very helpful calling taxis for our many trips. Comfortable beds and lovely bath toiletries made this a wonderful experience. Small rooms but that's Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brucetupholme
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this delightful hotel while on a short mini vacation , business and concert to see the famous Portuguese Fado singer , Katia Guerreiro , at the Olympia Theatre Hall . Very friendly , multi-lingual staff , well located , adequate continental breakfast , small rooms but comfortable and nice products in the bathroom . Only fault in our room was it was dimly lit , so maybe something could be done about this as it was hard to see . I take my business with me when I travel via my laptop , so the free WiFi was terrific , since I am used to paying for it wherever else I travel in Europe . It is ideally situated in romantic Montmarte and I will certainly return here on my next trip to Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “In a great Montmartre location...”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in January 2012. Everything was good or alright at this hotel, our only real disappointment was that we weren't given a room with a view (that I asked for in advance and really hoped for) and the stone cold "welcome" from a curt and indifferent young lady at reception. Hotel is situated in a lovely part of Montmartre, among picturesque streets, an array of nice shops and eateries and a short walk to 2 metro stations/lines. Market street rue Lepic and lively rue and place des Abbesses were a joy to be near. Even when returning well past midnight, there were always people around and the area felt very safe. Our third floor twin room was clean, with nice silky curtains and matching bedspreads, a good size closet/wardrobe, flat-screen TV, small desk, free WiFi (that worked well), small in-room safe and a single window that faced a tiny courtyard -- hence no view or daylight. Bathroom was cramped but very clean and stocked with good toiletries. Breakfast is served in a small, tidy room in the basement, from 7am. I did not like the coffee. Food was okay -- the sort of bread and croissants that French supermarkets sell. Nearby bakeries offer much tastier treats (Les Petits Mitrons on rue Lepic and Le Grenier a Pain Abbesses are a couple of favorites). Charming Coquelicot bakery/restaurant, at 24 rue des Abbesses, serves breakfast and has some tables outside too. There is a rule of no eating in rooms at this hotel, instead, an electric kettle would have been nice... But all in all, considering the great location, it's very good value if you can get their lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “A great little gem”
Reviews.Author: Angela200111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. My choice of hotel was based on previous reviews and generally I thought that they were apt. We had a twin room on the 6th floor facing the courtyard and found that it was extremely quiet. Nor did we experience any noise from fellow guests. The room was warm and clean with clean linen and very good lighting by the bed which is always a bugbear when it is impossible to read in bed. We thought that the breakfast was good value for 10 e. Paris has now become very expensive for a traveller on sterling. The setting was great. Our walk to the hotel up rue Lepic was a fantastic reacquaintance with day to day shopping in Paris. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: linda636
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel smart and friendly with a good atmosphere, ideal for artists square and monmatre, rooms were quaint and comfortable, warm staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, I strongly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: migliaribasso
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor of the city and an enthusiast of Montmartre in particular, I can only say praises to this cosy hotel, well-situated on the bohemian and picturesque neighborhood. Rooms are warm, decorated with very good taste, and so are the common areas of the hotel (lobby, reading room and breakfast lounge). The staff was always very helpful and friendly. I'm certainly coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Arts review”
Reviews.Author: ohwhatahoot
Reviews.Content: Lovely quiet street, pretty facade, smart and clean lobby/reception, lift and stairs, friendly and polite staff without being overly friendly. Room was smart, clean and odour free! Location is great, CafÃ©'s and restaurants are on the door-step but the area is not noisy! Would happily return for another stay! David

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel - so close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Orangerinnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Des Arts twice and loved everything about it. It was so close to all the things I wanted to do and I found it extremely easy to get around. Also there are some wonderful bars and restaurants at your doorstep. At the top of the street is a great little bar / restaurant with a wonderful view of the city - great place to sit with a glass or 2 and just watch the world go by. Moulin Rouge is just down the road - lots of things to see just walking around the streets I am heading back to Paris in July this year and will be staying with them again. The staff were extremely helpful in pointing us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming hotel on Montmartre and well located!”
Reviews.Author: dgcourriel
Reviews.Content: I found this little charming hotel by chance (through a friend's recommendation) and I was surprised by the interior beauty of this hotel. Do not be deceived by this small hotel, the appearance is misleading, but this is actually a 50 room-hotel hidden on Montmartre. I have visited many small charming hotels in Paris but so far this is one of the best small hotels I have seen so far in Paris (if we compared it to the quality/price ratio). Its bathroom impressed me the most, usually you would expect the bathroom to be small for this kind of hotel, it is well equipped. Room is compact, with a comfortable double-bed but well decorated and clean. Room is equipped with WiFi but downstairs near the entrance is a small 'salon' with armchairs, a jukebox, books and magazines and most of all... a PC connected to the internet, free for all hotel guests to use. Breakfast is decent, better than most small hotels I have tried in Paris or Spain. One thing unusual is, the hotel reception lends an Apple iPad for 2 hours, free-of-charge, to its hotel guest. All the restaurants, grocery shops, shops, tourist-sites, banks, post office, bars and metro/bus stations are within walking distance of the hotel. This hotel is ideal if you have less than 5 days to cover Paris because everything is already on Montmartre! This hotel is perfect for a family, a couple or the usual business traveler. It has that 'Parisian-Montmartre' atmosphere in it!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant little find”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay F
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Lonely Planet guide and it was a great little find. Situated in a fabulous area of Paris, the area makes it all worth while. With a metro stop just 1 minute around the corner and lots of wonderful bars close bar you would never be bored with this area. The room was a little smaller than i thought it would be but it was cosy and very clean. When i take a trip back to Paris i will stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A good second stay”
Reviews.Author: triplover25
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this property and we spent 5 days over Christmas here. I would say that the location is good, the value for dollar is good, but this time it was a lot louder than the last time we stayed. We were woken up the first morning by housekeeping knocking and asking if we were in the room. I find this strange as you have to leave your key at the front desk when you go out so housekeeping should know you are still in if the key is there. The third night we had very loud neighbours that were in and out all night until 4:30am and it sounded like they were in our room as the soundproofing is not great. We were then in turn woken up not once but twice by housekeeping again. Not sure why they came back the second time. All in all the stay was good, but based on the level of noise we may possibly be looking for alternate accommodation next time we visit Paris. Every time someone goes past your door or talks or shuts a door on your floor you hear it. I would be happy to pay a little more to sleep better. As a suggestion to the hotel, you may want to get do not disturb signs for the doors so that guests can sleep in if they want without being disturbed by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Joao_12
Reviews.Content: Really nice room, lobby and crew. The room is a little bit tight, but extremely clean and very well set up. The location is perfect, right in the middle of Montmartre, in walking distance from SacrÃ©-Coeur and Moulin Rouge. 2 metro stations very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SparkyMarky62
Reviews.Content: Went for the superior room which was spotless and of a good size. Located in superb area with plenty of eating choices nearby This was recomended to us by a friend and I would have no hesitation doing likewise. Hopefully will be back, since it had taken me 50 years to get to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis P
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here in Feb 2011. I was a little dubious having read some damning reviews but am pleased to say it was absolutely fine. A well aportioned room (small but no surprise) room and a spotless bathroom. You are not allowed to take food or drink to your room which was a litle off putting. I guess this is to try and get you to take the offered breakfast. We did not and found countless cafe nearby for a more trasditional breakfast. We also bought a kettle so we could have our morning coffee in bed - it's a holiday after all. On the whole, a great hotel in a great area. We will return this year.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel - best for couples!”
Reviews.Author: Mvk422
Reviews.Content: This room was really small, but incredible romantic and everything we were looking for. It was mostly just a small room with a comfortable bed, and a small, clean bathroom with nice products. There was a cute window with a beautiful view of the Eiffel tower and the Paris rooftops. We liked our stay a lot! Didn't eat at the restaurant, but saw it and it looked nice. The neighborhood is excellent too. We stayed in Paris for a week afterward in an apartment and we missed the neighborhood around this hotel! I'd definitely recommend this to another couple -- I heard families around the hotel, but I think it would be best for a romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Eckaslike W
Reviews.Content: This nice little hotel is tucked away just off the main Rue Des Abbesse and, as a consquence, is slightly isolated from the main streetâ€™s constant hustle and bustle. Our Double Superior was on the top floor as far away from the noise as possible but it was still too noisy all night to leave the window open (although it was OK with the window closed). Mind you, we live in the middle of the French countryside so are accustomed to near silence at night. The room was fine, the tiny bathroom well finished, perfectly functional and spotlessly clean. The free wi-fi access was handy too and the staff were pleasant, helpful and spoke perfect English for those challenged by the language. The only down-side is the hotel breakfast; don't bother - you'll get a better deal and a significantly better breakfast elsewhere, try the bakery close to the Abbesse metro for a wide selection of pastries or cooked fare with freshly squeezed orange juice and lashings of fresh coffee. Montmatre is a lovely area; by far the liveliest and most interesting residential part of Paris that we've seen. There is no shortage of excellent, if expensive, restaurants and the tiny 'Le Vierge Lepic' on Rue Lepic is very handy (less than 5 mins. walk from the hotel), has a lovely atmosphere and serves fantastic & authentic French rustic cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Large room with balcony in popular area? Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: auntie_zeena
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here over Christmas. Room 42 must be one of the nicest rooms in the hotel - it was large enough to have room to stretch out, had two sets of French doors leading to a small balcony overlooking a quiet street, and everything was clean and spotless. Easy walking distance to two metros, with lots of little bistros, shops, and stores nearby to explore. The staff was always very friendly and the breakfast was just what we needed (croissants and other small pastries, lots of fresh bread, yogurt, juices, hard-boiled eggs, jam and cheese). My only wish was that they would have had some fresh fruit with the breakfast as well, but that was easily purchased on the street. Would definitely return, and always ask for the same room (or at least one facing the front of the hotel) again!

Reviews.Title: “In a city of overpriced rooms, this hotel is a bargain gem!”
Reviews.Author: T O
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Des Arts and I couldn't have been happier. A friendly staff and clean, tastefully decorated rooms make this place a charmer. Located in the very fun area of Montmartre with 2 different metro stations within easy walking distance, this is an excellent base for your Paris visit. The hotel has an elevator to help getting your purchase laden bags up to the room. Highly recommend. Hotel is a short walk to the Moulin Rouge (I'd skip this) and an easy walk to Basilique du Sacre Coeur (definitely visit here - the view of Paris is stunning).

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: Lepetitbelge
Reviews.Content: Great price/quality-ratio, splendid location, good bed, nice breakfast, we love the interior and the room names. One tiny remark: bathroom door hinges made a hell of a noise, which makes it impossible to go to the toilet at night without waking your partner. And when your neighbour arrives, it sounds just as if he is turning the key of yoÃºr door, which is a bit scary. But we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosners
Reviews.Content: Really charming hotel in the midst of Monmartre. Rooms aren't enormous, but not bad size for Paris. Very clean with good bathroom. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely want to return. Like the juke-box in the lobby. Only criticism was that there wasn't enough light to read in the room (only in the bathroom)!

Reviews.Title: “Just behind the Moulin Rouge, a professional tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Acer sed justus
Reviews.Content: A clean, quiet and smartly furnished 3* hotel, 5 mins from the Moulin Rouge. Staying alone, I found it, surprisingly, a little bit impersonal. (Wondered how long I'd have to stay not to be asked at breakfast what my room number was; more than six days it seems!) Objectively, though, an establishment it's hard to reproach.

Reviews.Title: “Montmartre gem”
Reviews.Author: ChiliGirl
Reviews.Content: I loved this little gem of a boutique hotel. Clean, modern rooms, large bathroom and fantastic shower with good lighting! When does that ever happen in Paris? My room was off a small outdoor courtyard, so was like a little cabin - very cute. Very good breakfast - I agree with the other reviewer that for 10E it's a good deal. The neighborhood of the hotel is exactly that - a real neighborhood with boulangeries, fruit and fish markets, children going to school in the morning plus all the things that tourists need: lots of restaurants, easy access to the Abbesses Metro, and interesting shops. I would definitely return to Hotel des Arts and Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsJol
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as we wanted to stay in the 'village' of Montmatre and had good Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel was clean and staff welcoming and spoke excellent English. The buffet breakfast was indeed excellent and provided a great start to the day. Numerous bistros/bars within just a few minutes walk - see some recent reviews and with Metro stations within easy walk access to central Paris very convenient. We had a standard room which was on the small side and at the front of the hotel which could be noisy in the morning - we always travel with ear plugs so not an issue. Very comfortable bed though despite some other comments. All in all good value and great location

Reviews.Title: “A very good solution at the expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: Antonios F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Des Arts for 5 nights. We asked for a better room with view, because the first was a bit depressing. They finally gave us a room in the 6th floor, with a kind of view.We gave them the trip advisor promo, but i didnt finally understand if the last room was the superior. Our room was a good size and a clean. The only comment: put a curtain or a glass in the bathroom!!! After every use, it was a mess! Service was very good and helpfull, kind and funny. The breakfast could have been better, with bigger variety. After the 2nd day, was a little boring to eat the same things...The location was great-Montmartre is fantastic for the winter walks- and very close to the metro stations. Overall: a very nice, honest, clean and good experience. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great place to experience Parisian culture”
Reviews.Author: nielka8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Des Arts for 6 nights in October. We managed to get upgraded to the superior room after mentioning the trip advisor promo. Our room was a pretty good size with good storage and a clean updated bathroom. Overall service was good, breakfast was expensive at the hotel because of small selection. We recommend the bakeries down Rue De Abbesses where you can get freshly baked pastries for under 2 euros. The area was nice during the day but got a bit scary during the night. Location was good close to two metro stations. The hotel was supposed to book us for a private shuttle to the airport but there was a mix up and provided us a taxi instead, which was far more expensive than what we were supposed to pay for the shuttle. Overall a great stay to experience authentic Parisian culture. Would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordonberkhamsted
Reviews.Content: Having come here to stay in 2008 we returned to find standard even better and much enjoyed ourselves. Breakfast at Euro 10 actually good value. Hotel is in ideal location near the Metro. Ate at Le Durer resturant beyond Abbesses Metro it was good as 2008. Go hungry. We will come back. Gordon Bluck

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacey1690
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Des Arts for 3 nights on the 20th November. The hotel is in a great location, minutes from 3 metro stations and a 2 minute walk to the Moulin Rouge. It has a very homely feel, rooms are small but it's all we needed for our short stay. It has free Wifi & use of an ipad from the reception :) Rooms have tv's with some english channels. Breakfast was basic as expected when in France. Hotel staff were really helpful, they even booked us a taxi to the airport for 17euros to save us getting the metro with our luggage. I would advise using the metro for most journeys as it's only 1.30euros to get about. We made the mistake of booking the tour bus which was good but it cost 32euro & so not worth it. Be aware round the montemarte area as a pick pocket stole my iphone however I managed to recover it ! Eiffel tower is a must, we walked it for 3euros! Be aware of people following you on the champs-elysee, it was rather scary for 2 21 year old girls but we tried not to let it bother us too much. All in all the hotel was fab & paris was a great place for a city break! Disneyland was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “nice charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We, as a couple, stayed in this hotel end of November. Well located, good breakfast, nice rooms, very good wifi signal in the rooms. We would reccomend it and book it again,

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel, will book again!”
Reviews.Author: munchener_studentin
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Arts is a little hotel with 65 rooms. OUR ROOM: We got to stay in room 60, it is on the last floor, bigger than the others on that floor. When you look out the window, you can see the Eifel Tower. The bathroom is not small at all, and in the room there is more than enough place for all your stuff. To get to the room you can use the elevator to the 5th floor and than go up the stairs once more. The room was really clean, the cleaning lady visited every day. It was very quiet, the bed was comfy. THE HOTEL: The hotel stuff is very friendly. All walls have pretty pictures. The atmosphere is really artistic and cosy. BREAKFAST: We didn't get breakfast at the hotel, because there are so many amazing bakeries around. We loved getting our breakfast from "Le Grenier a Pain" (http://www.legrenierapain.com/en/) - a price winning bakery, 1 min. walking from the hotel, normal prices. THE NEIGHBOURHOOD: Really cool, so much things to see, all in walking distance. It is also close to the city - a taxi at 3 am in the night from Champs-Elysees costet 8,50â‚¬. TIPPS: Stay at this hotel, get breakfast "to go" from a bakery nearby and go to Sacre Coer to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CaroServigna
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this beautiful boutique hotel in Montematre, a couple of blocks from Mouling Rouge. The hotel is comfortable, beautifully decorated and the service is fantastic. Breakfast is included and it consisted of fresh croissants, bread, pastries, cereal, jam, cheeses and spreads, nutella, juices and coffe, yogurt. Small but nice breakfast space. The bedroom was small with space only for a double bed and a desk, but it was very comfortable and with all you might need including a safe box, extra covers and tv. Only negative is that it had no AC which its not needed in November because its cold but you need to open a window which allows for noise from the outside. We had a view of the Eiffel tower from our room. The bathroom had a hand shower which made it a bit difficult to bathe, it has hot water and the bathtub is big. We only got one soap bar, but they also had shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower gel. The staff is available and courteous all the time. They arranged pickup from the hotel to the airport and kept our luggage after our check out so we could go sightseeing. Wifi: free!! Location: two blocks from a metro station from which you have access to the city. Close to Moulin Rouge and lots of cafes, pattisseries, creperies and small markets. Le Chinon cafe is three blocks away from the hotel, it has excellent food and service. This is a great place to stay while visiting Paris. I strongly recommend it and will definitively stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris”
Reviews.Author: Joyce L
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel des Arts in Paris - excellent location - within walking distance of the butte Montmartre and 3 metro stations. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable - my only complaint - not such great beds! Good thing we didn't go to Paris to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Gaille F
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my husband from 15th-19th Nov for my 50th in room 54 and it was all wonderful.Couldn't have picked a nicer hotel.Clean,homely,cosy,friendly staff,great choice at breakfast,and in a lovely dreamy part of Paris.Montmartre and Hotel des Arts isn't even too far away from the more modern south side of the river if you don't mind walking.We never used ANY public transport at all.We walked from the hotel southward towards the river taking in all the sights on the way.It took us 3 hours to walk to the Eiffel Tower but that was only because we stopped to take photos en route,Had a coffee in Tuilleries garden,then bit of lunch near the tower.After going to the top of the tower we walked back to the hotel in 1hour 20 taking in the sights.Will definitely be going back to this Hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, friendly hotel in the wonderful Montmartre!”
Reviews.Author: Caithoven
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in the Hotel Des Arts last week for the second time. The location is great, being close to both Blanche and Abbesses metro station and also many bars and cafes, yet as it is located down a quieter street it is not noisy. Our room was a good size and had a great view over the rooftops. The bathroom was very clean and the toiletries are such good quality for a hotel. The hotel's decor is very cosy and I especially like the painted lift. The staff are friendly and helpful. There really isn't one negative I have to say about this hotel and I wouldn't think about staying anywhere else for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: Staying here this weekend but have just looked for directions to the hotel and the hotel is nowhere near where the map states. We're much further out than the map shows...a good 4km away from where they suggest the hotel is. Very disappointed in Trip Advisor and whoever has created the map on the account/

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viclasalle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself in October and loved the hotel and the area. I felt totally safe even walking around before light in the morning, which is a wonderful time to see the interesting surroundings without lots of people. The location is wonderful and the hotel was very clean and well kept. Staff were very pleasant. I hope to come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gabby b
Reviews.Content: I love this small hotel in a great area near Montmartre.The location is great - a bit away from the main touristy area,but with lots of excellent cafes, shops and places to explore in the immediate area. I was upgrade to a lovely room on the 2nd floor, ( because I quoted tripadvisor), with a great sized bathroom , lots of wardrobe space and a good room. As with most Paris hotel rooms, it wasn't big, but perfect for my needs. The hotel is friendly and a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “well located”
Reviews.Author: BallyclareLeonardo
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Jan 2011. Staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel was well located in monmartre. Our room was on the small side but was perfectly suitable for the two of us. Breakfasts were good. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Shane R
Reviews.Content: What an excellent find, this hotel provide everything my wife and I wanted. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. The location is perfect the Metro only a short walk away, more cafes than you can ever ask for. The room was comfortable, quiet and clean. The view from the balcony at night over the rooftops, not quite high enough to see the Eiffle Tower, but very picturesque. If you want to stay in Paris in a small friendly hotel I would highly recommend this one?

Reviews.Title: “anniversary stay!”
Reviews.Author: bennec
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay at this small and beautiful hotel. We had a superior room with views across the roof tops of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. Delightful at the beginning and end of the day to open the window and take in the panorama. Breakfast good with plenty of choices and always replenished. Staff on reception always pleasant and helpful , following a minor injury we were given advice on the nearest hospital.and a taxi called. Bedrooms are small as they are in most Paris hotels but there is everything that you need. Location great and within easy reach of metro to reach Paris tourist sites.. Montmartre is a lovely area to ramble around in the evening with a range of bars and eateries. The sun shone on us for 3 days adding to our enjoyable stay. Hope to return again soon. This was our 9th visit to Paris and cant wait for our 10th!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Alex P
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel in a quiet street but very close to the Metro station Abbesses(and others). Everything was clean and comfortable. Breakfast is generous and very good. From the top floor there are good views, including the Eiffel Tower (if you are facing the right way). Customer service was good and friendly. Emails were answered promptly. On the downside, the free wifi signal was sometimes rather weak, but that is not a great criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: RobinBennett
Reviews.Content: Just a 20 minute walk from Gare du Nord, this lovely little hotel has the perfect location. Just around the corner are bars, cafes, restaurants, gorgeous food shops and galleries. The Moulin Rouge is 5 minutes away and so is the Sacre Coeur. Yes, the breakfast is basic but it is included in the price and is perfectly serviceable. Staff were lovely and our first floor room was big enough and nicely furnished and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: Des Arts is tucked away in the Montmartre neighborhood to the north of Paris. You're walking distance to the Metro though and it's very easy to get to all the major sights of the city. Montmartre itself is a very Bohemian neighborhood. This is where famous artists such as Van Gogh and Toulouse-Lautrec lived and worked. That artistic vibe is still present today. Be sure to take a walk (uphill) to Sacre Coeur. The rooms are comfortable and modern. The staff is very friendly. For American travelers, all of the staff we met spoke English and was very polite about it. The only downside is that the area is very hilly, so not a great choice for anyone who has trouble getting around. If you're not the type of person that takes the stairs, you might get annoyed by much climbing you have to do in Montmartre!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful 5-day Stay”
Reviews.Author: LandBP4344
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in in France. The room was wonderfully clean and quiet, compact and well decorated with a very comfortable bed.. We were on the 5th floor. When you opened the double sound proof window and looked out from our 5th floor room we could see the Eiffel Tower in the distance. It was wonderful in the evening to lean out and see the tower sparkling or with its search light panning Paris. We would wake up and open the window and we could smell fresh baked buns from outside. Below the window was a tiled patio. Our room was called "Henri Landier" each room is named after an artist. The bathroom was really nice with shampoo/bath gel/conditioner/hand lotion,hair dryer and even a zip lock bag to take home your unused soap. The doors of the elevators on all 5 floors had wonderful paintings of famous artists covering the entire door and a delightful 5 floor spiral stair case if you didn't want to take the elevator. The art on the walls throughout the 6 floors was wonderful (elevator goes to 5th floor and stairs to top floor). There was a juke box on the main floor along with a computer station for use and a variety of national newspapers you could sit and read - one could even loan an I-Pad for up to 2 hours. The breakfast room was on the lower level with another winding staircase; it had a delicious continental breakfast including hard boiled eggs, a toaster along with a variety of fresh baked breads and buns, individual glass jars of jam, yogurt, cheeses and cereals along with milk, juice, coffee, teas and hot chocolate. The staff were continually cleaning the breakfast room and replenishing the food. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and spoke very good english. The hotel is just a few steps from the main street of shops and restaurants and within close walking distance of 3 different Metro stations. My husband and I enjoyed the hotel and the surroundings and Paris very much.

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2 day break”
Reviews.Author: MayofanLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel very close to everything. It is only 4 stops (Blanche) on the Metro from the Gare du Nord, with one change. It is very clean and service friendly. The breakfast is continental and will easily fill you up for a long days' walking and sightseeing (Tip:Get 1/2/3/5 day travel cards at GDN Metro station on arrival). The hotel is clean and relaxed and like everywhere the lift is typically small and takes two people. Our room was on the sixth floor, with a good view and well heated, and the lift goes to the 5th so be aware if you have trouble with stairs. The bathrooms are being upgraded and ours was yet to be done, although we found it very clean and well supplied. Overall, this is a lovely hotel with helpful friendly staff and we would happily visit again..

Reviews.Title: “What a View!!”
Reviews.Author: JMacc
Reviews.Content: DELIGHTED with our third stay at this wonderful boutique hotel in fabulous Paris. Got a free room upgrade as we traveled in November and requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower on booking. The reception staff confirmed this with us at the time and then again just before our trip...and wow - what a view! Just open the windows and look to the left.... and there it is - the Eiffel Tower. Gazed at it in the morning when we wakened up and then watched it sparkle at night - what a treat. The room itself was perfect - a great size and very, very clean. I have to say that it would be really worthwhile upgrading rooms to a superior. During this trip, the reception staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The reception area is lovely and they were happy to keep our bags all day for us after we checked out. As an area, Montmartre is fab - a great base close to metro stops for exploring by day and a really good vibe at night - lots of really friendly cafes and bars around. Will definitely be back - you just can't beat Paris or the Hotel des Arts!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve6244
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Aug 11. Location is perfect for exploring Montmartre, and even better for just rolling down the hill after a good meal and a few bottles. Hotel was clean, comfortable and staff were very friendly. Decor is fun and unusual with the rooms named after artists. Our room itself was small but ok as we were only sleeping there. It was hot and stuffy. Our friends ground floor room backed onto a courtyard which meant that they didnt feel secure enough to open the windows. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. The dining room is barely big enough if the hotel is full, and we felt uncomfortable loitering around for a table. We would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: rachelrenee_80
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in Paris can be an overwhelming task! I chose Hotel Des Arts based on the very good reviews on Trip Advisor and am so pleased that I did! The hotel is located very close to both the Blanche and Abbesses line and is situated among wonderful cafes, cute boutique shops, and has very reasonable rates. Our room was extremely clean and well taken care of. We did not take great advantage of the hotel front desk staff or breakfast, but other guests seemed to be very happy with both. The rooms are small (to be expected) and I did find the two twin beds pushed together not to be the most comfortable beds I've ever stayed in, but who goes to Paris to sleep?! I definitely recommend staying in the Montmartre area in a smallish, local hotel over staying in a huge chain hotel near the more tourist-driven areas.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time and still lucky!”
Reviews.Author: mybellMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at Hotel Des Arts in 3 years and the service was just a good as previous years. This hotel is a great choice for exploring Montmartre!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: jtcg_cymru
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed in many hotels in Paris, but are aware that many hotel rooms are tiny, cramped and shabby. Not here though! Although the room was not American size, it certainly was as large as most UK hotel rooms and was beautifully clean and tidy. Bed was warm and comfortable and bathroom, though small had everything we needed with a powerful and hot shower. We had opted for superior rooms as this was a joint birthday trip for my wife and my brother-in-law who travelled with his spouse also. We were allowed to change our initial rooms on the ground floor to the 5th floor as we wanted views over Paris.(Word of warning ..the lift is tiny and will not accommodate four people + luggage!) We had a view of the street and the spire of the Sacre Coeur and our relatives could see the "shimmering" Eiffel Tower. Although the street could be a little noisy at night if the windows were open, once they were shut it was almost total silence. Breakfast was certainly adequate and worth the money. Fresh croissants, pains au chocolat and brioches to die for. Boiled eggs, cheeses and fruit salad with assorted yoghurts washed down with fresh orange juice and proper coffee and tea. Set us up ideally for the challenges Paris has to offer. The neighbourhood had everything we needed within a short walk and Montmartre at sundown is a delight!! And if you want good beer and nice food within spitting distance, climb the hill to the top and visit the bar Autour Du Moulin..- recommended especially during happy hour. If we return to Paris in the future, Hotel des Arts will be our first choice of hotel destination.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: I would say that apart from the nice rooms, nice and helpful staff and lovely atmosphere, the best thing for the Hotel Des Arts is the location....tube so close and lovely restaurants in the area.....definetely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveTheHedge
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and well finished room. There are some great places to eat within minutes of the front door and the hotel is situated near two different metro lines so it seems to be well placed for getting around Paris. Not really knowing much about Paris when looking, we picked the Hotel Des Arts based on strength of the reviews it had received and we weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Poor breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: P H
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. Friendly staff on arrival and throughout our three days. The location is everything and more than made up for the rather small room. We were in 46 which I have to say had an Ok view and was extremely quiet at night so we slept very well. I'd hate to think what it would be like in high summer though room was very hot with no AC but thankfully we could open the large window. Breakfast was nothing to get excited about very poor choice of friuts, cheese, no meats and milk was... well you know France for dairy!!! There's plenty of choice locally for petit dejuner anyway. The area around Rue Tholoze offers great choice of bars, bistros etc esp Rue de Abbesses and Rue des Martyrs and if you're into having a few beers, wines there's a couple of good edgy bars around! We had a ball I'd go back no problem. Only draw back was amount of begging around Rue Abbesses and Paris generally has gotten worse! Also CDG shuttle seems a rip off for â‚¬ 34 for 2 when metro only costs â‚¬18.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good find!”
Reviews.Author: Lenabug1101
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a beautiful area! The receptionists were all very friendly and helpful. They arranged transportation to the airport for 17 euros! That was a great help! We stayed in room 43, and my in-laws stayed in romo 23. The rooms were nice and clean with a somewhat comfortable bed. Whereas my in-laws room had a small armoir, there was a HUGE closet in our room. The bathrooms were clean and modern with a tub. The breakfast was included in the price and was a very hearty French style breakfast with croissants, pain au chocolat, baguettes, cheese, cereal etc. The breakfast room was very large and comfortable. The location was convenient as a tourist, but if you arrived with luggage and had to haul it to the hotel, it could be challenging if you had a lot and/or large pieces.

Reviews.Title: “Small Montmartre Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: new_york_paris
Reviews.Content: NYC to Paris frequent business traveler looking for new places to stay and neighborhoods to explore and this hotel was an excellent fit for that criteria. Small street convenient to metro with an excellent shopping (groceries/bread/cheese/wine) and dining street, rue Abessess, very close to the hotel. Friendly staff; clean and tidy rooms; iMac and jukebox in the lobby sitting room + a selection of daily international news papers. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little gem of a hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bernise
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old daughter, 10 year old son, myself and my husband just had a three night break in Paris and booked with BA. This hotel was a little gem, very smart, clean, friendly and an excellent location in a quiet street in Montmarte. Would recommend this hotel as a great base as close to two metro stations. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of September 2011 and we're glad we did. It is a cute location that feels so Parisian to us Angelenos. Montmartre has a great village feel to it and we loved walking around. It was a good base from which to explore the city and we had no trouble finding our way around the fantastic Metro system. The proprietors were great, always friendly and willing to help out. The breakfast was perfect to start our day in Paris. The rooms were small, but trust me when I say we've stayed in smaller in NYC. They were clean and cozy since we weren't there to stay in our room all day, they were great. A bonus for us was the resident dog, Caramel, since we were missing our pups back home!

Reviews.Title: “Paris by heart”
Reviews.Author: ole p
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 autumn nights with 2 kids - absolutely great quiet location and very orderly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Quaint Hotel in the Heart of Montmarte”
Reviews.Author: SoloTravelerDarlene
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my holiday in Paris a few extra days and chose this hotel because of price and location. I found all the staff very helpful and accomodating with all my requests. My room was small but pretty and spotlessly clean. The only negative thing was noisy hotel guests having conversations in the hallway after 11.30 in the evening. No consideration for other hotel guests. Breakfast was included and also wi-fi internet was free, unlike other hotels that were charging up to 15 Euros per hour for the same service. Would stay here again but would chose a larger room with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Barb_Romb
Reviews.Content: Good location but unfriendly staff. No airconditioning in room and our bathroom had a tub with a hose instead of a shower. The breakfast was terrible (even the coffee was bad). Some of the staff were ok but the main girl we dealt with was disinterested in being helpful. If you want to print your boarding pass, you have to email it to them and they print it for you (which can be a problem). The maid left our window open in a wind/rain storm and my luggage and some prints we bought were wet when we returned. The girl at the desk told us when we returned and said "everything is ok" and disregarded the damage. When we discovered the damage, she gave us reimbursement for 3 prints and offered the use of their dryer (which would have damaged my good clothes). They did some remodeling which is nice but I would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: lorrainececile
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are small but well organized. The sheets and towels are of high quality and the hotel is kept very clean and well maintained. You might want to pay a little extra for a room on the top floor which adds to the brightness and we have even had a view - watching the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. The staff is helpful and pleasant. The lobby has a real charm and is very pleasant to use. The area is full of wonderful small restaurants and full of life.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: shropshirelad63
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. helpful staff and a great villagey feel to the surrounding area. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “HAD AN AMAZING TIME ... LOVE THE CITY AND THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshipper183
Reviews.Content: I came here to celebrate my birthday with my mum. We were origianally booked in to their sister hotel, however they had over commited themselves and booked us in to the Hotel Des Arts... I loved it and was almost grateful when we arrived as it seemed so much nicer even on first impressions. The hotel reception desk was lovely .. really welcoming and helped me with everything i needed. The room was lovely from the decor to the cleanliness. Located just were i needed and wanted to be i had an amazing time. The breakfast was only 10 eurs each and was lovely and fresh with cereal, bread, crioissants, yoghurt, juices and coffee.. I just love it here !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and helpful team in the heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: ejwm
Reviews.Content: Finding hotels that support, help and enable your visit through the friendliness and local knowledge of the staff in a big city is a rare treat. The Hotel des Arts team did just that - both day and night. We were given advice, helped to find different interesting places and when a problem arose - they sorted it out as quickly as possible. Our room wasn't big but that was fine - it was clean, with comfy beds and extra pillows and blankets if needed. The bathroom has lots of hot water and a good shower. We were on the first floor, looking out over the front street, so there was lots of potential for noise, but we didn't find there was much. Or maybe it was because we were out til late any way enjoying Paris and particularly Montmartre to the full, with all the great local bars and cafes populated with friendly warm chatty people.

Reviews.Title: “It was quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Masato N
Reviews.Content: The view from the 6th floor room is unexpected. It is very impressive.I started painting immediately. Also, the clean room and wide bathroom are much better than other hotels in Paris, I will come back again next year and paint again around Montmartre. Welcome mini bottle champagne is also the heart warming gift.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sh1bco
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location for going out and seeing the sights. Montmartre is a fab little area with lots of lovely shops to explore and is really close to the Sacre Couer. The hotel staff are all very friendly and helped to book a restaurant for us. Our room was small but clean and very quiet with a very comfortable great and great shower. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cozy”
Reviews.Author: Peggy F
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our two nights at the Hotel des Arts in Montmartre which came at the end of a two week vacation in France, including stays in Paris (Latin Quarter), Avignon and Nice. It was lovely to be welcomed with champagne, roses and chocolate! The staff was friendly and helpful, and there was access to a computer. The room was clean and well equipped. We loved the original art work on the walls in our room and throughout the hotel. The location, as others have pointed out, is great and we liked the area better than the Left Bank/Latin Quarter. Although it was late September, it was quite warm and lack of AC was an issue, particularly as the room is very small. There was no air circulations with the window closed and with the window open some late night noise from the cafe/bar below interrupted our sleep. Our room looked west but, if one hung out the window a little, the Eiffel Tower could be seen to the left. This was a problem for a person with fear of heights! For 9.5 euros, the breakfast was very generous - I miss my pain au chocolat already! The coffee, however, was the worst we had in France. We would definitely stay here again, in the spring or fall.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: MHSG
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location to enjoy the ambiance of Montmartre with it's restaurants, bars and cobbled streets. The hotel is in a narrow side street and our first impression as we entered the small reception area was that we had found the perfect artsy Paris base for our 3 night stay. All the rooms are named after artists, the lift doors are painted with Paris scenes and there is nothing "big box" about the place. The staff who all spoke great English were helpful and informative. Our room on the 5th floor was delightful facing inwards .... Not exactly a courtyard but facing other windows and very quiet. Our friends on the 2nd floor faced the street and it was a bit noisier but quite interesting to watch the world go by. Our superior twin room with very modern bathroom was quite large enough with flat screen TV and more than adequate. The weather was unseasonably warm so it did get rather hot with no A/C and there was not the usual tea making equipment. A new twist was a plastic baggie with the invitation to take our soap and toiletries home with us. We heard some guests complain about small, noisy rooms so when booking make sure to ask which room you will be getting. The breakfast room down the spiral staircase was lovely and a very adequate breakfast was served. One problem was that it only opened at 7:00am and we left one day before that on a great trip to the Normandy Beaches. They were unwilling to give us a boxed breakfast to take with us. We found the local restaurants very atmospheric and except for one they were good value for money especially Basilic where we had a 3 course meal for 23 euros. The metro is nearby and so you can easily access all the Paris sights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect get away!”
Reviews.Author: Maeve22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Des Arts last October for our Anniversary, the location of this hotel is perfect, 5 minute walk to Moulin Rouge and 10 mins walk to Sacre Couer. It is also conveniently situated close to 2 metro stations (roughly equal distance to both). Situated just off the main rue meant it was quite peaceful but with the hustle and bustle of the bistros and bars just a stones throw away. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were a little small but with all facilities and comfortable bed. The room for breakfast is in the basement of the hotel is quite small so you may have to wait for a table - this would be the only negative I have about the hotel. Overall I found the hotel to be great value in an excellent location with friendly, helpful staff. I would have no hesitation in recommending it and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leigh H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: Very happy with Hotel Des Arts - Small, comfortable and very clean. Stayed 3 nts mid-Sept, double Superior on the 4th floor overlooking the courtyard and not overlooked by the other buildings near by. Many talk about the lack of air-con, this is not an issue outside the hot months. Nice bathroom, small bath with shower and WC. Breakfast was nice, small eating area but we always got a table around 8.30am - busier around 9.30am. Choice of cereal, breads/toast, butter/cheese, juices, tea, coffee, Danishes, yogurts, boiled eggs. Worth Â£10 per person/day for this buffet breakfast - elsewhere one drink and a Danish would cost Â£5 or so. Modern lobby and nice lounge with a cd jukebox, chilled out one evening listening to Duffy, waiting for a rain cloud to die. Would defo visit this hotel again. Montmatre: Loved it, good atmosphere, great restaurants and cafes. Abbesses metro is good to exit via the lift, but to enter you have to use a spiral staircase 100+steps... instead walk down hill to Blanche metro, outside the Moulin Rouge, easier with a suitcase. Gare du Nord: Be very careful of the nasty ticket touts trying to help (interfere) with you at the ticket machines. Buy from the Ticket Office Desk, despite the queues. We purchased a 3 day pass for travel in the 3 main zones. Sacre-Coeur... we visited from the steps at the bottom of Montmatre hill, be very careful of the illegal street traders trying to temp you with their crap. We were stopped and they were reasonably forceful - having some rough neck pressing his finger into your chest because you won't give him the time of day... had to push him away with equal force. Perhaps visit Sacre-Coeur from the top of Montmartre hill via all the nice shops and markets to avoid these nasty low lives. Note: don't promise presents to anyone, painfully expensive in Paris... Perfume in UK Â£50... will be Â£80-90 in Paris etc.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break to Paris”
Reviews.Author: moley666
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic little hotel in a great location within a few minutes walk of 2 Metro stations, the Moulin Rouge, the Sacre Coeur and fabulous little cafes. Brilliant value for money and very clean. Breakfast was generous and the staff were really friendly. Rooms are on the small side but perfect if you're going to explore the city rather than simply sit in your room and while away the hours. Couldn't recommend this highly enough and will definitely be returning for another visit without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ray4chris
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, very clean and Eco friendly, rooms small but more than adequate, breakfast room cramped otherwise we would have rated it five. Very close to plenty of restaurants and bars, half way up the hill to Montmatre .

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sarah A
Reviews.Content: The room was charming. Looking left out the window I could see the windmill made famous by Moulin Rouge. The staff was courteous and helpful. No air conditioning, but the late August weather was very pleasant. Only problem with the room was the road noise. With the windows closed, this was not an issue, but when we left the windows open the traffic was loud enough to disturb our sleep. Furnishings were comfortable and room was very clean.
