Good location for exploring Montmarte. The bathroom is lit up all night by the light from a theater right across the street. There were nice cafes nearby, but beware the cafe across the street from Sacre Coeur; I got food poisoning from the Quiche and spent the next three days in the hotel room. I'm glad the hotel room was so nice and the neighborhood was interesting enough to keep my husband entertained. Would have liked to have had a stand to put my suitcase on. There was a desk, but that was not convenient. Also, the only chair was the desk chair. Since I was sick and needed a chair to sit in, that was inconvenient and not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: akennedy_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay for two nights at the Hotel des Arts in Montmartre and would especially like to thank the hotel for their help when my wallet was stolen on the metro. The hotel is a good central position for exploring Montmartre, comfortable room, good breakfast, my husband liked the coffee. Nicely decorated, liked the paintings on the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a perfect Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: mia880
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very easy to find from Abbesses Metro Station. Room is cosy, but big enough for 2 people. Bathroom was small but was nice and clean. I found the hotel staff to be not as welcoming as other hotels, however when we needed something we got it straight away. The location is great with lots of little coffee shops and restaurants to choose from. Nice to have some tourist attractions nearby and walking to the Sacre Coeur before dinner was a nice way to end the day. The room did not have air conditioning and some nights that we were there it was pretty hot so sleeping was a bit of a struggle and had to sleep with the windows open. Overall a really great hotel for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balint_Ciara
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is in Montmartre, with easy access to the Metro and within walking distance to the Sacre-Coeur. Rooms are small but clean, if a bit outdated but worth it for the location. We didnt opt for breakfast as there are multiple boulangeries and cafes in the area for very tasty breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and will return!”
Reviews.Author: Stacerss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. Our room was clean, nice size, 6th floor, amazing view. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was amazing, quiet street close to Sacre Coeur and Metro. There was an amazing restaurant up the street called Chez Pommette, the food was delicious our server Jean-Francois was great. I would definitely return to this hotel. Thank you Hotel Des Arts for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in small hotel in excellent location of Montmarte Paris”
Reviews.Author: TrevChch
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month we had the pleasure of staying at this small hotel located in Montmarte district. The staff were very friendly & always helped us with our questions. Breakfast was excellent & dining room always tidy no doubt to very attentive work by the friendly waiter. The location was perfect for visiting the usual attractions of Montmart but what really stood out is the close proximity to excellent lcal cafes & wine bars. On calm mornings we would wake to the smell of fresh bread being baked at local boulangeries, some of which offer exceptional food! We will definitely stay at this wonderful small hotel on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: judytraveller
Reviews.Content: I was only going to Paris for 3 days and wanted to stay in Montmartre. I found this little gem on the web and when I return to Paris it will be to stay here. The location is so convenient, the room was very clean and the staff were most helpful, the rooms are named after French people, some famous and some not so famous. Also, the continental breakfast was quite substantial with a variety of cereals, breads, fruit and juices. I was traveling by myself and I felt the double room would be a bit small for 2 people. I overlooked a courtyard but I was hardly in the room and so it didn't matter. From the hotel you could walk up the hill to Sacre Coeur with a wonderful view of Paris, in the other direction a few minutes walk to the Metro. I was really very pleased with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the heart of Montmarte”
Reviews.Author: Cars2001
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed three nights in Hotel des Arts which is a boutique style hotel. Our room was located on the top level which had a beautiful view overlooking the neighbourhood of Montmarte and a clear view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was cosy, good enough for a couple, no airconditioning but this did not bother us at all. The location was great only a block away from the Metro, Sacre Coeur and the Moulin Rouge was only a few minutes walk. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby which were filled with locals - always a good sign! The breakfast was great enough to fill you for the whole day! The staff were friendly and the hotel was clean, connection to the wifi was scarce due to the volume of users but just be patient and you will get your turn. I felt like a parisian staying in this hotel stepping out onto the cobble streets and being in the heart of the vibrant culture of montmarte. Highly recommend this place we would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: Its a really cute hotel. It was clean with nice breakfasts. Staff is nice. Breakfasts are good. But I loved the location!! Go and walk around, 5 min walk up the street and you will find many nice cafes, restaurants, art shops, where you can spend a beautiful evening. From the hill you would be able to see the Eiffel tower and take nice pictures. This hotel is located in a right romantic place with nice atmosphere. 10 min bus and you are in the centre. I would recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Des Arts is a good hotel in a great location in the heart of Montmartre which is a bustling little area full of cafes and brasseries. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from the Moulin Rouge and about 10 mins walk from the Sacre Coeur. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff were very friendly. Our room was small but not really a problem for us as we were only staying for 2 nights. The room had big opening windows which was very welcome as we arrived in the middle of a mini heat wave and the room had no fan or air con! The bathroom was fine, and had a bath, shower (over the bath), wc and sink. There was also a safe in our room which was free to use. Breakfast was fresh juice and coffee (or tea), yoghurt, cereal, croissants, pain au chocolate, toast, french bread and plenty of jams, cheese or honey to choose from. We had no problem finding the hotel from the Gare Du Nord - we took the Metro Line 4 to Marcadet-Poissonniers, then changed to Line 12 and got off at Abbesses and from there it is only a few mins walk. We would certainly visit this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sgo_de
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this lovely little hotel on Montmatre. The staff were very freindly, helpful and could speak English. The room, although quite small, had all we needed including free high speed wireless internet, a little safe, a comfortable bed and was very clean. The reasonably priced breakfast was more than adequate to start a day's sightseeing on. The hotel itself is located very near the local restaurants, bars and other attractions. The nearest Metro station was only a couple of hundred meters away. If we ever go back to Paris, we would probably choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Convenient - Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Louche1864
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few minutes walking distance from both the Moulin Rouge and the Sacre Couer and is very well located with beautiful cafes and restaurants around it. The metro station is down the street next to the Moulin Rouge and will take you to all of the beautiful sites around Paris. Be aware that the rooms here are not massive, space is at a premium but the rooms are cosy enough to sleep you comfortably and allow some space to hang some clothes if necessary. We were fortunate enough to stay on the 5th floor which is up a narrow set of stairs but was worth it , as from our room we could glimpse the Eiffel Tower which is beautiful especially when it lights up at night and particularly when the light show is on at the start of the hour. Our room was very clean and the bathroom was actually quite spacious in comparison to the size of the room itself. The staff here are fantastic they are very friendly and helpful and go out of the way to assist with any enquiries that you have. Breakfast in the mornings is great with fresh juice and bread amongst other things such as croissants and jams and is a great way to start the day. I think the location of this hotel along with the friendly staff and cosy but adequate rooms make this place a winner and I`d happily recommend this place to others - although I would say it is a place more for couples then families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Handy location, close to metro station. Helpful and friendly staff. Modern and clean bathroom, comfortable firm bed and quiet in the evenings. Cosy bedroom with a window that opened out where we could even see the Eiffel Tower! We will tell our friends about this place

Reviews.Title: “A great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: paivimh
Reviews.Content: We staid here for a week in the end of May 2011. The room was a bit small but okay. The only problem was that it was near the front desk on the first floor so you could hear people coming & going and talking at night. Also we had a window to the courtyard where two rooms had entrances so it wasn't too pleasant to keep the window or curtains open. The cleaners left the window open during the day after they had cleaned and I was a bit worried about our belongings. The staff was okay, not too friendly but helped if you needed something. There was a lounge area near the front desk with tourist books & a computer you could use, which was very helpfull. I guess the hotel is a find in Paris as the price isn't as high as in many other 3 star hotels, the location is great and the rooms are clean & cosy. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but in the cafe's at Rue des Abbesses, we loved to look at the people and the shops and enjoy our breakfast with fresh croissants. The area was lively, there were loads of bars, restaurants and cafe's, narrow streets and loads of steps, many people, small shops, some bohemic feeling mixed with tourists, music and artists, students and people of all ages. The atmosphere was awesome, you could listen to live music on the corner of the streets, buy antiques on the weekend market and climb up to see maybe the best view over Paris. The subway is fast but if u have time, take the bus when you can and see the city while you go. In Paris I would recommend the Louvre when it's open late and has less queues and Arc de Triomphe at night when the sun is going down, great views! Luxembourg Gardens are perfect for a picnic & siesta and Champs Elysees is something to see. Those and some great food & wine and your trip to Paris has to be a success :)

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: JohnTaichung_Taiwan
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little place! The front desk staff strike the perfect balance of warmth and professional efficiency. The location is perfect - a bit tucked away, but two minutes walking and you're in the thick of it. We were in a room facing the street, and there was a joint down the street where the party spilled into the street at night, so beware light sleepers (it couldn't be too bad, though - my wife was only moderately bothered). The ipads that they lend at the desk are a wonderfully thoughful touch. Room breezy and light. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Cute little boutique hotel in buzzy Monmartre! we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Chablisfiend
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 26th-29th July in room 26 (double). Lovely little hotel, furnished well and quite "arty". Spotlessly clean and friendly helpful staff made this a great choice. Nice location if you like a bohemian buzz. 5 minute walk to 2 Metro stops (Blanche and Abesses). Lots of creperies, restaurants etc and near to the Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur, Place de Tertre etc. Breakfast is 10 Euros per person which may seem a bit expensive for a continental, BUT just one cup of coffee and a croissant will cost you betweeen 5-7 Euros anywhere is Paris, so the fact that this is an "eat as much as you like" style buffet made it good value. Lots to choose from, juices, cereal, yoghurt, toast, pain au chocolate, croissants, baguette, cheeses, jams, etc etc. Hotel has a (small) lift which is handy, and they are happy to store your luggage on your arrival/departure day until check in/check out. Would stay here again and would be happy to reccommend to friends. I would give this hotel a firm 9 out of 10 (and I am quite fussy!). Well done Hotel Des Arts and a big stroke for Caramel the dog! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Pammypolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was recommended by several sites and wasn't disappointed. It was in a good location in Montmartre and good value for money. My room was small but clean and comfortable. The decor is unique, much nicer to stay somewhere like this than in a hotel from a chain that all look the same. It's about 5-10 mins walk from Abbessess metro, within walking distance of Sacre Coeur and all the other shops and sights of Montmartre. Plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from too. The staff were very helpful and friendly too except for the one on the last day who didn't seem to care that my taxi didn't turn up on time even though I might miss my train. Perhaps she omitted to book it... Still this didn't detract from my stay. Breakfast was quite simple, cereals, croissants, toast, tinned fruit etc but you get what you pay for. They have a room for luggage, free internet access (if you can get on!) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JustLoveToTravel26
Reviews.Content: It was hard to find reasonable priced hotel in Paris without horrible reviews. We were happy to choose this one. We had no trouble to find the hotel from metro, after arrival we asked for room on top where u can see top of eiffel tower. Room was small but clean and not too cold for january. Montmartre has such a atmosphere. Would avoid some side street around clichy at night though. Many places to eat around. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, I like to have different things on different places at different times:) City centre was about 25-30mins by metro. If I go to Paris again would be happy to stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly situated for a girls weekend away”
Reviews.Author: maxic1
Reviews.Content: 4 of us headed to Paris for a Girls weekend... and the hotel was perfectly situated... relatively close to the Underground, to the Moulin Rouge (where we enjoyed an evening of entertainment)... not to mention the funky shops in the neighbourhood... and of course some lovely well-priced resto's! the rooms were clean and comfortable and reasonably priced.. the bathroom was pretty small (almost had to climb over the toilet to get into the shower) - but the water pressure was decent and all in all... a small room/bathroom is the least of anyones problems! Staff were friendly during check in/out... and the usage of the little lounge with pc and internet was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SamTuddy
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this wonderful hotel! The service was brilliant as was the location. Nice and close to restaurants, Moulin Rouge, trains, laundry etc... Rooms are clean, tidy and quite modern. There are no drudges in the rooms, however the staff happily stored our beverages and food in the fridge in their kitchen! I would definitely return, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, how you rate the location depends on what your looking for”
Reviews.Author: Stuart G
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff friendly, room was small and shower was pretty rubbish but then we didn't go to Paris to sit in the room and I wouldn't recommend you do either!. The hotel is in a great location for monmatre and the surrounding area - rue lepiz has great smells from the food on sale, almost impossible to walk by without buying something. However, Moulin Rouge is just round the corner and the whole red light district is not far away - that's definitely not the nicest area to wander around but if you keep to rue lepic or rue des abbesses and north of it then the area is lovely and there are plenty of restaurants, cafe's and bars that are well worth checking out, whether it's for breakfast, lunch or dinner. If your planning to walk and explore Paris I'd consider staying in the 5th, 6th or eastern side of the 7th arrondisements - it will be closer to the action, further from the red light district and when you want to come up to this side of town (which you definitely should) you can jump on the metro and wander around this area - a full day up at the montmatre and surrounding area should be enough, no real need to stay up here for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant, very clean hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: andreaR75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel des Arts for two weeks. There was an initial problem with the room we were allocated on arrival, as we had requested a double bed, but this was remedied the next day. The street was very noisy at night but the window was double glazed so this did not pose a problem for us. The decor was very pleasant and everything looked new. The breakfast was included in our package and consisted of fresh baguettes, preserves, croissants, hard boiled eggs, small packs of cheese, tinned friut salad and yoghourt, you helped yourself. Only complaint was the coffee wasnt very nice! There was always someone on reception 24 hours. Room was well soundproofed, lift was tiny! There is a lovely small cinema across the road which we went to several times. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just go there!”
Reviews.Author: babailey7
Reviews.Content: Just go there, you'll love it.....! `just don't bother looking at any other hotels in this area.. you need to star at Hotel Des Arts

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: OXOlady
Reviews.Content: After reading previous trip advisor reviews I booked this hotel for a weekend away with my husband and was totally happy with my decision. The hotel's location is absolutely perfect in amongst the hustle and bustle of Monmartre and close to lots of great restaurants and bars and about 10 mins easy stroll from two different metro stations. The hotel room was small but scrupulously clean as was the bathroom. We were located at the front of the hotel on the first floor and we kept the window open, due to the lack of air con, it was incredibly noisy but we still managed to sleep probably due to the fact we were exhausted from the miles we walked during the day! The breakfast room is tiny and compact but very efficiently run. All the staff were exceptionally friendly. A great choice for anyone that likes a bit of nightlife on their doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Everything from check-in to check-out was above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: gremil
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Des Arts and were informed that since we were staying five nights, they had moved us to a studio apartment instead of our regular double room free of charge. The desk clerk called a cab for us and told us that if we got a receipt, the hotel would reimburse us. Our apartment (the superior apartment) was 100 steps from the Sacre Coeur with an awesome view to the north. Everything about the apartment was perfect and we had everything we needed. This extra, free upgrade turned what would have been an awesome trip into the trip of a lifetime. We had even made about an hour worth of calls to the U.S. and the hotel waived the charge. A great bonus was that all of the hotel staff spoke good English and were amazingly friendly, polite and helpful. It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Lively area, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladyloretta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Couer. Interesting, lively area, with lots to see. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful, the breakfast plentiful. The room was small, good for sleeping in but not for relaxing. LGH

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Montmartre, beautiful details!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLili
Reviews.Content: We started our recent Europe vacation with a visit to Paris and through Trip Advisor we found Hotel Des Arts. Even before arriving, their staff were prompt in responding to my emails with various questions. I signed up to their FB page and it was neat to receive pictures and travel tips in anticipation to our arrival. The hotel is a small hotel, but with great attention to small details. We had chocolates, fresh roses and french toilettries. Breakfast was also very nice , the croissants are awesome. We would like to especially thank Jeremy for his great disposition and customer service as he was quick to help us solve a couple of situations that came up during the trip. The location is great, a quick walk up to Sacre Couer and a short walk down to the Moulin Rouge via Amelie`s Cafe (Deux Moulins). Will definitely return to Hotel des Arts the next time we visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, in lively Montmatre!”
Reviews.Author: ajkavanagh
Reviews.Content: Lovely little room on the 4th floor, comfortable bed, but whilst there was a shower on the bath, there wasn't anything to hang it off so we had to shower whilst crouching in the bath. Also, no tea/coffee/kettle facilities. Good breakfast options (continental, obviously)! It was also quiet which is unexpected for the middle of Paris. There is also free WiFi. Location is great, in the middle of Montmatre, with lots of CafÃ©s and restaurants locally. Just 5 mins from both Abbesses and Blanche Metro stops. Sadly no air-conditioning, but this shouldn't be a problem for most of the year - we arrived when it was (very unusally) 36C in Paris in June. Otherwise, great hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great area of paris”
Reviews.Author: marie12336
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for for 4 nights. Room was clean but small {but this is expected in Paris}.We requested a shower cubilcle in our room which we got, which was nice and powerful. We had also requested a high floor which we got. Lovely toiletries in bathroom too. The only downside to the rooms were that there was no tea/coffee facilities. Good breakfast. Internet access available in reception area free of charge. Freindly staff. Fantastic location, great local cake shops. cheeses, boutiques. Would recommend for a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"perfect location"”
Reviews.Author: Tosh46
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Perfection starting with location then staff then accommodation ideally situated just a stones throw from the moulin rouge & cafes in abundance if there was a small gripe it would be about lack of air conditioning or fan in room but in no way ruined the experience will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Clean, standard Parisian hotel. Great Montmartre location.”
Reviews.Author: Bcbunny
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great Montmartre location. It was clean, safe and quiet. The rooms were small, but this should be expected for Paris. We were unaware that the breakfast was an additional charge and ended up paying for the days we ate at the hotel when we checked out. Wifi/Internet is not offered in the hotel rooms. Contrary to what it states on some website reviews for the hotel there is no shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: marie9999
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very nice & comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. Perfect location. It is nested in a neat little neighborhood with many sidewalk cafes and small old fashioned type shops for people who live there, so you can buy cheese, bread, meat/deli a la Francaise. There was a mixup with our reservation (our mistake) so when we arrived we had been marked as a no show and the room had been booked. Alain found us another room there at the hotel for the first week and for the second week even nicer accommodations close by at the same price. Can't say enough about this place. The breakfasts are great. Bread, jam, cheese, muesli (uncooked granola - very good) and the people were really nice. There is a computer with internet access available. If you want wireless in your room you can buy an access card at reasonable rates at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel to live in”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMice
Reviews.Content: Perfect setting. This is in a great part of Paris. Top floor room had a fantastic view. Service was excellent. No request was too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaznayM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel des Arts for three nights and had a superb stay...the location was fantastic - just a couple of minute walk from the Mount with it's bustling cafes, artists and shops, as well as the impressive and enthralling Sacre Coeur. The hotel has a lovely laid back ambience about it with friendly staff and nice rooms. The added touches of lovely complimentary toiletries, a bouquet of roses and a glass of bubbly onarrival just added to our overall positive experience. The gentleman who prepares breakfast certainly has his work cut out as the dining area is quite small and busy, but he does a grand job. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend without a doubt to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel and perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: KeithHopkin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and wish we stayed longer. This was my first night in Paris ever and this as the perfect neighborhood. I would recommend Hotel Des Arts to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: RLCROBERT
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely located hotel for those wishing to walk to the Montmartre area while having the ability of hoping onto a nearby metro (Blanche) to get to the Arc de Triomphe. Everything you could need is within walking distance, with quaint restaurants, shopping, grocery store, pharmacy, pubs, AND pastry shoppes!!!! We felt very comfortable walking in the neighborhood following the 10pm mass at Sacre Coeur. The staff, at all hours, were very helpful and courteous. Our room on the 4th floor was clean and spacious enough for 2 people who spent very little time there. Breakfast options were ample enough with all the usual choices, which were always fresh. If driving, parking is at a premium. Drop your bags at the door, then go park and leave it for the lenght of your stay! Our group of 6 all agreed that we'd stay here again in an instant, both for the overall experience and it's proximity to some of the best views in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent , we like it very much”
Reviews.Author: margaquito
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well placed, near to a Metro Station, nice neighborhood. Clean and Cozy. We enjoyed our star very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location!”
Reviews.Author: ryanair5749
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other reviews & we were not disappointed. Room was small but comfortable & the bathroom completely up-to-date with a nice big tub. We had requested to be on the back side & it was quiet, as we always had the windows open. Bed was very comfortable & even had extra pillows. Staff was very helpful on how to get to & ride the Metro. Location was great for walking all over the area. Would definately recommend to anyone visiting for the first time. The breakfast was excellent & there was always plenty of food & a nice variety for every taste. Thank you for making our first trip to Paris so perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Peabot
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and it was just delightful. From the bouquet of fresh roses in our room to the perfect location and Very helpful staff, we loved it. Highly recommend this hotel, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I had the chance to stay here, thanks to Tripadviser rankings. The hotel has pluses and minuses. It's in a quiet and interesting area, very close to the Sacre Coeur. The room was nice with huge walk-in closet and modern bathroom. And was clean. Room did not have aircon or fan but could open window, which was sufficient most of the time. The one thing I don't like about this hotel is its policy that you can't eat in the room. I had remembered it vaguely reading about it in one of Tripadviser's reviews but did not consider then to be a major consideration. So before checking in, I had bought Chinese takeout. Then when I read about the hotel policy, I quickly had to leave the room and walk 3 blocks to Sacre Coeur to have the food as I was afraid it would stink the room. This is the 1st time I had to deal with this policy anywhere and I must say I don't like it. I'm not the sort of person who enjoys eating out alone and would rather have dinner in the privacy of my own hotel room. This hotel is in an area, where there's plenty of food to buy, and take back to your hotel. I honestly believe this is a major turn-off. I would definitely be able to say I would stay here again if it didn't have this policy. But I can only say I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: findingausernameisap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming and the service is first rate. We stayed in the hotel's flat on top of the hill. It was fantastic - we could hardly believe how great it was (and we travel a lot) ! The hotel is in such an awesome location, you get a feel for Paris and the wonderful Parisians. Not your run of the mill tourist experiences. Great places to eat and the Metro is so close. It was so wonderful we hated to leave! Some advice: eat at cafes on the street right below the hotel instead of up at the tourist area behind the SacrÃ©-Coeur. That area is lots of fun & you should go there, but the food is more expensive and not as good as where the locals eat.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Liselrom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights - cosy clean and comfortable room - plentiful buffet breakfast. Definitely be back - very near to metro and good selection of restaurants, shops and bars. Quiet too! Staff polite and friendly. A plus is that it was a five minute walk to Chez Toinette for evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Mature Ladies”
Reviews.Author: panncassidy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel tucked away down a side street. Staff very friendly.Very clean.Nicely different.Local area full of places to eat, near the metro. Will certainly return. PC and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Montmartre dream location, good value for money, very clean & good service”
Reviews.Author: TravelPage25
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in mid May travelling via Eorostar booking direct ourselves. Hotel has lots of character and rooms are clean, neat and tidy. Only 5 minutes walk from all the Montmartre sights. Breakfast was continental with good clean surroundings. Our room had been recently refurbished and was very nice. Hotel is on busy side street which can be noisy at night but when you have had a full day it doesn't stop you sleeping. 5 minutes walk to Metro and then 15 minutes to City Centre. Hotel staff speak good English and are very helpful. No food allowed in rooms and no hotel bar. Small lift for 4 persons max. Plenty of restuarants and bars in area. 10 minute walk to Moulin Rouge. Capatillo Italien Restuarant in Rue Audran very goos food and value for money. 5 minutes walk from hotel. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mands_carter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Paris hotels for business and this is the second time my wife and I have been for a leisure break with friends. This is a lovely 3 star hotel, but with superb friendly staff and is situated in an excellent area. There are many good bars and restaurants within easy walking distance and this are of Paris has a real village feel about it. It's jst north of the seedy Pigalle district and just south of the tourist traps of Sacre couer. This area of Mantmartre, is great. There are good Metro links within 5 to 20 minutes walk of the Hotel. The service and facilities at the hotel are very good for a 3 star (please do not expect to pay 3 star prices for 5 star luxury)... but little touches like a vase of flowers in the room and the decor make this a loevely little hotel. Breakfasts are excellent, but are also popular, so don't be upset if you have to wait a few minutes for a table to be free. All in all, I can't recommend the Hotel and the are highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdevita
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in May. We were warned that the area of Montmartre was a little seedy but that was not the case at all. The hotel is about 2 4 blocks up from the Moulin Rouge...and while the area surround the Moulin Rogue is colourful once you walk up the street to the hotel area is adorable. Small cafes and art stores littered he streets. You will have to do a lot of uphill walking if you stay in the area but it only helps justify the crepes! The hotel was about a 10 min walk to 2 metro stations that easily got you to all the major sites in Paris. The hotel itself was great. There was a computer in the lobby with free internet, the staff was very friendly and incredibly helpful. Breakfast was included for us and it was very typical European breakfast...not huge but enough to get you to lunch. The room was a nice size and very clean. Bathroom looked new and was alos nice. Just as a warning we had a tub with a hand held shower head that wasn't mounted to the wall...so showers were a little awkward. Overall a great stay...I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Small & friendly, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SoloMan_York_UK
Reviews.Content: http://www.arts-hotel-paris.com/?gclid=CI_175Sv-6gCFYFB4QodFTlgRg I chose this hotel for a romantic 3 night stay in Paris and it met all our expectations. Just an 8 euro taxi drive from Gare du Nord where the Eurostar train arrives from London, it is in the heart of Monmartre which has a village atmosphere. 50m to the rue des Abbesses with its local food & wine shops, bars and restaurants and short walk to the Sacre Coeur cathdral, passing by the Place des Abbesses with its art deco Metro station giving easy access to the main tourist sites in central Paris. A 5minute walk from the hotel is the famous Moulin Rouge cabaret theatre where we had an enjoyable, if over-priced, evening. Our 150 euro seats literally backed onto the stage; I could have touched the shoes of the dancing girls! The hotel staff were friendly and inviting and spoke good English. The hotel lift was small but served our "superiere" room (no 42) on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking the street which could become noisy at night if the windows are open. The windmill "Le Moulin de la Gallete" could be seen from the balcony. The room was adequate size for 2 people which can be unusual in Paris. Ensuite bathrrom was clean and compact. Breakfast in the basement restaurant was good where the international clients mixed. If you want a compact hotel in an atmospheric and typically Parisian location, without all the frills and their additional cost of the swankier hotels, the Hotel des Arts will more than meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Paris sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: JaneEEG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends. Always a leap of trust when booking on line but we could not have been more delighted with our find! The staff were so helpful, 24 hour staffed front desk. Ideally placed for the metro, cafes, restaurants and general sight seeing as well as being being placed in the heart of Montmartre. Slightly noisy at night but it did not cause us any real lack of sleep. We had rooms at the front of the hotel and on the 2nd floor and it was wonderful to be able to look out and see life in the street below. We cannot wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: marcpotvin
Reviews.Content: Traveling abroad is always an adventure. On-line booking makes it easy, but can also create problems. If you are planning a trip to Paris, book your stay in this hotel. Price, room quality, service & location. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: beatentrack
Reviews.Content: This is still my favourite Parisien Hotel as it is friendly, personal, clean, fairly priced and located in the (touristic but nonetheless appealing) area of Montmartre. I am hesitant recommending it as it tends to be booked out quite a lot these days!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lewis9663
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location a 2 min walk away from the metro. The staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean. If you don't like hills I would give this place a miss as there are lots of steep hills in the area. If I ever go back to Paris I will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel, perfect for mother/daughter weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: jammicrackers
Reviews.Content: What a great find. I went by reviews on trip advisor and I was not disappointed. A stunning, boutique hotel filled with character and set in a fantastic location on the cusp of montmartre, a stone's throw from sacre coeur. Less than 5 minutes walk from Blanche, Pigalle or Abesses Metro stations (don't take the stairs in Abesses!), even the street on which the hotel sits is everything you would imagine Paris to be. The rooms had an antique style, in burgundys and golds, topped off with a stunning juliette balcony overlooking the charming, quiet side street (although there is a bar right opposite which got a little loud at night). The bathroom was glimmering white, very clean, all with the expected facilities and a lovely shower. The twin room was a nice size, perfect for the two of us, not at all cramped, with two single beds. The staff were extremely friendly and highly accommodating, although there was a small slip up with a couple of the tips they gave us, one of which telling us that Versaille was open on May 1st, now if i've learnt anything from my trip to Paris, it's that nothing in France is open on May 1st, not even Versaille! We still got to see the stunning gardens though and it was a beautiful day for it. But just make sure you double check these things. If I was stretched to give one, my only complaint would be the size of the bed, a twin bed would not suit anyone over 5" (which is why my mother was perfectly comfortable, whereas me, a healthy 5"5, seemed to fall out every once in a while - although my mum did mention that the bath was a little on the small side). But for two days, after some ruthless sightseeing, sleeping or bathing was not a problem. Overall a wonderful trip, made perfect by staying at this wonderful hotel, i'm recommending it to all my friends (not the tall ones!), it really is a find and we both agreed that we'd definitely not hesitate to stay there again. I hope you choose to stay at Hotel Des Arts, and if you do, keep an eye out for the room key, I think that was my mum's highlight (the art on the elevators were mine)!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflier83
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts is just perfect for a short stay in Paris. This was my third stay there and it did not disappoint. I was always greeted with friendly staff and my room had chocolates, flowers and champagne on arrival. The room size was generous for Paris, and the condition was great. Its centrally located in one of the best and friendliest quartiers of Paris, Montmartre. i will definitely be staying here again on my next trip. K

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great location to visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: jonquigley
Reviews.Content: 5 Had 3 nights here over May Bank Holiday. Paid Â£300 each including flights, accom b&b from Manchester UK. Got RER from CDG Airport to Gare Du Nord, â‚¬8.70 each one way, a bargain particularly if you get the express. We walked from the Gare du Nord to Hotel des Arts, which was ok as we got into CDG 08.30 local. Stopped off for coffee & croissants on route. Hotel a bit tricky to find as our map was crap, but if you prefer, take the Metro from La Chapelle which is part of Gare du Nord to Blanche (just near Moulin Rouge), turn right once on ground level, head up Rue Lepic, across to Rue Theloze and you are there. Hotel very nice. Small, but clean, friendly, attentive and modern. Only criticism is via my other half who is a very light sleeper...thin walls and can be noisy if you donâ€™t keep the same hours as some of the other guests. I can sleep thru an earthquake so I canâ€™t really comment. Hairdryer in small bathroom, nice firm bed, TV with limited channels mostly European but 2 English News channels, but no tea/coffee facilities in room. Room attended everyday, breakfast is continental...juice, coffee, teas, toast, croissants, muesli, fruit, french bread, cheese, preserves, etc. 7.30 to 10 30 so more than adequate. Can be problematic getting a table to yourself unless you go down ultra early or late, but promotes conversation if you have to share a table. Met some lovely people this way. Re experiencing Paris, get a ticket on the Open Top Tour Bus. Jump on opposite the Blanche Metro station on Rue Clichy. â‚¬32 for 2 day pass; 4 different routes taking in all tourist areas of Paris; hop on, hop off where you like, spend some time, jump another bus and explore another route. A brilliant way to explore the city. Your are given headphones which you plugin with multiple languages onboard providing a running commentary of the sights and history. The Metro is fabulous, cheap and quick but you miss the vistas and commentary provided during a similar journey on the Open Tour buses. Oh, get the bus and you will get to experience the lunacy that is the Parisian traffic! There appears to be no other rule than every man for himself! Bicycles, scooters, cars, delivery vans, buses, coaches, all aiming for the same piece of road at the same time!! If you havenâ€™t experienced it, itâ€™s scary. Watch from the top of the bus while you try to claim a piece of tarmac around the Arc de Triomphe, Place de la Concorde or crossing one of the many bridges!! Food & drink was great eating out. Stay away from the frontline tourist places if on a budget; go a couple of streets back for better value. Look for "Formula" , "Fixe Pris" or "Menu" deals to keep costs down. We paid no more than â‚¬15 each plus wine for very commendable 3 course meal. Now, things to be careful of... Pigalle, Moulin Rouge area is a big red light sex shop area. In our experience itâ€™s not a problem, just another aspect of a foreign city but may offend some people. Walked past the establishments and working ladies every night on way to dinner or hotel, but not pestered...donâ€™t know if that says more about us! Sacre Coeur. If you walk thru Place du Tertre, look out for primarily pick pockets as the square is crowded with lots of brushing past/body contact. Also lots of attention from portrait/caricature painters or silhouette artists mithering for a commission...even if sat in one of the overlooking bistros you are not safe from their persistence. At the front of the Basilica, watch out for African guys trying to get you to sick a finger out for them to tie a friendship bracelet on your hand, then ask for money. A loud "Non", or some firm "Anglo Saxon" is usually enough to dissuade them. Donâ€™t be pressured. Make noise and they will leave you alone. The Louvre: Girls asking you to read and sign a clipboard for deaf and dumb charities. Again, a total scam so donâ€™t be pressurised, donâ€™t make eye contact, push the clipboard away if thrust at you and a loud "Non" will suffice. Believe me, they are neither deaf nor dumb. Gold Ring Scam: Google that one. Not experienced it personally, but be aware of it. In short Adorable City, great little hotel, excellent position for experiencing Paris, food, drink, atmosphere..10/10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pemby54
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a weekend at Des Arts, its a great central location. The hotel is really clean & the staff are very friendly. We stayed in room 2 which is close to reception & was bit noisy at times especially early morning around 06.30 (getting ready for breakfast) We would definatly stay here again but would ask for a higher floor, but overall we had a great weekend & can recommend Des Arts as a great hotel to stay in the heart of montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMRUK
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I (mum) were very pleased with our fabulously located hotel. The room, though smallish, was perfectly adequate (room 44) and quiet as it was facing the indoor courtyard; the very small bathroom had a shower cubicle (great!!) rather than a bathtub; the housekeeping was as one would wish. Our buffet breakfast was included in the price and was perfectly satisfactory. Reception staff were helpful and pleasant. We would have preferred free Wi-Fi but instead made use of the free internet connected computer in the quirky lounge. We felt that the hotel matched the (mostly) consistently high ratings on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Zorro56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts is indeed one of the Seven Wonders of Paris. My wife and I have stayed at this hotel twice. The sevice from the staff is excellent. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and Patrick (the person encharged of the cafeteria operation) makes one feel welcome and at home. The location is perfect. Moulin Rouge, the Chirch of the Sacred Heart and The Monmartre Cemetery are within walking distance. The neighborhood has plenty of attractions and wonderful cafÃ©s. Nightlife goes on forever. The metro station is close by so you can move arounf Paris quicly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Slippers79
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in a great location. Breakfast was really good, staff when very friendly and helpful. Only problem was we didn't have shower curtain and the bath was micro but the rest of the hotel easily made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jezebelkatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for five nights and had a pleasant experience. We stayed in the suzanne valadon room, can't remember the number. It was a decent size for European standards and for the price and it was clean. I didn't want to stay a chain hotel so I was happy I could find a quaint reasonably priced hotel in lovely montmartre. Apparently it is quite standard in paris to have a shower hose and tub and no shower curtain as another hotel we stayed in had the same situation. Took a little longer to shower but you get used to it. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The internet cards they provided us did work and they had a computer in the lobby. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel because there so many cafes to try near by. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Kerfill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very pleasant area of Montmartre, a short distance from the Metro station Abbesses, plenty of nice shops and cafes/restaurants nearby, and not so long but a bit steep walk to Sacre Coeur. Moulin Rouge is also nearby for those who love Cabaret's. The staff was friendly and helpful, and spoke good English. The room was a bit small but not uncomfortable. The bathroom was ok, but in my view it would be better to put in a good shower and dump the small bath. Breakfast was ok, the breakfast room was small but sufficient. We can recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No smiles from the staff”
Reviews.Author: jacka2068
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six days in this cute hotel. the decor is lovely and also in the rooms. These rooms were very small and was taxing after a while. no place to put you luggage but it did have a desk and chair as well. Internet was a problem and when one of the cards they had issued for internet access was faulty, it was hard to get a replacement. The staff, except for one, were extremely stressed and looked in pain when asked a question. The breakfast was quite OK as long as you were there early, otherwise you may not get a seat and a lot of the food would be gone. The breakfast attendant was lovely and very obliging. The rooms were cleaned daily and apart from the stains on the floor very very clean. The bathroom was fine for a bath but had a hand held shower and no screen so a regular shower was hard and drenched the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “small, clean, staff friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: katielulu
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, staff very friendly, could have had a little more variety for the breakfasts but was adequate. near to metro & good restaurants, would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location - pity about the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: WetherbyLady
Reviews.Content: The location is great and within walking distance of all local attractions. However the bathroom (room53) is minute! It was not possible to sit on the toilet "normally" as the toilet was too close to the bath. The bath was so small it was difficult to get into and out of to use the (hand held) shower. The breakfast arrangements also left a lot to be desired. There were not enough tables to accommodate the number of guests and we had to queue and wait for a table to become available. The menu choice was limited and on one day the hard boiled eggs ran out and no more were forthcoming. Only 1 person laying and clearing tables proved too much work for 1. That said the hotel was clean and the reception staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very pleasant area of Mon Matre, just a few minutes walk from The nearest Metro station, plenty of nice shops and cafes nearby, and perhaps 10 minutes walk to Sacre Cour. It is also just a few minutes walk from Moulin Rouge and close to theatres along the same main road, but well removed from the slightly seedy sex shops and shows near Moulin Rouge. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, with excellent English. The room was small but comfortable, well appointed and cleaned well daily. I personally prefer a slightly less firm bed and would have liked a usable shower rather than just a bath with shower attachment (but no shower screen), but these are very minor niggles. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food, grabbing breakfast at convenient cafes instead. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Smiffy21
Reviews.Content: My niece ( 24, 1st visit to Paris) and I (50, 2nd visit) chose the hotel after reading 'Tripadvisor' reviews and seeing photos on the site,we were not disappointed. We loved the cosy entrance and lounge with jukebox,the Montmatre themed lift doors and old leather chairs and magazines on each landing. Our room (twin) was of a good size,compared to others I've experienced in Europe. Clean and comfotable. The bathroom too was well sized. The hand held shower and lack of a shower curtain was expected due to previous reviews and a bit of a nuisance.There were 3 mirrors including a full length on the door,one in the actual bed room would have been useful. Our room didn't have a view,would have been nice, but it didn't spoil our stay. Despite being next to the lift we were not disturbed by noise from the lift or people using it.We slept soundly with the window open,no problem with noise there either. Breakfast saw a good selection of continental breakfast foods.Did get a bit busy around 8.30, but we were on our way by that time and eating was relaxed. The staff were very friendly and helpful The hotel's location was perfect. Close to the bustle of Montmatre, but peaceful at night. Lots of restaurants to chose from! We dined at two reached by turning right at the bottom of Rue Tholoze,' Zebre Of Montmatre' and 'Le Basilic'. The other was 'Le Templier' left at the bottom,along past Abbesses Metro, on the right side of the street. There is also a Crepe/Sandwich bar just across the road at the bottom of Tholoze with a delicious selection of bagettes,sandwiches,wraps,crepes! A walk up Tholoze from takes you to Place du Tertre and Sacre Coeur.Down Tholoze and on down Rue Lepic takes you to the Pigalle,yes a bit seedy, but The Moulin Rouge is there to be seen or visited.To the left at bottom of Tholoze are restaurants,bars,cafes,food shops,Metro Abbesses station and on to a warren of streets with a myriad of unusual clothes,gift shops and galleries. To the right at the bottom of Tholoze, the road divides.Right, more cafes and shops and right at the end and to the left, Montmartre Cemetery-atmospheric and interesting for a stroll-honest! The right fork? I don't know,we didn't have time,but we will be back to stay at 'Hotel des Arts' and explore it hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “All in all a pleasant hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Mr-M-Gascoigne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Des Arts with my wife for our anniversary this March and was initially a bit unimpressed with the area/road that the hotel was situated on having walked up from the metro station in the red light district which is a bit grotty looking in the day time for your first impression of Paris. Although, if walking out of the hotel in the other direction the idyllic beautiful streets of Montmartre and the Sacre Coeur are just a few minutes away which was great. The proximity of the metro stations was very handy when zooming off around the City to see the sights. The hotel and room itself was very clean and equipped with a television although a couple more international channels and some drink making facilities would have been nice. The room was quite small but enough for what we needed and the bathroom was clean and well equiped, all but the lack of shower (bath only). Reception staff were very friendly and the service was great. Unfortuantely our breakfast experience was a hit hectic, they were quite disorganised with only one member of staff looking after the whole breakfast with tables not being cleared and relaid quick enough for the guests to sit promptly. The breakfast itself was good with nice variety and everything was very clean. To sum up - great hotel, clean, tidy, location pretty good, only real negative was breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming little hotel in the heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth5
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in our superior room at Hotel Des Arts Montmartre. The standard of the hotel is more of a 4 star than a 3 star. Beautiful and clean rooms. A bottle of champagne in the room for a little extra. A rose and a little chocolate were placed on our bathrobes - little details that made our trip perfect! I loved everything about the hotel and would love to go back. Very good choice if you want to explore BEAUTIFUL Montmartre!

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparciaM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, due to all the reviews on tripadvisor and it didn't disappoint at all. One of the best hotels I've stayed in in a long time. Great location for Montematre (Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge, Cemetery), great views other paris and only 30 mins walk to Grand Opera. Good spacious room, great staff, quite, stylish and quirky find. Would definitely go back to this hotel and would definitely recommend to friends who are visiting paris. Excellent bars and restaurants around the area, as well as great bakeries. Area is very parisian and non-touristy, makes you feel like one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a fascinating neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: debandrich
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the centre of the Parisian artists' quarter this is for you. A lovely, friendly, family run hotel in an excellent location, admitedly up a bit of a hill. Spotless, well-equipped room, good facilities and an ample buffet-style breakfast. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff. We found it a perfect base for exploring Pigalle, Sacre Coeur and the rest of Montmartre. Metro stations nearby meant getting to the rest of Paris very easy. Good choce of restaurants and bars nearby in a lively, bustling quarter. We appreciated a room to leave our suitcases in for a few hours after check out and the use of a computer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location and Speak English”
Reviews.Author: cepi44
Reviews.Content: They were very nice at the reception lobby plus they all speak english, we stayed for 2 nights and no problems at all, we didnt have a courtain shower on the bathroom but we didnt mind taking a bath instead of shower. They have internet at the lobby. We could see the eiffel tower from our room window wich was a plus (room 60). You can walk to Sacre Coeur, and metro station is 5 min walk. We flew to Beauvais and took a bus to Porte Maillot, once in the metro take 1 to Charles de Gaulle, the take 2 to Blanche and you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Arts - Warts and all”
Reviews.Author: Paul003
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel mainly on the recommendations on TA - all I can say is it's not the worst hotel we have ever stayed at, but it comes pretty close. We had a room on the 5th floor, room 54 which was supposed to be a superior room, i have no idea why, the room measured 12' x 10' with twin beds and a view from the window of room 53 and the back of the lift. Storage space was almost nonexistent, 2 single wardrobes either side of the beds, which consisted of a hanging space which was just about tall enough to hang a shirt or a skirt and 3 narrow shelves, one of which had the room safe fitted into it and the other 2 had spare pillows and blankets. So the blankets and pillows had to be put on the floor with our cases so we could store our clothes away. All around the room was notices to the guests.. " for hygiene reasons no eating in the room" "for safety reason do not put anything on top of the cupboards" "for safety reasons don't put anything on the window sill" However the room was spotlessly clean although the colour scheme of nicotine yellow did make it look very drab the beds were very comfy and with sheets and blankets which made a nice change. The bathroom was a good size and with a nice selection of toiletries however these were not replenished during our 4 night stay. The breakfast room was ok but too small for the number of guests, breakfast is served from 7 till 10 and when we went down on the first morning at 8am we had no trouble getting a table but from about 8:30 onwards you will have to share your table and on the second morning of our stay we went down at just after 9 and by 9:30 they ran out of food and only had cereal and coffee on offer, We had just finished by then and we left some very angry guests arguing with the staff. On our last morning we were sent away twice because they had no spare tables.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuggersNewportWales
Reviews.Content: had a great 3 day stay here,lovely spot ,ideal for metro stop 2 min walk away ,breakfast very good,great freejukebox in lobby,only 1 little moan,our room had a hand held shower,not free standing

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: SJonazzle
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, arty, bijoux hotel. Rooms are clean and stylish - small but perfectly formed. Certainly great value for money and good service. Continental breakfast exceeded expectations. We also loved this area of Paris which is full of really great places to eat - do try Petit Parisienne on the same road - a gastronomic delight!

Reviews.Title: “Down to earth, friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bella1983_11
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into this hotel I loved it. It has a relaxed, friendly atmosphere with a funky artistic decor. The room was a good size with a good size bathroom, decent size TV and large window shutters that opened fully to give a view of the street. The only downside of the room was no tea and coffee making facilities which would of made the stay more comfortable but in the grand scheme of things didn't impact too much. There is a free access computer with internet downstairs in the lobby which was great as I didn't take my laptop but there is WiFi throughout the hotel. There was a standard range contential breakfast and once again staff were very welcoming and friendly however it does get busy in the breakfast room and on occasions I struggled to find a table. The location of this hotel is fantastic literally a few minutes walk (up a hill) from Blanche metro and cost around 5-10 euro for a taxi from Gard Nord. There are loads of cafes and restaurants around the hotel which are really worth checking out and the moulin rouge is just opposite Blanche metro. This hotel is a great find and great value for money, I will definately be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment des Arts”
Reviews.Author: crooked_weasel
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel my partner and I were informed that we were not staying in the hotel, but in an apartment across the road. Whilst this did not cause any immediate concen, after the third day of no turn-down service (clean towels, sheets etc...) we were forced to return our own dirty laundry to the reception desk and request clean replacements (including more toilet roll!). When we first used the shower there was a problem in that the temerature was fixed at scalding hot. When calling the hotel to ask if they could help they weren't forthcoming with a solution (besides adjusting the temperature dial) until we had left for breakfast and on our return they claimed the problem had resolved itself. This was untrue as the boiler had simply run out of hot water! Fortunately this problem did not continue past day two of our five day stay. The apartment itself was self catered and well equipped (microwave, fridge, kettle, toaster) but did not provide anything more than the equipment. Fortunately there were convenience stores nearby for us to buy tea/coffee etc. As the apartment is on the ground floor we were awoken early every morning by the sound of the postman, people recycling bottles in the backyard of the building and the residents of the apartment building. It must be said though that the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is served between 7 and 10 in the hotel building. The room is quite small, and on two of the four days we had to share tables with other guests (again, this was not a huge problem for us). On our last day, however, we entered the reception at about 9am to be confronted by a group of agitated guests, who were waiting to go downstairs for breakfast, but there was not enough room. We were asked if we could come back later, which usually would be a problem for us, but as we needed to pack we agreed and went back across the road. Once we had finished packing (and were constantly looking though to the reception area to see when there was no more queue) we went back to the breakfast room at about 945, where there was no food left (other than preservatives, which were useless without anything to put them on!) When we asked if there was any bread, we were told that there wasn't, and no effort was made to go and acquire more (it should be noted that there are numerous boulangeries near the hotel). We mentioned this again when checking out of the hotel, but all we were told was that they were sorry, and made no effort to compensate us in any way (we had paid extra for the buffet breakfast when booking). As we are a young couple none of these points (besides the lack of breakfast on the final day) caused any major problems for us. We simply felt that the hotel did not give us the kind of service which was expected considering we had booked a hotel room with buffet breakfast, instead of us booking a self-catered apartment for a week. The location of the hotel is good, being within walking distance of the Moulin Rouge, two metro stations and the Sacre-Couer. It is difficult to say whether we would stay there again, as following our experience we cannot truly say that we stayed at Hotel des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Rich186349
Reviews.Content: From start to finish we had an excellent stay in this hotel. It was ideally located, elegantly decorated and spotlessly clean. The room was small but very comfortable and all the staff courteous and friendly. The Metro is very close and there are numerous eating places of all sorts in the vicinity. All in all an ideal base from which to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Excellent Location You can feel the heart of Paris beating”
Reviews.Author: Avanifish
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very very clean, cozy and in an artistic mood. The location is perfect near to wonderful bistros, next to Sacre Coeur and a 7 minute walk to the metro station. Certainly go back to Paris again certainly i ll book the same Hotel. Just came back and i cant wait :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location amazing hotel helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: elementalon
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent in the heart of Montmartre I recommend this hotel to anyone ! great hotel, great staff,great rooms very clean. Close to lots of cafe bars and restaurants and nearby metro station Abesses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a single or couple on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LoveParis4ever
Reviews.Content: I like this area of Paris and always stay here even if given a better choice in another area. This hotel is cozy and quiet. Rooms are small but fine. TV has limited channels. There is a small movie theater just across the street, if you are starving for movies.Service is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Shirley29LondonUK
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a mid-price range hotel in Paris, then this smaller hotel in montmartre is an excellent choice. Close to lots of cafe bars and restaurants and handy for two nearby metro stations, Blanche and Abesses. We stayed in two superior rooms, one with balcony, and they were extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel buffet breakfast was a superb start to the day, unlimited toast, pastries, cereals, juice, eggs, coffee or tea. To add to the atmosphere of being in Paris, the hotel has some great framed photographs and paintings on show, and even the lift doors were adorned with painted murals. Highly recommend the Hotel Des Arts and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: seasidegeordie16
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! in a fantastic location to see the more hidden gems of Paris! Loved the quaintness of the whole place..will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a beautiful part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ctrappe
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints, nice friendly service, nicely styled hotel situated in a good location in the montmartre area. If anything perhaps the room was a touch on the small side but adequate for both of us, and not really an issue. Plenty of nice shops around, and close to the metro. Staff were helpful, and the included breakfast was simple, yet satisfying. Would recommend. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Hilary_Bennison
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel as part of my suprise bithday trip to Paris. He could not have done better, down the bottom of the road is the Moulin Rouge, Up teh road and round the corner is the Sacre Cour, and the small lanes with cafes and street painters, it was lovely to stay here. Good location, opposite the Moulin Rouge is a metro station that takes 10mins ish to Gard du Nord and 15mins into the centre of Pairs for the Effile tower etc. Metro was very efficient , loved the street buskers that get on the train, very amusing. Made a short journey even more pleasurable. This was my first trip to Paris, loved it and will be returning to investigate in more detail.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: the_oslo_gooner
Reviews.Content: Booked online at hotel's own website at a very competitive rate (1 night prepaid), you would struggle to get same value for money in Paris. It's a small cosy hotel, just of rue Abesses in Montmartre. Some 5-7 minutes walk from nearest metro station (Abesses). An abundance of bars and restaurants nearby, still it feels quiet in the hotel, nice. Rooms are quite small, but do the job (but not smaller than you should expect - I've stayed in far smaller rooms on Manhattan). The hotel was helpful with restaurant bookings in advance of our stay, thumbs up. Breakfast at â‚¬ 10 (continental) is no bargain, but no rip off either. We opted for this choice all three mornings. The breakfast room it self is very cosy, and situated in the basement. It's quite small, so we had to que for some 10 minutes one of the days. on the downside: There is no A/C in the room (that I could find) som it might get hot in summers maybe? No free WiFi either, you may buy wifi access from the reception, but quite expensive. Showering is i bit of a mess as there is no shower curtain (or fixed wall), hence water all over the floor if your standing up when taking a bath. Would strongly consider the hotel for my next stay in Paris, but would also check out other options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: SRLYork_UK
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommended for its comfort, convenient location and friendly ambience. We loved the cinema just across the road, the fondues available in nearby restaurants and 'Amelie's ' cafe just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On ! ...and a few restaurant recomendations”
Reviews.Author: DINKYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I cant add much more around the hotel than what has already been said to be honest ....(great part of town, clean and tidy rooms, lack of shower curtain bit bizarre/unnecessary, on the whole would definetly recomend). the only reason Im writing is to pass on the snippets of real experience I always look for/ like to pick up from the TA community We were a group of two couples aged between 39 and 60, we flew into paris at 1200 Saturday and flew out again at 1830 Sunday - everyone had been to Paris before so no plans to sight see as such but rather endulge in some Paris life around a night at the MOULIN ROUGE - everyione in the party enjoys food and wine Restaurant Recomendations ( taken initially from Zagats) Saturday Lunch - Zebre a Montmatre (3mins from the Hotel) - Light Lunch as we were eating early at Moulin Rouge - Nicely chlled out spot, real mix of Students and tourists - didnt want a lot but because the starters we all had were so good we were forced to order dessert as well - great start to the weekend....not a big place though and if its full there are other places similar near by Saturday Evening - Moulin Rouge - Approx 5-8min walk down from the hotel (even in the rain not a big problem and via a large pleasant enough street that everyone in the party felt comfortable walking along) Wasnt sure what to expect but actually turned out to be a great night, the show is truly spectactular (even to a jaded yorkshireman who thought he had seen it all), the theatre and general set up was also much better than I expected - food was average to be honest but I wouldnt have missed the experience and seeing the people who came just for the show being squeezed into any nook an cranny and sharing table late into the evening makes me think on balance that if you are planning on going to the show do it once and do it properly and dont be put off by the price ( we did the 180 Euro/head Belle Epoque menu and I 'd like to think we got a better table as a result of this but this may just have been the luck of the draw). The tickets said be there at least 30 mins before the 1900 show time - we got there on the dot of 1830 and there was already a queue around the block - dont be put off ! so long as you have a ticket the doors open at 1900 and you are generally sat at your table with a glass of champers in hand by about 1915 - Pleasant walk back to the Hotel via a couple of Bars....again no feeling of tension in the area, certainly when we were there felt perfectly safe and amongst similar minded people Sunday Lunch - Le Basilic ( 4mins from the hotel on the corner opposite Zebre) - After a morning at the Louvre and with a taxi booked for 1600 to take us back, wanted somehting nice but close to the hotel - had seen the name of the place in Zagats and had spied the sign when we were at Zebre the day before so tried our luck ...really glad we did! best meal of the weekend and a lasting memory of the perfect french Sunday lunch - relaxed yet slightly more upmarket than Zebre this relatively small space was crammed with smiling faces and french voices - food was very definetly a step up also and whilst the prices were higher the option of Prix Menu or al a Carte covered all the bases both from a price and qulaity perspective - Grandmas poached egg starter with Garlic shavings was a highlight as was the Hay Roasted Lamb Rack, classic Rossini filet and duck done only the way that the French seem capable of doing.....rolled back to the hotel and onto a cab back the airport and home sharing tales of glutiny and excess but everyone agreed we were very lucky people and wouldnt living in an appartment in Montmatre be a realy good thing to do !! In summary - if you have read this you are probably at that stage of just about to committing your credit card details to the vagaries of the internet. From our experience I would suggest you swallow hard and just go for it ......Hotel Arts is a great little 3star in a lovely part of town....besides just how much time do you want to spend in your room?...even in the rain just wandering along Rue Abbesses stopping off for a glass somewhere (not because you want to get drunk but because you want an excuse to stop and watch other people walk by) is a truly soul affirming experience that should not be missed......Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: MarkAlder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now & we've loved it both times. Great views from the upper rooms, excellent staff & perfect location in the heart of Montmartre. Could have done with a proper shower rather than the hand-held one but we're being really picky there! Recommended for a romantic city break anytime

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Montmarte Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheSnakeCharmer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Montmartre a few times I can confidently say that this hotel is definitely located in the best part. By Parisian standards the rooms are also quite big, and very comfortable. The staff are helpful too, and the hotel common areas pleasant. Only definite negative would be the lack of a shower curtain/door!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: regulartraveler96
Reviews.Content: located in montmarte, this small hotel (40 rooms) is a gem. We stayed in october 2009 and enjoyed the hotel. we returned this febrary for 1 wekk and it was again excellent: impeccable, newly renovated room with new bed, excellent kreakfast, sympatic staff and an ideal location. Close to the metro in montmarte, close to sacre-coeur in a typical paris neibourhood , we enjoyed the hotel and neibourhood atmostphere, the small cafes and shops, the easy access to downtown paris by metro and the frienliness of the people of paris in general and the neibourhhood in particular. the food in the area is also excellent, even is small cafes. we recommend this area of paris and particularly this hotel . excellent ratio quality and price

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Parisian Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: FunsterGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel des Arts to celebrate his 40th birthday. We were very happy with the hotel upon arrival. A friendly and polite gentleman checked us in and immediately offered us advice and guidance on the locality. We were given a map and we were told where the best places to eat nearby were, the proximity of the metro stations etc. I would definitely recommend The Zebra, which is literaly around the corner from the hotel - lovely food and very friendly staff. I have to say that I found absolutely everyone (without exception) particularly friendly around the area. The hotel is in a wonderful part of Montmartre surrounded by gorgeous brasseries, bars, restaurants and small shops. It's a perfect part of Paris to come back to after a day visiting the sights and travelling on the metro (which is just down the hill from the hotel) - about 5-8 min walk. The hotel itself is charming and extremely clean and pleasant. All of the staff are polite and friendly and more than happy to give help and advice if required. The hotel has a very homely feel. Our room, which was on the top floor (room 61) was clean, comfortable, nicely decorated, cosy and perhaps a little on the small side, but very pleasant. As mentioned in previous reviews the shower is a little awkward to use without a shower screen and the beds could be a little more comfortable. The complementary toiletries smelled lovely too. Breakfast was included and this was served in the basement area. This area was extremely briight, clean and nicely decorated and the continental breakfast was lovley too. We both had a wonderful time at Hotel des Arts and will definitely stay there again!! I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Riv4
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Des Arts, but with one caveat- I really really missed having internet access in my room. Wireless would have been ideal, but even a wired connection in the room would have sufficed. The shared Mac in the lobby was a nice gesture, but I'm very wary of using any public/shared computer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLooker
Reviews.Content: Pros: Really close to Montmartre and Sacre Coeur and some lovely bars and restaurants, the room was clean, there were some nice bathroom toiletries, and the overall price wasn't too steep. Cons: The decor is extremely dated, the staff aren't very friendly, the breakfast was lacking, the bathroom did not have a shower but rather a shower/bath attachment which sprayed water everywhere.
