We didn't spend much time in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in Great location!”
Reviews.Author: RuthHW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January; the hotel is in an excellent location, close to the Metro and surrounded by restaurants, bars & boulangeries. Room sizes are about average for Paris so not huge but clean and tidy - nothing to complain about at all!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in central paris”
Reviews.Author: iamdangermike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January and would definitely recommend it. The location is on a quiet street up from pigalle and easy walking distance to 3 metro stops. Plenty of nice cafe, deli's in the area. Its easy reach to popular destinations such as Louvre or Notre Dame. Both are about 30-40 mins on the metro door to door. i think for the price the room was very good. The bathroom was nice and we had our own balcony. The room was warm and the bed comfortable.The hotel has an elevator but you can easily walk to your room (ours was the 4th floor). I think they only have about 35 rooms so its very cosy and intimate. The breakfast buffet is compact but the usual suspects are all there. They have a really nice reception room with Jukebox playing french classics and a Mac computer to check your emails if need be. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again. Perfect if you dont want something simple but enough to still feel that you are in Paris ;) Oh and each room has a different name after famous artists....cute.

Reviews.Title: “Great cosy hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: baroquepawel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located just a few minutes from Basilique Sacre-Coeur in Montmarte. You can have a wonderful walk around at any time of the day or night. It is also very well connected (by the underground) with the rest of Paris, so travelling everywhere is easy. There are a lot of little shops and cafes nearby, and I had some of the most delicious foie gras once. There is a charming fromagerie a few minutes walk, and a lot of creperies and other quick food places should you get hungry in the late evening and not feeling like a proper supper. The room was spacious, even very spacious (it was a suprior room), very clean (inlcuding the bathroom), with a balcony and high above the street level (thus quiet), nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful with answering questions, giving directions, booking taxis etc. It was the second time I stayed in this hotel, and it will also be my first choice the next time I am going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of Paris”
Reviews.Author: RetiredPornStar
Reviews.Content: This was about my eight time to stay in Paris, and I have to say this hotel is perfect for getting that taste of France. The neighbourhood is endlessly watchable and friendly. So are the staff at the hotel, rooms are clean and modern, with HD satellite TV. No complaints with the breakfast either, although everyone seems to want to have a lie in and take breakfast late. Stay here, get a good guide book and go and explore mes amis!!

Reviews.Title: “Parfait!”
Reviews.Author: ruffege
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, warm, quiet. Well situated for everything we wanted. Looking forward to coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Montmarte district”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtraveler60
Reviews.Content: Friend and I stayed here for 7 days -- 2 blocks from Metro & sightseeing bus stop -- good restaurants - area is a bit "shady" in spots, but overall - great location. Value for hotel is great for Paris - clean/typical breakfast, small room, 1 person elevator - most of the staff was very helpful... I would probably stay in another area if I return only to get yet another "feel" for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Georgiaxox
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an amazing location, close to two metros and the Moulin Rouge. The room was a good enough size, clean with a safe which was useful for our passports etc. There was a fancy flat screen TV on the wall and a desk, chair, stool which was nice. Although some people have complained about the hand held shower, I had no problem with it and really enjoyed being able to have a relaxing bath after walking round Paris all day, beautiful as it was. We had the bed and breakfast included together and the buffet was brilliant, loads of choice of both food and drink, and they never run out. W stayed 3 nights and only had to wait on the third morning for a table. The hotel itself was very pretty and painted beautifully, and there was a really nice feel to it, with friendly staff. The only downsides are that it was very hot without airconditioning, but luckily we were on the 3rd floor so slept with the window open. We didn't have a view at all, infact we looked into the window of opposite rooms and the walls were very thin, although we never had a problem with noise. Overall I would deffinitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Higly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Pascal
Reviews.Content: We intended to stay for one week but stayed for two due to flight cancelations. The hotel staff were most helpful and we were able to stay in the same room despite short notice. Our double room was comfortable and spotlessly clean with a lovely view over the roof tops of Paris. The location is one of the best in Paris, with two metro stations and many places of interest within easy walking distance. The area is charming, full of shops, bars, restaurants and offers a wide variety for a visitor to explore from morning 'til night. The hotel is warm comfortable and welcoming. The staff were friendly and always helpful. We would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La Mon Cheri”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Arts-Paris Montmartre Room 61-Dates of Stay: 2-4 January 2011 We arrived around 10 am because our plane arrived at 6:15 am from the US. It seems they have a hard & fast rule about check-in: not until 14h or 2 pm so we left our luggage and walked around and then took the Metro to one of our favorite restaurants for lunch. We returned about 15 minutes before 2 and had to wait, but we were the first allowed to check in. Our room was on the top floor, but the elevator only goes to the 5th floor so we had to walk one flight of stairs-no big issue. Our room was named â€œGazi Le Tatarâ€�. All of the rooms were named, and each floor was decorated with a Montmartre/Paris theme. Hotel is family run apparently and very clean. They were dusting the lobby while I was waiting to check in. All staircases were winding so there may be an issue if the elevator was out of order for some. Staying on the top floor would also be difficult, if not impossible, for people with walking disabilities or difficulty. Our room was spotless just like everywhere else in hotel. One issue was heat: It could be adjusted but did not go down rapidly due to method of heating-hot water. I didnâ€™t see any evidence of a/c so room could be hot in summer. The room had two windows: a regular one and a smaller one near the ceiling and heater. We kept that one open most of the time to offset the heat. From our room, one could see Sacre Coeur clearly. Looking right, one could see the Tour Montparnasse, weather permitting. I wish we had been on the other side to see the Eiffel Tower, but I have no complaints since I requested a higher room and got exactly that. The room had two twin beds, also as requested. They were pushed up together, of course, as is the custom in France. I saw them adjusting mattresses across the hall so the room can be made up with one double or two twin beds. How efficient! There were very small ledges on each side of the bed. The one by the window had the telephone. The only available outlet in the room that I could find was beneath the other ledge on the side closer to the bathroom. There was a desk with a stool as well as a small garbage can. Another lamp was on the desk plus bright lights above the head of the bed and one on the far wall above the desk. There was a nice but small, maybe 20 inches or 50 centimeters diagonally, television. There were about 25 channels. All were In French except the Arte channel which sometimes was in German. Reception was spotty on about 1/3 of the channels due to satellite signal. They need to add some English news channels such as BBC and CNN; however, one is not in Paris to watch tv, but sometimes it is nice for those who donâ€™t speak French to have some. I speak French and German so not an issue for me. Next to the small ledges by the bed were two narrow closets. One had extra pillows and a blanket; the other had a very small safe. My little notebook computer was too big for the safe so I kept it in my suitcase and trusted them. The bathroom had a sink, toilet, and tub. There was a hair dryer on the wall and 3 mirrors of various sizes. The one that bothered me was the one on the door so I could see my fat self on the toilet! There was no mounted shower but a shower cord. Unlike most French tubs, there was no half glass door so one had to be careful when using the shower extension to rinse off so as to not flood the bathroom. They had very nice amenities which seem to be custom made for the hotel. There was soap, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, hand cream, and a shower cap. One minor complaint is that they did not replace them the second day. I did find the maid to get another bar of soap, however. Everything worked fine. My only comment would be that they should add some safety bars to help getting up and in and out of tub. Tub was not slippery but could be if one didnâ€™t rinse it off before standing up. There was also another small garbage can in the bathroom. As others have said, breakfast area can get crowded. We timed in just right on both days. They had cereal, bread, hard boiled eggs, juices, yogurt, water, coffee, and tea. One addition that could be made would be a few cold cuts such as ham, but no complaints because they probably would charge more than 10 euros if they expanded the selection. The hotel had no wifi although they told me at the desk that some rooms were wired for such based on how they were booked. I am not sure exactly what that meant. There was one terminal in the lobby, but it was often busy. I was able to quickly check my email a few times, but some lingered as if they were extra special. Also, there was a problem checking AOL mail except in the mornings for some reason. There was an error message so not sure why I could not access it during afternoon and evening. I had a family emergency in the US and had to phone for more details since I could not send or receive emails for almost 24 hours. I am not sure if it was the hotelâ€™s connection, server, AOL, or exactly what. In summary, the hotel deserves its high ratings. All of the negatives were things that could easily be fixed. The biggest negative was the heat. I realize itâ€™s an old system, but it would be nice if there was an off switch rather than just a knob to turn so one had to guess if it was on high or low or wait a half hour to see if it cooled off or heated up. I donâ€™t like paying a booking fee (5,50 euros here) but would not let this be a reason to not stay here. The rate of 85 euros for a top floor room with a view and enough room to move about was a real bargain for Paris. This was the third hotel where I have stayed near Montmartre. This hotel was much better than either of the others, the Villa Van Gogh (formerly Best Western dâ€™Esteres when I stayed there in 2001) and the Tryp Blanche Fontaine (see my review for the details), and would definitely be my first choice when I stay in this part of Paris again. I do like to stay in different parts of Paris on my many visits and rarely stay in the same place again, but I would here. Access to the metro was about 200 metres, either east and flat to Abysses or south and downhill to/uphill from Blanche. There were many great restaurants nearby including one of our favorites, Le Buffet on Rue des Trois Freres, where my pictures are on their wall by the wine racks since Iâ€™ve eaten there about 20 times and am considered family. Bottom Line: Hotel was quiet and provided a safe, comfortable nightâ€™s sleep. Bravo Hotel des Arts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: hduppi
Reviews.Content: Like the majority of reviewers, I was very happy with this hotel. Every single one of the staff were pleasant, multilingual and and helpful if requested. The rooms were about the same size as others I've stayed in while visiting other cities and towns throughout Europe - efficient, but smaller (or larger) than some travelers may be familiar with depending upon their experiences. My room was very clean, and had hand painted art work on the walls. The location was excellent - this was the first time I stayed in Montmarte, and I was glad I chose to stay here and will definately again. I was especially happy with the heating system - I was always warm - something which I cannot say for some other hotels I've visited during the winter months. My only suggestion would be to add shower curtains and a hook for those guests choosing to bathe this way rather than seated or kneeling in the tub. Some suggestions for others - if you will be visiting a number of museums, consider a Paris Museum Pass, which you can purchase online, or at the airport when you arrive or at an Information center. It has many advantages. There are numerous foodstores and supermarkets nearby. As for restaurants, you can turn either right or left as you leave the hotel, and find many excellent places to eat. In Paris, it is common for restaurants to offer 3 courses - entrees, "plats" (main dishes) and a dessert course. Typically, you may choose an entree and a plat, a plat and a dessert, or (for a few euros more) an entree, plat and dessert. You may also choose a bottle of wine or a carafe of the "house" wine - white or red. In the cafes, they may have beer, either draft or in bottles, usually in view in a cooler along with soft drinks and bottled water. Be aware - food is more expensive in Paris than in other parts of Europe. My favorite restaurant - Les Dix Vins (The Ten Wines). Exit the hotel and turn right. The next intersecting street is rue Abbesses (with MANY restaurants and cafes in either direction). Continue to the next street, rue Veron, and turn left. After 100 feet or so, you'll find the small, storefront Les Dix Vins - often filled with locals. Take your menu decoder with you, because it is a family restaurant and they speak French. The menu is on a small handwritten blackboard and the wines are on a handwritten blackboard on the wall. Everything is delicious - so be bold! As for breakfast, I did not eat at the hotel, as it was a little more expensive than I wanted to pay. However, other guests mentioned that it was good. Local cafes have breakfasts available for a little less money, but you will not have the variety and the coffee will be limited (if you order a black coffee (cafe noir) you will get an expresso. In Paris, it is unusual for breakfast to be included in the price of a room. This is really a great place to stay while visiting one of the great cities of the world - enjoy it for what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: mmm76Finland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with my husband and we liked it very much. Our room was clean (in bathroom there was a shower with sliding door) and we didn't have any problems with heating system. Hotel's breakfast was good and the breakfast room was quiet. Only thing we didn't like was some kind of plastic in the bed on top of the mattress. Otherwise the hotel was just perfect. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find near Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Veillemadame
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel over New Year 2010 - the person who said the rooms were small has obviously not stayed in Paris much! For Paris the rooms were of a really good size. Couldn't see much difference between the standard and superior rooms, so don't bother spending the extra money. Bathrooms very clean, but a bath is the standard, if you like a shower, ask for one of the few rooms with showers. Reception really helpful and welcoming. Didn't bother with the breakfasts, as there are plenty of good cafes nearby, including the one used in the film Amelie, and you get much more of a feel for Paris than a hotel breakfast room. Montmartre and Moulin Rouge are only a few mins walk away. Really recommend this hotel if you want a good room in the Montmartre area.

Reviews.Title: “No shower curtains!”
Reviews.Author: gburg2000
Reviews.Content: This is a typical above-average European hotel. The rooms are tiny and the decor nice. The location was good. Only the internet on the lobby computer is free. We only stayed one night, and that was adequate. My biggest concern was the lack of a shower curtain. It was not a privacy issue as much as a simple convenience issue. With a hand-held shower nozzle, it was difficult not to spray water all over the bathroom. Thus it limited the effectiveness of the shower. If I were staying more than one night, I would have been seriously mad about this. I asked the front desk and they said that none of the rooms have shower curtains because they don't want to have to deal with mold issues. For what they charge, they should be able to clean or replace moldy shower curtains! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “bestens”
Reviews.Author: blumenstruck
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in my favourite area of Paris. Staff were very helpful, which doesnâ€™t always happen in that city. The room was typically small (well, this is Paris) but perfectly OK. The breakfast was better than youâ€™d expect in a Parisian hotel, but the breakfast room could do with being a bit bigger asit gets crowded on a morning. The one point I would make is that the heating in the room was on full blast all the time I was there, and I couldnâ€™t see how to turn it down. This meant thatI had to have the window open- even when if was -2 outside- to get any sleep! Overall though a perfectly decent and good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mon777ey
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel des Arts in Paris. I accidentally left my IPOD in the room on my departure. The hotel was gracious enough to send it back to the USA for me at no cost. FANTASTIC. That is excellent service and they should be recognized for their efforts. A place I'd defintiely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Samo76
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel with good breakfest included to prise. Free wifi and iMac for common usage. Location is superb if Montmartre is your favourit area in Paris. Nearest metropolitan is two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly hotel in great Monmartre location”
Reviews.Author: JB236
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Arts is an excellent budget choice in the heart of Monmartre - welcoming, with a nice reception area (including jukebox, chocolate lab, newspapers and internet access), and cosy, well-equipped, clean rooms with firm beds. Cross the road and you're in Studio 28, a classic French arthouse cinema, walk one way and you're on Rue des Abbesses and all the shops and restaurants there (and a short walk to Rue Lepic and Rue des Martyrs with gourmet groceries), and the other way and you're heading up the hill to the Montmartre village square. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous 'petit' Hotel in Monte Marte with friendly and helpful staff !”
Reviews.Author: ECOnergy
Reviews.Content: Excellent room for the price with comfortable beds, clean and in very good condition. The location is excellent with Metro and plenty of cafe's, bars, restaurants and good food shops nearby. You almost don't want to leave the area to venture into the heart of Paris. The breakfast for 10â‚¬ is great value with unlimited buffet served until all the people have left as opposed to a time. They have a good shuttle service which we used back to the airport. All in all best hotel I have stayed at in Paris for the price range ! Bon vacances !

Reviews.Title: “What a great find in Paris !!”
Reviews.Author: PhilipN87
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Arts is a wonderful little hotel. Room was small but very comfortable and quiet. The location is fantastic with 2 Metro stations within 5 minutes walk, and lots of bars and restaurants and cafes very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jds37
Reviews.Content: Great location in Montmartre, close to wide range of restaurants from Japanese to French country style. Welcome warm and friendly. Room smallish, as are most in Paris, but comfortable and well maintained. Good breakfast. Sacre Coeur quite close and choice of Metro stations within easy walking distance.. Want to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely, quirky little hotel for 3 nights. Great location, close to the metro, and lots of cafes and bistros. Friendly, helpful staff. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the breakfast was great. Our only criticism is that our room was a bit on the small side and the breakfast room is also quite small. It would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but not sure if this is not the norm in Paris. We would stay again and had a great time in lovely Paris!

Reviews.Title: “STYLISH SMALL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: magnus-pike
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from Blanche Metro. Smart and stylish small hotel in bustling Montmartre. Clean and comfortable rooms. Excellent continental breakfast but room can be fully occupied in busy periods. Good base to explore the local area. Plenty of bars and restaurants to chose from. Only 5 minutes walk to Metro and can be in center of Paris in under 30 minutes. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: RachaelST
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to Paris from 22nd October to 25th October. We booked the hotel and flights through Expedia. It was easy to navigate to the hotel from the airport by RER Train and metro. The Metro stop, Abesses, is about 5 minute walk from the hotel. Upon checking in the receptionist was very pleasant and helpful and made us feel welcome. The room was of a very good standard and quiet even though our room was facing the road, our sleep was never disturbed. The room was cleaned very well as was the hotel as a whole. We had a continental breakfast which was well stocked and staff were on hand if anything was needed. The hotel is well situated in the art district. There is a wide selection of restaurants in the area to meet all budgets. Overall we would stay in the same hotel due to its location, helpful and pleasant staff and high standard of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Paris086
Reviews.Content: Very friendly personnel, clean and renovated rooms, good breakfast and a very convenient location! And we even had a view over the roofs of Montmartre and the Eiffel tower from our window...a perfect choice. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff, Rooms excellent Standard”
Reviews.Author: SFB80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of my birthday celebrations as a family of 10. The rooms were small but cosy and very clean and of an excellent standard. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is good for the montmarte area and lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from near by.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: franNIreland
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days in this lovely hotel! Rooms are small but cosy, clean and comfortable. Tea/coffee making facilities would have been nice! Staff very helpful and friendly. Well situated to get into Paris-two metro stations within walking distance.Lots of eating places nearby. Would definitely recommend it and would go back again. One small tip-if you use the shuttle service bookable through the hotel allow a couple more hours than you normally would-they were late arriving and added to the traffic through Paris we almost missed our flight!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: sspicer002
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, Conveniently located in Montmarte. The Price was right and the room was cute and comfortable, recently updated. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not for the price.”
Reviews.Author: leka9
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that whatever you read in the good reviews about this hotel - it is all true! Hotel des Arts is cute, extremely clean, the staff is very helpful and the location is perfect if you want to stay in Montmartre. There are however certain things that obviously do not bother many satisfied customers and that I want to mention. First of all, even though the area is very quiet, and the vast majority of clients are polite, you will hear whatever happens in the hallways and in other rooms so prepare to be interrupted in your sleep even if you use earplugs. I rated the sleep quality as poor also because the beds are small and not so comfortable. They also slide left and right but the main thing that bothered me was that there was something about the bed linen (or the bed itself) that would make you sweat, i.e. some fabric did not breathe there. The breakfast (that is extra 10 euros per person btw) is very average, nothing special in it. I also did not understand why the hotel had only a computer with free internet and no free wireless access (you had to pay extra for it too). To conclude: even though it is not an expensive hotel, there are many other hotels in Paris that offer more or less the same package and that cost up to 30% less. I had the feeling that I paid extra because of the high rating here and not because there is more value in this hotel. I did enjoy my stay however and I recommend it highly for anyone that is determined to stay in Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jollyjulie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights on our first ever trip to Paris and fell in love with this city and this hotel. the rooms are spotless, the staff were helpful, and we slept very well. had room 62 at back of hotel, which was really quiet and had a great view of the city. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “4 Wonderful Days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: whisper28
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts was charming - such a welcome change from large well known "chain" hotels. The room was spacious enough and although the bathroom was very small, the shower was excellent. The hotel was stylishly decorated with some unusual touches and the staff were very helpful and informative. The hotel is in the fascinating Montmartre district with it's wonderful food shops, cafes, restaurants, places of interest and a short distance from 2 Metro stations. My partner has visited Paris before but this was my first visit and I enjoyed it immensely. We plan to stay at the Hotel Des Arts again - hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pipaya
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but really enjoyed our stay here. Quite possibly the smallest room i have ever stayed in, but they have really used the space well and everything is very clean and modern. Nice big windows were a bonus! Perfect stay for a night or two in Paris :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: linda2030
Reviews.Content: Just walk up the road 100 meters and you can see the gleaming, gold tower of Les Invalides accross the city. A few more hundred yards walk and you are at Sacre Coeur. with magical views . This little hotel is immaculate and in such a brilliant location - 5 minutes to the metro, bars and restaurants a stone's throw away. We had room 26 and it was very quiet. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: richardandrachelp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while in Paris for a concert at Stade de France. The hotel was great - clean, good value for money, and a nice breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful.The only thing missing was a bar but there were plenty of cafes and restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. Location was perfect, for the butte de montmarte (5 minutes walk up the hill), rue Abbesses with its cafes and bistros (2 minutes walk), Gard du Nord (20 minutes walk or 10 minutes on the metro) and the Stade de France (30 minutes door to door on the metro line 13). Our concert finished at 11.30 and we were back having a drink in the rue Abbesses by midnight. Friday night was noisy - there was a street party which went on until the early hours of Saturday morning but speaking to the waitor at the local restaurant on Saturday this was a special event and not typical, alhthough I imagine most weekends would be reasonably lively so if you are planning on going to bed early you may need earplugs. We will certainly return and have already recommended the hotel to friends

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HIGHLY RECOMEND”
Reviews.Author: acorns30
Reviews.Content: Perfect Merci Like icing on cake for my first trip to Paris [If anyone complains about this hotel thay must be extremely difficult to please] Would love to come back s'il vous plait

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dlukeg1
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel recommended to us & it lived up to it's recomendation. The staff were VERY helpful - the location was great. We like a softer bed -so our nights sleep couild have been better but we get hard beds everywhere. Our friends had room 56 & out of their window they could see the Eifell Tower. Also our camera broke the first night so we put it in the bin - the evening when we got back to the room the chamber maid had taken it from the bin & placed it on the dressing table.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: MalRon
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable for location, value for money and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “5-star service; in a 4-star hotel, for a 3-star price!”
Reviews.Author: thehairycoo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great little hotel in the Montmatre area, you simply cannot fault this place. The staff are incredibly helpful and were friendly/chatty but not intrusive, leaving you to your own devices unless you ask (the way we like it!). As the title says; this place gives you 5-star service from the staff, in what I would class as a 4-star boutique hotel, at 3-star prices. If you are prepared to spend upwards of 300 euros a night for a luxury hotel, this place isn't for you. If you want great service in a clean; comfortable, stylish hotel that delivers exactly what you need for a few nights sightseeing in Paris but don't want it to cost the earth, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay in this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mybellMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time my friends and I stayed at Hotel Des Arts - we were there in July 09 too! Again - a great stay! Staff are still friendly and helpful! Location - still fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutigue hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Deborah053
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Montmartre. There are at least 30 good restaurants around the hotel. It is within walking distance of Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge is around the corner. We purchased transit tickets and travelled by subway all over Paris. We had no trouble walking to the Arc de Triomphe. Our hotel room was small but beautifully decorated and was on the 5th floor. There is an elevator or spiral staircase. The breakfast was excellent with fresh cheeses, baquettes, pastries, cereal, boiled eggs,croissants, juice, fruit and yoghurt. It is served in a lovely room downstairs. There is complimentary internet in the salon area. You can get a shuttle to the airport through the hotel for 17 Euros. We would stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A dream honeymoon in a lovely hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: EmmaDyson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon in Paris. We chose it as it was affordable and with my husband being a keen artist it seemed fitting with our visit. The hotel was lovely and exceeded expectations. There are 6 floors and we were on the 6th floor! There is a lift up to the 5th floor and only a small spiral staircase to the 6th so no problems although if you are like mt husband and don't do small lifts then the 5 floors of spiral staircasing can make you a little dizzy! Although a stop on each floor to admire the artwork on each lift door is worth the climb! It is a quaint hotel (although it has 64 rooms!) and has nice little touches like each room is named after a famous artist. We had a relatively small room but there was enough room for the two of us with hanging space each side of the bed and 3 shelves each, a large desk, bathroom with a bath/shower, sink and toilet which was very clean and looked quite new, also a hairdryer but it was one of these attatched to the wall so ladies if you have long hair I'd suggest bringing your own! There was also a free safe which you programmed your own pin number into (very easy to use and had instructions) and a flat screen tv which had BBC world news. There was also a reading room downstairs with daily papers in most languages, free internet access and a free jukebox! so when you come back after walking all day you can take a paper, sit back in the comfy chairs and listen to a bit of louis armstrong or duke ellington (or one of the many other musical masters!). Breakfast comprised of croissants (and other pastries), toast, jams, bagguette, a selection of cheeses, yoghurt, cerials, orange/apple juice and tea/friut teas/coffee - only continental served but was always plenty of choice and you help yourself! The hotel was situated perfectly for us. A few minutes walk up hill and you were amongst the street artist of place du tetre and the cafes and restaurants and little trinket /souviner shops and also the sacre-coer. A minutes walk down hill from the hotel and you find youself in a bustle of cafes and restaurants and at the moulin rouge! It is also well situated for metro and bus travel but as we only made one trip out of monmartre during our stay to visit the louvre and champs-elese for 10 Euros each we got a taxi as it worked out cheaper and easier! if you do want to use the buses be prepared to change as not all sites such as the louvre have direct bus access. The staff were all very helpful, spoke fluent English and very friendly. Our flight was in the evening so we made use of the luggage room at reception and there is also a trasnfer service to the airport - we booked ours with a separate company which cost 115 euros for return for the two of us but the hotel have a transfer service at 17 euros per person so worth looking into using this - I wish we had have! All of Paris is quite expensive in comparison to the UK, the average pint is 9 Euros and the main street restaurants charge around 17 Euros for a main course but a lot of bars have happy hours between 2pm and 10pm when beers are half price and try and look at restaurants down side streets if you are on a budget as many do 2-3 courses for 10-15 Euros and a carafe on wine for 8. All in all it was a wonderful stay without any problems or complaints and the champagne in the room on arrival for us newly-weds was just another touch that we wont forget. We will definately be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a nice area.”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for what we paid. (As part of a package on Eurostar with Cresta) Yes, our room and bathroom was small but the Hotel is ideally placed for a base to explore the charms of Montemartre and the bussle of Pigalle and the Moulin Rouge. The staff we found friendly and efficient. The free juke box and Internet in the lounge is a nice touch. The Breakfast room was small but didn't get overcrowded during our stay. (I would imagine if the hotel was full and everyone arrived at once it would be bedlam!) However the food was well presented and adequate for a continental breakfast. On our experience most hotels in France of this size & rating suffer from the same complaint, but hey it's not the Paris Hilton but then it's not the same price of a 5* place. Yes the view from our room was a small service void, that most of the rooms backed onto, but it was a lot more quiet at night than having street noise outside! Our one complaint has to be the Shower. There is no bracket to hang it on and no curtain or screen. So even if you sit in the bath tub and use the spray the result is a flooded floor! The moral to all this is you get what you pay for but at least here it is with a friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: chris49
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in the Hotel Des Arts for three nights in August. For the rate we paid, I was pleasantly surprised at what we got. We had two single rooms, which were a good size for singles. He was on the ground floor right on the reception area (with a glass door as well as the room door to keep the noise out), whilst I was on the 4th floor. Both rooms looked over a well at the back. The public areas are very clean and the dÃ©cor is lovely. All the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we thought it was a bit expensive for what you got. We had breakfast at Amelie's cafÃ© in Rue Lepic one morning and then went to another boulangerie near Abbesses that served breakfast the other two mornings and found this was a lot cheaper. The area has lots of cafes, bars, restaurants, etc. and is within five minutes walking from Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur and all the other great features of Montmartre. There are two nearby metro stops, Abbesses and Blanche but mostly we used the buses from the main road at the bottom of Rue Lepic. One bus is the No. 30 which goes direct to the Eiffel Tower in one direction and Gare du Nord the other. Our last morning we were able to store our bags in the baggage room as our train home wasn't until 6 p.m. Living in the hotel is a gorgeous chocolate-coloured labrador, Caramel, who has a fantastic temperament. Well worth a pat!! On our return to England, I was pleased to receive an email from the Hotel, hoping that we'd had a good stay. This personal touch is very much appreciated. We are planning a return winter weekend to see the Louvre as we didn't have time to fit it in this trip; hopefully Hotel Des Arts will be able to accommodate us again as I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to plunge into Montmarte's atmophere”
Reviews.Author: Savah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and me had a weekend break in Paris and I chose this hotel mostly because of the location: it did not disappoint us at all! A very very cosy little hotel in a perfect position between Montmartre and Pigalle neighbourhood. Surrounded by a nice movida, lovely restaurants and cafÃ©s, such as the "Lepicurien", at the top of the same street as the hotel. We had an inside room so no view but really really calm in the night and in the morning. I really loved the hotel's decoration evoking all French painters and writers of mid 19th/early 20th centuries. Rooms are very clean (small like any other place in Paris!! :D ) but the only flaw is that they are not equipped with air conditioning and minibar: during our stay temperature was not so high but we kept anyway the window open night and day, and about the drinks, I would have really appreciated some water in the minibar, not to buy it anytime outside. Wifi in the rooms is on payment but there is a Mac in the hall with free connection. Breakfast was lovely, there's a bit of everything, croissants and bread were very good and the decoration of the table was soft and charming. Breakfast is on payment per person. Staff was pretty nice :) It was a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: enzian1958
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in two double rooms with our teenagers and it was a hit. As before mentioned, small rooms, but very clean and newly refreshed. We stayed at the fifth floor and had a nice view over Paris and from one room, even the Eiffel tower. The bathrooms were fantastic, breakfast as well, staff very friendly. In the neighborhood there are lots of good restaurants and bars. Specially Al Caratello. A perfect stay in a not very cheap Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: hubx2
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel des Arts based solely on the reviews we had read here on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed! We were delighted with our room (we requested top floor as advised on this site for the breathtaking view of the rooftops) which was small but very cosy and immaculate. And what a view it was!! The bathroom was a good size and very clean. We found the desk staff to be pleasant, friendly and helpful. I was a little disappointed not to have met the 'infamous' Coco the dog (who was away on vac with the owners) as we were missing our own choc lab at home. Breakfast was very good although the eating area can get a little tight when fully occupied. The best part is the location. Right in the heart of beautiful Montmartre and yet our lovely room was so peaceful at night. All in all, would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely return - great value and a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FussyPair2010
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a 4 nights stay in this hotel and I can honestly say it had no faults at all, we have been to Paris a few times now and this is the best hotel by miles. Roll on next year when we can go back. The rooms were a good size, the breakfast was lovely and everywhere in the hotel was spotless. Great location too for getting around on the Metro. Highly recommended by us, and we are quite fussy!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect small hotel for a taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: deanmk
Reviews.Content: For my adult daughter and I, (a sixty year old), this was the perfect place to experience Paris for the first time. The hotel is small, elegant, with a touch of bohemian, comfortable, and with a staff that is helpful and speaks English. They made our four day stay in Paris a wonderful experience. The Des Arts is close to two metro stations, excellent restaurants, cafes, bars, bakeries, markets, shopping and away from the tourist crush. The cobblestone streets and architecture allow you to experience another era. You are only a very fast subway ride to major stops such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, and the Effiel Tower. The room and bath are lovely and clean, the hotel has a computer for your use and an elevator. There is no AC, but we were there in July and never were uncomfortable. This is a wonderful and inexpensive little and very charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC BREAK”
Reviews.Author: chrismaguire
Reviews.Content: WHAT A FANTASTIC FIND.This was my first trip to paris and this wont be my last .The hotel was in a great area resturants cafes and i think the best bakery in france just round the corner.Two metro stations close by so easy access to all the sites of Paris.Breakfast was very continental and well worth the extra money paid.All parts of the hotel were lovely and clean,rooms are nicely decorated and the lift doors are amazing.All staff are very friendly, the two lady receptionist were very nice and didnt mind pointing things out when i was going in wrong direction which happened most days.Looking forward to my next trip and i will be stayin at Des Arts again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: akgarn
Reviews.Content: The location is great - the neighbourhood is lovely with great shops, food and cafes. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms where clean and of a good size. All in all a perfect stay and I would definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: lemon-wilson
Reviews.Content: What a lovely spot in this glorious and central area of Paris. We found the staff very helpful (especially with our repetetive need of a corkscrew!) and English: fine. My only quibble would be the lack of air con: at the height of summer, we needed to sleep with windows open, but given we were on the 5th floor, felt safe enough doing so. This is such an interesting and vibrant area of town, and you can eat here quite cheaply if you're clever, (try the Caribbean/Cajun restaurant up a side street, if I find the name I will re-post), our 9-year old was happy with the crepes and take-away yum-cha cafes! and we only realised after an enforced move how central to Paris we had been. Quite cheap, but not in a nasty way, this one is a budget find!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: shika_sarsorah
Reviews.Content: great location in the heart of Montmartre , near subway , 5 min from moulin rouge , clean rooms Well-coordinated , great stuff always helpful and very friendly the receptionists were polite & the restaurant man(patrick) was very friendly , Breakfast was wonderful . Definitely return and recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carsten7773
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is superb, about 2 min from Abesses Metro station, with plenty of excellent bars, restaurants and stops frequented by locals. We had a beautiful room overlooking Paris. Rooms are, as everywhere else in Paris, small but completely adequate and well furnished. Our (superior) room had a bathrub, flatscreen TV, desk with chair, small safe, enough storage and a very comfortable bed. Staff was friendly, multilingual and even fulfilled extra wishes such as wine glasses and a bottle opener late at night. We appreciated up to date magazines and newspapers on every floor and in the lounge, as well as the free internet via a stylish Mac in the lounge. Even though the hotel was well booked, it was quiet and never felt busy. We did not have breakfast as we preferred to sit in the local cafes. We left with very good memories and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joexx7
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and booked through Expedia as part of flight from Aus. Location is brilliant in the middle of Montmartre with Metro and Moulin Rouge just around the corner. Staff extremely friendly and helpful and room small (normal for Paris) but comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet with fresh baguettes, pastries, boiled eggs, cheeses, cereals etc wasbrilliant. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: artistaME68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Arts was very charming, loved the juke box and all the wonderful pieces of art throughout the hotel. Our room was very clean and the staff very pleasant. The location was great...could enjoy all the wonderful sights in Monmatre. Many wonderful small restaurants and museums in the area...great fun. Would recommend this hotel and hope their experience would be as great as mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: doreymeTTO
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 great nights there, good price, nice rooms, quiet, great location. Definitely return and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Montmartreand Hotel des Arts are a terrific combination.”
Reviews.Author: yundie
Reviews.Content: We thought the reception and breakfast staff were great and very helpful. Wish I could remember names. Breakfast was good. A bit hesitant the first time about taking lunch back to eat in the breakfast room but after that very comfortable. Thank you for being so polite about my attempts to speak in French. A wonderful spot to soak in atmosphere and If you like walking, well....Paris is at your feet. Bed very comfortable and room just big enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: seniorsinparis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great price. The hotel is located near subway and the 'on-off' tour bus. Lots of cafe's nearby, wine shops and baguette shops. The hotel employees are extremely helpful with directions, etc. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, amazing sourrounding”
Reviews.Author: Belze77
Reviews.Content: It was a great trip to Paris for 4 days. The hotel made it to a really familiar journey. Great bars and restaurants are next to the hotel. Thumbs up, we hope to come back one time!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: oieoie
Reviews.Content: this is a "small boutique" hotel in the heart of Montmartre and a short walk to closest Metro station. Our room was comfortable and clean and the staff pleasant and helpful. The breakfast room was a hidden treasure and good value for the price charged. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any one attempting to avoid the larger hotel atmosphere. Our room was across the small courtyard towards the rear of the hotel and offered an unexpected quite and peaceful enviroment and if this is what you seek would recommend your request one of the two rooms there when booking

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: ygrealtor
Reviews.Content: We booked/confirmed two rooms with the following in writing: 1- Smoking room 2- Free wireless internet Upon arrival, we were informed the entire hotel was non smoking. This would not have been an issue if we were simply informed PRIOR to booking. This took away our right to make an informed decision as to if we desired to book this particular hotel or not. We also had confirmed (in writing) the free wireless internet. Upon arrival, we were informed the hotel does not offer free wireless servises and to access the internet, one must either a- Use the lobby computer or 2- Purchase internet access cards at astonomical rates. I suggest the buyer beware of the old bait and switch scandal that we fell prey to.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, luxury and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Tripper2010Australia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our "Splurge" after having camped at a music festival in France...It was so lovely to come to the Hotel and be warmly welcomed and then go up to our amazing room complete with a bath tub! Breakfast was wonderful and great value for money and the staff were always helpful and very friendly, and Monmartre is a fantastic location!! Could not have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Explorer88888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, right in the heart of beautiful Montematre (my favourite part of Paris). 2 metro stations nearby for convenience. Great shops, cafes, restaurants nearby. Rooms were charming and clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful in recommending places to shop or eat.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: DeeH77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few days in March 2009 and I was very impressed - clean, good value, ideal location, quiet. I am returning to Paris for a couple of days in August 2010 and am going to book into the same hotel - hopefully there will still be availability...!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: simonelovestravel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - friendly enough staff, great location. It is clean and well kept. I went here with my boyfriend though, who is fairly tall... and the room was just tiny. The bed was probably queensize at a push, but i wonder if for that price you should get a kingsize bed? If space is not an issue for you, then go for it. You will be in the middle of Montmarte - probably my favourite area of Paris - gorgeous, quaint, and as you will see - space is not ample here anyway! You shouldnt want to be spending much time at the hotel, with all there is to see outside!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised to find such a stylish, charming hotel in the heart of Montmartre, and with a bath too!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyDayUK
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were polite and patient with our rather scatty approach to being in Paris, we didn't have breakfast at the hotel so we cannot comment on that. The room was perfect, we asked for twin beds and that's what we got, the ensuite was exceptionally clean and there is a most welcome lift. The location on rue Tholoze meant that we were pretty centrally located - equidistant from Pigalle, (and all the attractions there!), and Sacre Coeur. Surrounded by bars, cafes and restaurants/ bistros, we were spoilt for choice and we were not too far from the Metro either. All in all we were perfectly happy with all aspects of this charming hotel, perhaps the one bad point were the noisey guests coming in late Sunday night (early hours - probably 4 or 5 in the morning) which disturbed my friends sleep, not a trivial thing, and would urge the hotel staff to ensure that guests remain quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: JTLLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in the heart of Montmartre. A perfect base for exploring the famous and lesser known areas of Paris. It's on a typical Parisian street with a Windmill at one end on the top of the hill. Montmartre is a great area to walk around and soak up the atmosphere. The staff are friendly and helpful and the facilities great - especially liked the room with the retro jukebox! Nearby are several locations used in the film Amelie, including the cafe where she worked. There are also 2 Metro stations within easy walking distance so it's very well connected. Hope I can stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Trisstie
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel for it's location, cleanliness and friendly staff. We stayed in Room 5 which is located at the back of the building on the ground floor and opens onto a small well kept court yard. Although a small room, it was very comfortable, quiet and newly renovated. The hotel atmosphere is very pleasant and everything is just so easy to walk to from this location including the Moulin Rouge, great cafes and restaurants and the beautiful Mont Martre area.

Reviews.Title: “Homely and French!”
Reviews.Author: CazzerL
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for our 4 nights in Paris honeymoon and it was perfect! We didn't get a room with a fantastic view over Paris, but what we got was a room with a view over true Paris. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Montmartre, on a one-way cobbled street, and literally the whole of Paris passes by! We loved being able to watch people travelling past, going about their daily business. The staff were all very friendly in the hotel and very accommodating of our 'pigeon' French. I think they appreciated the fact we tried to speak French. As in other reviews, yes the rooms are quite small, especially the bathrooms, but they are very clean, and very stylish. We particularly liked the wooden shelf above our bed, because we stood up lots of our wedding cards! Breakfast was great, with more than enough items to choose from. We found a superb restaurant in the next street called Cafe Burq which was very reasonable in price and was very 'French'. The food was excellent, and the staff were very friendly. We also went to a local bar called Le Sancerre which was very lively and served fantastic cocktails. The hotel is in a great location for metro stations, although I would recommend a taxi to the station if you can, to avoid lifting suitcases up lots of steps. We loved the homeliness of this hotel, and we loved the numerous paintings on the walls which gave it a very 'French' feeling. We will be returning to Paris and we would love to stay at this hotel again, because of it's location and more importantly its friendly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “had an amazing stay at hotel des arts!”
Reviews.Author: geordie16
Reviews.Content: we loved this quaint, pretty hotel! our welcome was great and were given room 43. not the best view (view of other peoples rooms!) and quite a small room but we were in Paris so weren't planning on spending all day in our room anyway so this was not a problem for us! the room and hotel overall was one of the cleanest i've ever stayed in and being in one of the small back streets on Montmartre it was very quiet and safe. the guy at reception recommended a few restaurants to try and we took his advice and went to "le zebra" which is just down the road and does great pina coladas! we only had breakfast one morning during our stay, which was good but we preferred the local creperies and cafes for breakfast! the sacre couer is a 10 minute walk away from the hotel and the cafes and bars around there were our favourite place to go, such good atmosphere watching all of the artists! we also went to the show at the moulin rogue which is just down the road and it was brilliant! had such a good night and it was such a relief having the hotel at the top of the road rather than having to get the metro with hundreds of other people! overall we would definately recommend this hotel. in my view, Montmartre is the best place to stay in Paris and we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lindale
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to add to all the positives reviews already here! We had a top floor room with a fantastic view We loved: Location Warmth of welcome & friendliness of staff Cleanliness View from our room Breakfast & breakfast room Free use of pc English newspaper On the down side: Rooms small & bathrooms smaller - although rather what you expect in a building like this Lack of hanging space for long garments in our room Really disliked the mattress cover which made us hot, clammy & sticky. Second time in a month we have come across a hotel using this type of cover

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.........................”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide81Broadway
Reviews.Content: I have been to several hotels in Paris of similar standard, but would give this the rating fair. No shower curtains and water went everywhere. The reception/concierge could be better and more interested in their job. It was okay but certainly would not go there again. Suggest people go nearer the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: freedom0957
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Arts is in the heart of Montmartre. It is five minutes walk from Abesses Metro Station so very convenient. When we arrived it was so great to be in small busy strrets with lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. You feel you are in the middle of parisian life as opposed to a tourist area. The hotel is not luxurious but very clean and perfectly adequate for a city break. Our room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was small, with a shower, but clean and funtional. You don't chose this hotel for luxury but for location, and good value for money. Breakfast is included: it is served in a small but well appointed dining room in the basement. It does get crowded. There are plenty of cafes around to have breakfast but it adds to the cost of your stay. We were able to leave our suitcases there when we arrived in the morning and could check n from 12.30. On the last day we left our cases there till it was time to go back to the airport. It is very easy to get to hotel from the airport: RER to gare du Nord then to Blanche or Abesses. We absolutely loved it and will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Savagehenry67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in mid-May and were very satisfied. The location is excellent and we really enjoyed the Montmarte area of Paris. The hotel is on a nice quiet street with several nice cafes, restaurants and bars nearby. The rooms are small, but this did not bother us at all. The hotel's 10 euro breakfast was fine, but if coffee and a croissant is all you are looking for, I recommend venturing out to one of the nearby cafes. It is also very close to a couple Metro stations, so there is easy access to the sites. The only minor drawback about the location is that we had to make a couple transfers on the Metro when we came in from the airport, a little annoying to do with all your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: Caropa
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel. It was clean, quiet, and our room (double superior) had an amazing view, including the Eiffel tower. The only downside, which we sort of expected with a boutique hotel, was the size. It was itty bity, we literally couldnt fit our open suitcases between the bed and the wall. Also, the bed was not the most comfortable, but wasnt awful either.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Florenza60
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. We booked Hotel des Arts after reading about it in Woman & Home a few months ago. Travelled by train from Gloucester to London and then Eurostar - door to door in about 7 hours. Lovely hotel, a stone's throw from the lively and charming street (Rue Lepic/Rue des Abbesses) which has delightful shops and care's. All around is colour - fruit, veg, bakeries and flower shops - cobbled streets - really lovely. It was so relaxing to "come home" to the serene Hotel des Arts after busy days sight seeing. Amazed at the value for money this hotel provides. Friendly. thoughtful staff, neat rooms and great pictures to look at around the hotel. Enjoyed fabulous food in local cafe/bars. A perfect place to stay - wixhed we could have stayed longer - so will just have to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: susan17Staffordshire
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 day stay in the best area of Paris! Convenient for all tourist sites in Paris, easily accessible by metro or on foot. Hotel breakfast excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The sweetest memory of Paris trip”
Reviews.Author: MIKOnERIC
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay made our first trip to Paris so memorable. We were out sightseeing 10 hours a day. Coming back to the hotel was like coming back to our own home!! Quick chat with guys at front desk begging & the end of the day was fun. I especially want to thanks to Patrick at dining room. He was SO nice, ALWAYS answer our question & giving great advice how to get there & Paris's histories etc... We were looking forward to enjoy breakfast at the cutest room & talk to him before the long walking day!!! Thanks Patrick!! We miss you SO MUCH!!! We absolutely LOVE the area!! There is a bakery, you go down the hill from the hotel then make RIGHT. 4~5 doors down, apple green wall. Their baggette sandwich is out of this world. About 3~4 euro. Young girl works there speaks English & helped us everyday. You will see people lined up all day at this bakery. Also,there is yummy & cheap Crepe stand across street. Open till 10pm or later on weekend ( even Sunday). I loved his Ham, cheese & mushroom crepe!! 4.5 euro!! If you need something real CHEAP & nice to bring back home for your coworker, go down to MONOPRIX super market across street of Blanche metro station!! 5 minutes walking from hotel. there is 2 entrance, one for drug store & on your left is for the clothing. Downstairs of clothing section is grocery store. They have this yummy MONOPRIX brand chocolate packed of 3, for just 2 euro!!! We bought 2 packs ( meaning 6 bar of chocolate) for my coworkers. wish we bought more!!! They are yummy!!! If you want to mingle with locals for beer, go up the hill for 1/2 block from hotel. There is corner bar across from " Comfort inn". 1 pint of beer for 3 euro. & VERY local atmosphire going on!! if you bring your smile, they will give you nice smile & treat you like a local!!! ( but if you are looking for fancy french thing, this is not for you ) Also, you pass this bar & keep going stay on LEFT. you will find Apartment where Piccasso, Modigliani and all kinds of artist used to live ( their art studio). called Bateau-lavoir, keep going for another 1/2 block on your left, you will see a small squire. There is window of " Bateau-Lavoir". you will see all artist list who lived this street. Hotel Des Arts are truly wonderful place to stay. You really feel that you are in Paris!!! I LOVED the fact that you have to drop /pick up your room key from the desk, so you will remember YOU!! That made us feel like we are welcomed all the time. I can not wait to go back to paris & stay there again!! Thanks guys at front desk. especially Charles & Camile !!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel des Arts in Montmartre is a real find!”
Reviews.Author: LumixLeica
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Hotel des Arts through online 'research' and after staying there for seven nights followed later by another night we can attest that this is a wonderful hotel, and hotel experience. The location is perhaps one of the best in Paris for those who wish to feel the essence of this charming city, and even within Montmartre it is close to essentials like a laundromat, banks, good yet reasonable eateries, without being right in the path of tourists swarming to the SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur Basilica or Moulin Rouge. The included breakfast was excellent. There will be people who need more elbow room in their rooms and/or better access for those less agile (and we could be among that group some day), but if you can do it, we highly recommend you include the Hotel des Arts among your serious considerations.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel With French Charm & Character!”
Reviews.Author: StevoSW
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for a couple of days in Paris. The location is great because you can literally walk out of the hotel and into a street with wonderful cafes and bars, shops etc and then down the road about 1-2 mins is the Blanches Metro station which takes you everywhere. The room was very clean and up to date with a lovel fully opening window. The bathroom was excellent and very modern. For some reason there was no shower holder or shower curtain, but all the bathroom fittings were very modern and worked well so as long as you are careful in the shower that this is OK. They even give toiletries which is a nice touch and not given in all independant hotels. Check in was nice and friendly, you need to give in your key each time you go out here, but thats fine. I also used as much french as I could when staying here and they appreciated me trying as many other cafes, shops and bars do, which adds to the fun being away from home. Otherwise there is no point being away! Breakfast was OK, I wouldn't go mad about it but what you do get is pretty fresh and as much as you want. The coffee was not so good but then it was from an urn. For the second day we had breakfast in a bakery. Oddly the hotel at check out said we had breakfast both days! This however was taken off the bill when we explained we didn't eat it both days. The TV in the room was nice, a medium size flatscreen, only french channels, so Americans will be disapointed, but then you have to bear in mind you can always stay at the Marriott if you want to imagine you are in Dixyland. Bed was comfy, nice sheets and pilllows good, with a room safe and hangers and closet space a pleanty. This hotel does not have a bar but there is a small vending machine with soft drinks and Toblerones! We went to shops nearby for wine etc anyway. There is a lounge area off reception, really lovely with leather armchairs, large flatscreen tv and jukebox with CDs, free of charge, also a free of charge I-mac for using the net. This was very useful for going online. All in all we had a great stay here and would come back in a shot. It is very hard finding a hotel in Paris that is central and has good standards at a reasonable rate. We did use the booking.com website and this gave a good rate. The Zebra of Monmatre bar and restaurant at the end of the road was fantastic, also there were some other great restaurants further down the road which we visited. Just take a look in the window for the menus, if they seem very french in their approach and full of French people, you are onto a good thing! Avoid anywhere where the menu is translated into several different langauges, you will get ripped off and be eating gunk. If you want a lovely stay in a genuine French hotel with genuine non tourist trash cafes and bars next to it, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: 051610a
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, room was clean & tidy, comfy bed, clean bathroom, plenty of closet space, very well priced, great location, all staff were pleasant & helpful, Caramel is just adorable, we stayed here 6 nights & would love to stay here again if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect tiny little room"”
Reviews.Author: KJoyWright
Reviews.Content: Tiniest little elevator, it was you or your luggage. Tiny little spiral staircase. Wonderful fresh fruit and french bread breakfast, perect hot chocolate for those of us who do not like coffee (we do exist). Very tiny room but it had all we needed including a lovely view.of the rest of the Ile San Luis. I think we stayed in the attic. I traveled with my elderly Mother to a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charming room”
Reviews.Author: siobhan25Uk
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 nights at the Hotel des Arts. We enjoyed being in the heart of Montmartre and the hotel was a serene base to come back to. We stayed in room 46 which had a balcony overlooking the rooftops - very atmospheric. The room was spotless and comfortable. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - there are numerous gorgeous bakeries nearby where you can pick up perfect pain au chocolat for a Euro. Would recommend Le Miroir restaurant near the hotel (you need to book) - bit cramped but the food was sublime and good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Londonlady57
Reviews.Content: I'm about to stay at the Hotel des Arts for the fourth or fifth time. It's in a perfect location and it's friendly and comfortable and feels French and nothing like an anonymous chain.

Reviews.Title: “loved paris, loved monmartre, loved hotel des arts”
Reviews.Author: marganrob
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, its ideally situated near to Sacre Coeur & the Moulin Rouge & the metro. We had a super 4 night stay. The room was very clean & the staff very helpful.Breakfast was excellent & we were looked after well by Patrick. I was quite wary about making our own way to Paris but we had no problems.The metro is so easy but the staff were on hand if we needed help. Loved the paintings in the hotel & on the lift doors! The hotel is on a quiet street but in a very lively area, we especially enjoyed the atmosphere at night, walk up to Sacre Coeur & the whole of Paris is in front of you-Stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Charming,warm and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: bethhanlon
Reviews.Content: My second stay in two years - why book anywhere else when you've experienced near perfection? When my travelling companion had to cancel due to a bereavement I knew I would have no worries about staying at the hotel and rediscovering La Butte solo. The manager moved me to a wonderful room with a balcony - an oasis of tasteful decor and calm. I didn't have breakfasts this time because I decided to go to a locals' cafe - Le Village. Best find of this stay was Le Musee de Montmartre and the vineyard. A close second was the arthouse cinema Studio 28 opposite with its beautiful colourful lights. A very good hotel location for a special occasion - I previously stayed for my 50th birthday. The staff are all extremely polite and helpful - unlike some other experiences I had in rip-off Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_of_Ashby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel des Arts for 3 nights over Easter. Firstly the hotel was clean, smart and best of all well located. Away from the tourist tat of Place du Tertre, this hotel is located on what is the local high street of south west Montmartre, close to Blanche Metro stop, and within yards of shops, bars and restaurants. At night it is fairly quite, our room was at the front on the 5th floor. The rooms are smallish, ours was a superior double and was adequate, the other single and double rooms look very small. Breakfast was OK with a reasonable selection on offer plus the usual hard boiled eggs and croissants. Ovearll highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: triumphnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Des Arts for a short 4 night break. My girlfriend didn't know but I had planned to propose to her on this trip. I had a tight budget and wanted to stay in Montmartre as it has a true village feel and you can be absorbed into a part of everyday Paris life. The boutique Hotel Des Arts seemed the perfect place and I booked with them over the internet. The hotel was more than we had hoped. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly, breakfast was simple continental buffet but great value for Paris. Our room, while small, was perfectly comfortable. The Sacre Coeur is just a short walk away and a few minutes walk to the metro and you are a short journey away from all of the sights of Paris. We treated ourselves to a show at the Moulin Rouge which is also just a short walk away from the hotel. We travelled on Eurostar and the hotel is no more than 30 minutes away from the Gare Du Nord. We will return to Paris and will stay in the Hotel Des Arts. My now Fiancee even said she will ask for the same room when we stay again. A perfect trip in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: chester98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hoel Des Arts Montartre right in the heart of Moulin Rouge. The hotel location is fantastic, if you want a real bit of Paris stay here. The Cafe's and restaurants will blow you away, you'll really feel like you're in Paris and not some tourist location. The hotel is simple but very clean, the staff are great, Charlie was very friendly on reception during night duty, we only saw him on heading back to the hotel room at night. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel we ventured out and hung out with the locals which was fantastic and I can say they were all so friendly and very accommodating. If you want France in a Nutshell, we stayed in Paris for 3 nights and could have easily stayed another 2 nights. I seriously recommend the restaurant at the very top of the street on the left called, Bistro Lepicurien opposite a pub, the menu is on a blackboard and in French of course but the waitress speaks excellent English better than my French and was really helpful, this place was simply divine, I could have eaten here every night, the setting and the whole ambyance was delightful. We'll be visiting again when we get the chance albeit far from Australia. If you've chosen to stay at this hotel and location you'll have a great time, the atmosphere of the whole area is amazing you'll know exactly what I mean when you stay - one of the best overseas holiday's I've had. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “if you go to paris go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelchesterfield
Reviews.Content: a very clean and warm hotel very good breakfast and only 5 minutes from the metro station and the moulon rouge plenty of cafes and bars lots of shops. 10 minutes walk to the sacare coure ,look out for the man running through the wall.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ezekielette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon and it was a wonderful base to explore Paris. Located in the funky Montmatre area, it is a wonderful place to sightsee. We were on the fourth floor (there's either stairs or an ittybitty lift) and the room was lovely. Double bed with TV, chair and desk, radiator, and clean bathroom with bath (no shower) and hairdryer. The room was very clean and serviced daily and very warm! When we arrived our room wasn't ready but we sat in the lounge and they got us some drinks. There is free internet downstairs in the lounge and the included breakfast was wonderful! Breads and pastries, toast, hams and cheese, cereals, teas, coffee, juice, it was a wonderful way to start the morning. The Montmartre area is a great location; the beautiful Sacre Couer is a 10 minute (hilly) walk and every morning the local artists are out displaying their works. There was the most delightful restaurant just up the road and lots of local shops and restaurants around. There is plenty to explore in the local area, and it is about a 40 minute walk to the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower, but there are a lot of train stations around as well (but we loved to walk everywhere.) The staff were friendly and helpful with us trying to learn some French! I would definately recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel for my first visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: nybt
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff was excellent. Everyone seemed to speak English which was a big help. The rooms were so clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 4th floor and was able to look out over the rooftops. I enjoyed the breakfast although the crossants outside of the hotel were better. The breakfast room gets really crowded around 9 oclock so try to go a little early. The location was great. We took the train from the airport. Took the B line RER train from Charles De Gaulle transferred to the Metro number 2 line going in the direction of Port Dauphine and then got off at the Blanche stop and walked to the hotel. There is a computer in the lobby but I could not send out email. There are many crepe stands, bakeries and restaurants in the area. Upon arrival we left our luggage untli our room was ready and went out to see the sights and partake of the many pastries. This area is near the redlight district.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, edgy small hotel in Montmartre area”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Providence
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool place...great artwork, great interior design, very clean and recently updated rooms....and a 5 to 10 minute walk to Sacre Coeur. When we arrived, we unexpectedly brought a friend of my daughters up from Tours. In spite of being overcrowded that weekend, they went out of their way to accomodate her.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy hotel in brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Racheybabes31
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my mum for 5 nights in March 2010. We had a twin room which was a decent size although the bathroom was tiny but the shower excellent! Our room looked out onto an internal 'courtyard' so there was no view but att least it was quiet. The breakfast was good - croissants, danish pastries, cereal, bread, yoghurts, eggs, cheese, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and fruit juices. The location was amazing - a 5 minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. I'd recommend an evening on the Rue des Abesses (just at the end of Rue Thorloze). There are loads of little bards and cafes and it's good to people watch!! Staff at the hotel very friendly and helpful with any questions. All in all a brilliant base to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Room”
Reviews.Author: WelshTan
Reviews.Content: We had a superiour double and were not disappointed. Superb location. Lovely clean hotel, Best hotel to stay at in the area if you want to stay around montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Got such warm feeling staying there in a snowing period of Paris”
