Reviews.Author: BerryNi24
Reviews.Content: It's the first trip for us to Europe and Paris was our first stop. It was definitely a good stay there. Quite convenient (couple of minutes) walking from Metro. Quiet street, and the room is really nice and comfortable. Staffs are really nice and helpful. It's just maybe the buffet breakfast (10 Euro/person) slightly expensive. Overall, I really like the detail decoration even for the elevators - although its tiny :P The black cute doggy of the hotel also very friendly showing the culture of the hotel itself, ha :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missieelliott
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and had a fantastic time. Hotel is very clean, staff are friendly and helpful and hotel is great valus for money. Fabulous location for the tube and loads of sightseeing!! Rooms are cosey but comfortable and clean. Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nthrop
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and so I was unsure what to expect, but I couldn't have been happier. The Hotel is lovely and in a delightful area of Paris that is bustling with lots of great bistros, restaurants and shops, as well as having many cultural highlights on its doorstep (such as the Sacre Coeur). The hotel room was comfortable and clean, and very quiet, so no disturbed nights sleep, which is exactly what you want after a hard day seeing all the sights Paris has to offer! Really convenient for the metro to get you everywhere you need to go, although also not too far to walk into the centre of Paris if on a leisurely walk as we were one day. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. All in all a lovely trip. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: jetsettagranny
Reviews.Content: Great Service, clean and good value. Good location halfway up the butte of Montmartre. I managed to get to and from Sacre Ceour with only about 8 stairs. Pleasant walk to Metro past some wonderful eateries and charming boutiques. Rooms are small but comfortable. I booked well in advance and secured a double room, which was great for solo traveller with 2 suitcases. Original artworks in stairwell and rooms adds a lovely touch. Can't comment on breakfast as chose to use local bakeries for Parisien Breakfast. Will definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area, quiet street, good service”
Reviews.Author: skulmartin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street in a lovely area - Montmartre - convenient for Sacre Coeur and good cafes and restaurants as well as for for travelling by metro to other areas. Our room and bathroom were spotless; the staff were helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Barbiegoyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Hotel Des Arts and the previous positive TripAdvisor reviews are right on the money. The hotel website pictures are what you actually get! We stayed in room 12 on the 2nd floor overlooking the street. Really cute twin room - small but completely comfortable. Montmartre is a lively, busy area so some street noise. Didn't affect us as it was cool and we mostly kept the windows closed. Could see this as a problem in the heat of summer with no air conditioning if you had to keep the windows open. Very "French" hotel - cute, cozy, clean and well kept. Staff were helpful with directions and questions. Didn't eat in the breakfast room as there are so many restaurants and bars in the area so cannot comment on this. The streets are narrow and cobblestoned and the hotel is a walk up a 2 block hill. A caution on getting there - DO NOT get off at the Abesses Metro station if you have luggage! At least 10 short flights of stairs! Tough enough just walking up them let alone bogged down with luggage although this is the closest station and only 1 block uphill to the hotel. We mostly used the Blanche station at the bottom of the main street. Was much easier to navigate. We didn't find the distance to the main attractions an issue at all. Used the Metro for all our travel and only 20 minutes or so to all the attractions. We even came back one afternoon for a rest and back out again at night. We went to some different areas and I am really glad we stayed in this area. The hotel computer was put to good use and although we had to wait our turn a couple of times, it was all working our entire stay and definitely helpful. Would definitely stay here again and hope we can return to France one day. A great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NichaUk
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a stay at Hotel Des Arts and would definitely return. We emailed the hotel before arrival and our questions were handled promptly. We requested a room facing onto the street on a higher floor and were very pleased when the hotel was able to accommodate us. We were in room 51 (5th floor) which was a double room with shower, it turns out this was a superior room so we'd been given an upgrade (what a nice surprise!). Both room and bathroom were a good size, the shower I must say was fabulous, plenty of hot water and room for 2! Breakfast (7am-10am) was included in our room rate but would be â‚¬10pp if not. The continental breakfast included juice, cereal, pastries, bread, jams, boiled eggs, fruit (tinned), plenty enough to get your day off to a good start. Nice breakfast room. This hotel is in a great location, Montmartre has a great vibe about it with the lovely cobbled streets. It's outside the main centre of Paris but easily reached by Metro. You have access to two stations within a 5 min walk, Abbesses (turn right out of the hotel then left at the bottom of the road and just follow) or Blanche (turn right of the hotel, right at the bottom on the road and immediate left onto Rue Lepic and follow to the bottom of the hill). You can buy a Carnet of tickets for â‚¬11.60, 10 single journeys. The hotel is also only 10 minute's from Gare Du Nord. There are many restaurants near by and I will be writing reviews, but we'd definitely recommend 'Le Durer' (19, Rue Yvonne-Le-Tac) and say avoid ' Des si et des mets' (63 Rue Lepic).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: canucks0707
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel des Arts in Montmartre north of Paris, 18th arrondissement for 7 days and it's a nice one. Close to lots of shops and cafes. Even close to Blanche Metro station only 2 blocks away. Our room was small but cozy. Only minor flaw was the bathroom was the bathtub with no shower curtain leaving us to mop up using towels, and no meals allowed inside the room. Free internet access in the foyer but we hardly used it. Overall a good stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in marvellous area”
Reviews.Author: Nigelinleicester
Reviews.Content: I fully agree with the many positive reports on this hotel. It is clean, well run, with a very helpful staff. We had two rooms, one double, one twin-bedded, on the first floor. Niether was enormous, but they were not cramped. One had a small shower, the other had a hand held shower with a bath. It wouldn't take much to turn that into a proper shower over the bath, I suppose. But more importantly there was ample hot water, the rooms were well maintained, and we were not disturbed by roads, people in the street or other hotel users. The area is vibrant and, although Montmartre is clearly a tourist honeypot, the area round the hotel is not over-touristed and feels like "real" Paris - lots of cafes and restaurants, a little popular cinema across the road from the hotel, but also some excellent local shops - see the fishmongers at the junction of Rue des Abbesses and Rue Lepic for instance - long queues on a Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeardoAustralia
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent 4 night stay at the Hotel des Arts. We found the room to be very clean and located within an easy 5minute walk of Blanche Metro station. The staff where helpful from check-in to check-out. The hotel is only minutes away from restaurants and shops. The bathroom is tiny but clean and our room had a balcony. There is free internet in the reception lounge and a shuttle bus to the airport if needed. The only downside is that you are not able to eat in the room, therefore all meals must be eaten in cafes. Thoroughly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant from Start to Finish!”
Reviews.Author: swimmingotta
Reviews.Content: It only cost us 9Euro from the Nord Train station. Check in was simple and easy. The room was brilliant. The staff were really helpful with everything and were happy to call a taxi for us when we left at the of our stay. The room was magnificent, although in saying this we were in a much better room than we paid for, they were full most of the nights so we think that we were upgraded... The Breakfast room was well staffed and clean. There were a number of pastries and juices on offer, but the fruit let a little to be desired, canned fruit, and not great quality. The area the hotel is in is perfect for those who are happy to use the Metro system, although we did walk from to the Eiffel tower on our first night, which took just over an hour, with stopping along the way. They provide maps of Paris and the Metro if you ask. There is a computer hidden in the foyer, but we never used it. We would recommend the hotel to anyone, although the bath did not have a shower curtain so we did have to mop up water after use, and you are not allowed to eat in your room...... Not that it stopped us in all honesty. You are moments away from a Metro stop, which services or connects to great locations, the quickest street to the Moulin Rouge is lined with shops, bakeries, patisseries who were all happy to put up with out poor French and spoke enough English to get by.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: davidpatmore
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are well furnished and clean, and the location is characterful - being opposite the first cinema to open in Paris and still operating has to be a big plus. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: elinalag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many 3-star hotels in Paris over the years, but none compares to Hotel des Artes. I booked the hotel from the Eurostar website, along with my train tickets from London, and got an amazing price. My stay at the hotel was excellent. The location is spot on, especially if you like the bohemian atmosphere of Montmartre. There are many nice places to eat and have a drink around. My room was quite spacious for a single room, quiet and warm enough when outside the temperature was 0 oC Celsius. What I liked most was the chillout lounge where the manager sets the right mood by playing sweet jazz and soul on the jukebox. Mind you, he is very competent and friendly in other areas too, like helping guests connect to the Internet via the free WiFi (although this Internet speed was quite slow). All in all, my experience was very positive and since I came back I recommended the hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Zdanowicz
Reviews.Content: It was the first time i have been to Paris and this hotel was great. The Hotel was good value for money, we had a nice room and it was situated in a great location. The room was not huge but big enough for us with a very comfortable double bed. The room had a closet, TV, safe deposit box and a very clean bathroom with shower. Breakfast was not included and was 10 euros per person, we never ate breakfast here as we found cheaper options in cafes around the hotel that were prettier and very tasty. The Montmartre area that the hotel is situated is excellent. It has alot of great bars, cafes and restaurants close by. Also the metro station is a couple of minutes walk so you are connected to the whole of Paris. If you want to see Paris by day and return to your hotel area at night for dinner and drinks then there is no better area to stay. I will be returning and recommending this area and the Hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: DixieCardiff
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in an excellent location. Friendly and helpful staff, nice and comfortable (though a bit small) room, free wifi (though had a problem with it on my laptop so used the PC in reception). Great cafes and restaurants nearby (recommend Chez Toinette in Rue G Pilon) and Sacre Coeur very close by. I was here on business but would definitely bring a friend for a leisure trip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Homely hotel with excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Niknboo
Reviews.Content: After reading more favourable than otherwise reviews we decided to plump for this little hotel as our base for a few days in Paris. We are pleased that we did. The staff were extremely helpful and speak very good English. The room was not as small as we expected and spotlessly clean It was quite noisy at night if you're at the front of the hotel, but the atmosphere in the area (and earplugs) more than made up for it. They made sure that we felt welcome and helped us navigate our way around the City. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: krs00
Reviews.Content: After reading excellent reviews on this hotel, we were very disappointed with our stay. The room is tiny and you don't even have room for your legs when sitting on the toilet. The wifi internet system was barely working and the service is not good at all. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSGUsa
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Paris, Montmartre is the only place to stay. Sitting on top of the hill near Sacre-Coeur, Montartre is in the artist district with beautiful cobble stone streets and cozy cafes. Hotel Des Arts is in the heart of Montmartre. No matter where your sight seeing day takes you, you will always want to come back home to Montmartre. The staff was always so helpful with directions and how to use the Metro. The rooms were very clean and well Maintain through out our stay. All the staff were warm & freindly and made our holiday very memorable. I would highly recommend Hotel Des Arts. The three things I look for in a hotel are Location, Cleaniness, & Price. Hotel Des Arts exceeded in all three.

Reviews.Title: “If we can get back to Paris - we'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: NelPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 yr old daughter and I stayed at Des Arts en route to UK. It's a great spot between the Moulin Galette at the top of the street, and the Moulin Rouge one street down. In a very real part of Paris, Des Arts used to be a dormitory for the Can Can girls of the Moulin Rouge. Within walking distance are the Place du Tertre, the Sacre Couer, Le Lapin Agile - and a choice of two metro stations not far away (don't use Abbesses loaded with suitcases) and we thought it was a great spot. The staff were friendly and helpful, before and during our stay - and the dog is gorgeous! There are plenty of local cafe's in the streets up to and in the Place de Tertre (beware the artists - and flower sellers - pushy doesn't begin to describe it!) and along the Rue de Abbesses. It's not close to the Seine or Champs Elysees, but you can walk it. It is a very compact city and is fun to explore with a map. We walked (mostly) from our hotel, to Sacre Couer, to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, to the Louvre, the Place de Concorde and up the Champs Elysees to the Arc de Triomph in one day. It was cold, it rained, it snowed and we loved it! (We did get the metro back!) It is on a steep street though so if you have any problem with knees or fitness - go elsewhere. We loved that it's a busy street, it felt 'French' and that's what we wanted! We were in a triple - and granted the rooms aren't big - but unless you pay way more than we could ever afford, all rooms in Paris are small aren't they? We've stayed in smaller rooms in Paris - and on our honeymoon had the worst bed in the world - but it's Paris! We loved it at des Arts and would love to go back - but next time on the top floors so we can have a view. It seems to me that the main complaints come from USA. It's Paris - it's part of its charm - don't be so picky! We had absolutely NO complaints. Linda, Trev and Katie Kemp.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a lively part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: york1807
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and the place matched up to expectations. The rooms and associated bathrooms are not large but big enough for us on a 3 night trip to Paris. The place is clean with modern decorations and the continental breakfast was a little more than you sometimes get in France. The location is great, being between Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge and just off the lively Rue Des Abbesses, and there are a couple of Metro stations within 500m to let you get to the rest of the sights of Paris. Its on the hill of Montmartre so the price of the view from Sacre Coeur is a little strain on the legs ( unless you cheat by using the funicular) It isn't in the centre of the city but there is plenty going on in the area and a range of restaurants available in walking distance - Le Petit Parisien restaurant just up the Rue Tholoze was fine but there are many others. In terms of value for money in Paris this hotel was just what we wanted

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: talulaP
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small (well 50 rooms!!) family hotel really nicely put together, in the heart of the artistic montmartre. Staff all really helpful and rooms nice and clean. lovely breakfast. A real pleasure in a nice quiet side street next the hub of cafe's and eateries nice bakery etc. Sacre Coeur really close via a lovely walk (esp in the evening). Loved it loved it loved it. And they have a lovely dog Caramel who often is found asleep in reception (lovely dog even if your not keen)

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed for a good price”
Reviews.Author: queenoftheirish
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal on this hotel by booking online. Our room was clean, cosy (but not really small), nicely decorated and most importantly given the freezing cold - it was toasty warm. The bathroom was clean and the shower head on the bath taps had excellent pressure and was more than sufficient. The staff were okay, not memorably nice but not rude either. The location was quite good, although I would probably stay in the Le Marais area again as that's where we kept ending up! But overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: Aussie60
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and excellent service. Rarely have i stayed in a hotel that is better value for money. We wanted a hotel that was close to cafes and the mainstream of Arts and Hotel was perfect for this. We did not take up the breakfast option as we wanted to try something new each day in the numerous French cafes, and who can resist the local bread, with numerous fillings. If there was one thing that i did find strange that the record was disallowed in the eating room. I have never seen this before and must admit to snaking a few biscuits and cheese into the room to eat with a glass of local plonk. A great experience, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DandNEdmonton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Des Arts from Dec 27 - 31, 2009. The hotel was everything that we expected. The location is excellent although one thing should be mentioned - the nearest Metro stops are Abesses or Blanche. If you are lugging your suitcases, do not arrive at the the Abbesses stop. The station is quite high on Montemarte which means that you have to climb a LOT of stairs to get to the surface. Better to change to line 2 at Pigalle and get off at Blanche. Or just get off at Pigalle and walk - very interesting stroll along Blvd. de Clichy. Our room was quite spacious by Parisian standards and the hotel was very clean and well kept. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, each morning we would go to the creperie at the bottom of the street where my wife would have chocolate crepes and I would have a "super antipaso sandwich". After that we would usually go up the street (rue des Abesses) a short way and relax with an espresso at a sidewalk table. We did a lot of dining while we were there. Three restraurants I would recommend: first "Le Durer" on rue Yvonne-le-Tac - we eat there every time we are in Paris, a small restaurant with outstanding food, near the base of the furnicular to Sacre Cour. The other two were recommended by the hotel: "La Pomponnette" at 42 rue Lepic (follow rue des Abesses to the right around the corner) and "Le Moulin de la Galette" at 83 rue Lepic (go to the top of rue Tholoze and turn right). This was the perfect hotel for our Christmas vacation in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely independent Montmartre hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggalright
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little Montmartre hotel so close the great bars and restaurants. It is very quaint but the hotel is a more excellent condition than that description would suggest. The rooms are lovely and the corridors/stairs remind you why you chose this one not faceless multinational chain. Didn't try breakfast but it's not as if you are stuck for nice places to eat. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel especially if purchased in a package with Eurostar. Oh yes, Moulin Rouge is a 5 min walk down the street but you wouldn't know it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: juliabraik
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, the location was perfect and the hotel itself was comfortable, clean and very nicely decorated. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing first stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dansanHaverhill
Reviews.Content: The service was good, the room neat, but he manager and some staff were rude and condescending, not helpful in follow through. We had a room next to a street so it was noisy all the time. The manager in particular was rude and not at all helpful both during our stay and in correspondence later. The hotel was actually in a poor location away from many major sites whcih makes for too much time traveing mainly on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: oceanswell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts is on a quiet side street in Montmartre - a lovely, comfortable, clean hotel with a nice continental breakfast room downstairs. It's within walking distance to all the sites in Montmartre and access to several metro lines are a quick 5-10 min walk away. A quick ride on the metro brings you to the heart of Paris in barely another 10 minutes. Although within the tourist/sex shop section of Paris, it's still feels like you're in a cozy neighborhood - especially if you're lucky to be there on a Sunday when the fresh food and flower vendors line the street and families are out doing their shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a cultural identity, easy location, friendly staff, well designed breakfast menu..."”
Reviews.Author: Nettie2009
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in the 5th or 6th in Paris but this time we had to prefer 18th in order to be close to a group of friend and without doubt we choose Des Arts as it has a good reputation... We never regretted for this preferance after a four days long stay... Besides its cultural identity its friendly and careful staff made us very happy whenever we needed their help... On top that the breakfast menu which costs 10 â‚¬/pp was really good and comparing to the cafes around that serves breakfast was so wonderful. I must underline the high quality of coffee they serve... These are the positive impressions... The relatively less negative impressions might be mentioned as the minor technical problems such as not properly working ventilation system in the bathroom (we stayed in Room No:3; Jacques Prevert room in the first floor which looks at an very sympatethic inner court ) and the bath-tube that cannot easily let the water go!... Thank you Alain and all the team...

Reviews.Title: “c'est super”
Reviews.Author: SuperHan
Reviews.Content: our stay was lovely, the staff were helpful and the breakfast was tasty. Our room was a bit on the small side but very comfortable and warm (too hot sometimes but that's what windows are for). Nice clean ensuite facilities with a great shower, but again a little on the small side, the general area felt safe at nightime and it wasn't too far from hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,friendly staff,spotless,rooms larger than the norm for Paris”
Reviews.Author: CorkBelle
Reviews.Content: Five friends had a three night stay here .The hotel was recommended to us, and we would recommend it without hesitation. The rooms were excellent and when we requested to be moved to a lower floor there was no problem.The area around the hotel is lovely , lots of nice restaurants and cafes.very near Sacre Coeur and Place du Tertre, in the heart of Montmartre

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small Hotel. Great for Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: JGLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: I'd happily recommend this Hotel for a short break in Montmartre. We found the staff friendly and happy to speak english. Our room (62) perfectly spacious, quiet and clean. Breakfast buffet more than adequate. Their special website price was as cheap as any other.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pierregy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to spend the night after a show at the Moulin Rouge as well as provinding us with sightseeing opportunintes to Montmartre and it had to be walking distance from the Metro. This hotel did all that very well. Clean small room and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend away”
Reviews.Author: lisehayward
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nigths and 3 days in Paris and was very happy with our choice of hotel! Perfectly located in Montmartre to experience everything the area offers and also only 5 mins walk away for Abbesses and Blanche Metro stations. The rooms were extremely clean and tidy and staff were always extremely accomodating and helpful. I would recommend the Hotel des Arts to any of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “location location!”
Reviews.Author: meem0
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is just amazing! it is just as i pictured paris...cobble stone streets lined with cafes and bakeries! it was just lovely! the sacre scour was a short walk away and was BREATHTAKING! the hotel room was small but clean and adequate. we were suppose to be given a superiour room but the sign on our door stated our room was a standard double..my husband didnt want to bother with the hassel of bringing it up so we just stayed. all in all it was clean but the bathroom too small. we enjoyed the free wi fi that was provided...A BIG PLUS. but again the best part of the stay was the location...after a long day we would drop our things at home and stay up the rest of the night at one of the cafes right down the street. small room or bathroom ( a norm i hear in paris) is easily forgotten once you get to walk around montmarte!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel in a convenient Montmartre location”
Reviews.Author: Lin70
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel in a great location in the heart of Montmartre, just a 5 minute walk from the Metro. A clean and well maintained room, with a more spacious bathroom than you often find at this price. Good breakfast in an attractive breakfast room in the cellar. Internet, international newspapers and a jukebox with some classic tracks in the lobby. Friendly helpful staff. My only disappointment was not getting a room with a view of Montamrtre rooftops as I had requested.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of Montmatre”
Reviews.Author: Margaret L
Reviews.Content: Located in a tall characterful building in a quiet steep street just below one of the Montmatre windmills. We had a double and a twin bedded room for 2 nights on the 5th floor (luckily with a lift/elevator), with a view over Parisian rooftops. Not spacious but well furnished and well cared for. The only slight quibble was that there was no shower curtain for the over-bath shower, but that was more the hotel's problem than mine ! The breakfast was served in the basement, in a room filled with local artwork. A good range of breakfast foods. The reception staff were consistently helpful and spoke good English. A word of warning: if you order a taxi through the hotel, the meter starts from the time of the phonecall ... Much better to use the nearby Metro station of Abbesses if you can , a 5 min walk away. .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Lovely, Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pingoogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on the day of our wedding anniversary. As our flight arrived quite early, Alain was very kind to have us leave our bags until our room is ready for check-in. After walking around the streets of Montmarte for awhile, the hotel allowed us to check-in before the actual check-in time. Honestly, my expectations for hotels in Europe are low as most would tell us that they are quite expensive, basic and small. However, when we entered our room, I was very pleased and happy with what I saw. Well actually, I was more excited like a wide eyed child seeing a big box of chocolates. The room was very pretty, charming with two windows where all the sunshine went through. And then I saw the big arrangement of flowers and the bottle of champagne that my husband had secretly requested from the hotel before we left for Paris. I actually made the reservations for our whole trip so I'm not sure how Karine and my husband managed to pull off the whole thing without my knowledge, given that I could be quite nosy at times. We were given a beautiful room, a great surprise treat on our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful stay. The hotel also has a small area where you can lounge or use the internet which is very helpful. I had also booked the stay for my mother, grandmother, aunt and uncle whose stay at the hotel was a week prior to us. My mom would communicate to me via email (using the hotels computer) and was very pleased because the neighborhood is safe, close to everything and yet the hotel was situated in a quiet location. There are two metro stations close to the hotel which would be Blanche and Abbesses so getting around the city would not be a problem. Sacre Coeur is also a few minutes away which is situated at the top where you can see Paris and all its glory and of course, the Eiffel Tower. One tip that you shouldn't miss though is that starting around 9:00 every hour thereafter (or maybe earlier in late fall and winter). The Eiffel Tower shines with glittery white lights like fireworks (apart from its usual yellowish light) for about 10 - 15 minutes. Where would be a better location to view this spectacle from but from Sacre Coeur. It was our first time in Paris and the stay at the hotel surely made our wedding anniversary trip memorable. Will definitely stay here again in the future. Thank you to the staff of Hotel des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “A Quaint Hotel In The Heart Of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: tell_me_all_about_it
Reviews.Content: I've managed to find this little gem wonderfully located in the heart of Montmartre & also thanks to Tripadvisorâ€™s many positive reviews, weâ€™d decided to go ahead with the booking & have enjoyed every bit of our stay during Sept 20 to 22. After a long & tiring drive from Germany, upon arrival Karine was there to greet us & directed us where to park our car for the next 3 days. With a 5 minutes walk located at Rue Caulaincourt just next to Mercure & Ibis Hotels, the overnight parking lot was safe & at 1â‚¬/hr it's considered cheaper than some others we've checked in Montmartre area. We've booked a superior room & requested for a room with a view & indeed they live up to our request. The elevator only stopped on the 5th floor, just a short walk along the hallway & up a short flight of spiral stairs to the attic & our room for the next 2 nights, room 60. Although the room was small but it was adequate for us, no air-condition just a window with a great view of low Parisian buildings & the Eiffel Tower from afar. The bathroom was clean, well supplied with a bathtub, a showerhead & a wall mounted retractable clothesline but just one set back there was no shower curtain. The hotel is conveniently located in a very nice & lively neighborhood near to many cafes, restaurants, boulangeries, patisseries, grocery stores & shops. With Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge, Metro Des Abbesses & Metro Blanche are just a 5 minutes walk away. Lastly, the hotel provides breakfast at a fee of 10â‚¬/person, unfortunately we didn't try so we were unable to comment on that but they do provide free internet access in the waiting lounge & their pet & mascot a very happy & friendly 4 year old chocolate Labrador named Caramel that greeted the guests when they arrived. With so much said we would for sure to come back & visit you, Merci to you Alain, Karine & the rest of your staffs for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful clean welcoming hotel in a great location at Montmatre”
Reviews.Author: Kerribee52
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveller and found the staff particularly helpful. Room very attractive and clean but no overhead shower rose. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will stay there again if I return to Paris. Thoroughly enjoyed the fresh breakfast croissants and baquettes as well as other options.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandCarver
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Room (# 56) although compact was adequate. Beautifully furnished and painted. Clean/tidy and quiet. Bonus - could view Eiffel Tower. We particularly wanted to be close to Montmarte and this hotel fitted the bill perfectly. Staff first class. Tip. Use the metro and buy the carnet tickets

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but bizarre hotel rules and staff behaviour diminished the experience.”
Reviews.Author: Closeau
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights between Sept. 28 and Oct.2, 2009. The hotel is in an excellent location, right in the heart of Monmartre. Close to Blanche and Abesses Metro stations. The rooms are small but adequate; the bathroom facilities are excellent, but take note that there is no shower fixed to the wall; it is a hand-held shower head. There are no "do-not disturb" signs for the rooms, so expect the cleaning staff to barge in on you if you decide to sleep in past 9am. The continental breakfast is adequate, but it can be hard to find a seat in their small breakfast room. They charge 10 Euros for a continental breakfast. For 14 Euros, you can get a full breakfast at one of the many cafes just down the street on rue Abesses. There were two major annoyances with this hotel: 1) They prohibit the consumption of food in the room, apparently for "hygenic reasons." This is a real shame if you want to sample cheeses, baguettes and other take-out food from some of the excellent shops and restaurants in the area - in the comfort of your hotel room. 2) Our travel iron disappeared on day two of our visit, after the room had been serviced. We thought we had misplaced it. After searching around the room, we went to the reception. Sure enough they had it. They took it because they have had four room fires, caused by travel irons, over the past year. The real problem was that they took the travel iron without telling us, which could be construed as theft. They agreed that they should have told us why they took it, and after explaining to them that we had the presence of mind to turn the iron off before leaving our room, they returned it to us. Perhaps they need to implement an official no travel iron rule.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller87
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nites at Hotel Des Artes (thru 9/22/09). The hotel was lovely-very clean, quaint, and convenient to Metro (long walk uphill from Blanches Metro!) and not too far from Sacre Coeur. free Internet access on the PC in the sitting room off the lobby; jazz playing on the jukebox and comfortable armchairs to sit and relax. Check out the three Sympa (discount clothing) near Sacre Coeur, (Rue Steinbraken, or something like that!) and Halle St Pierre is great for a quiet bite to eat. Sympa has good deals. The area around the hotel has nice shops (a little pricy in dollars) and restaurants. Espace Dali is up the hill--nice small museum. Hotel staff were friendly; rooms are small (as expected). Didn't eat breakfast there. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBenny
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem in a great location. The hotel is darling, the decor throughout is fresh, with uplifting colors. The room we had was on the top floor, with an oddly fun view of Montmartre rooftops and Sacre Coeur spires. The stone breakfast "cave" is intimate and is a delightful space in which to have your coffee and pain-au-chocolat. The staff was upbeat and friendly, seemed glad to have guests. We had stayed at the Relais Christine in the Latin Quarter at the front end of our trip, a great hotel, but to be honest, this place was more enjoyable for us. And it cost about 1/4 as much. You will schelp your own bags here, the rooms are not huge, etc., but Hotel Des Arts deserves it's high TripAdvisor marks. You will hard pressed to find a better hotel and location in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “I will always be staying here!”
Reviews.Author: circleseeker
Reviews.Content: Feb little hotel in the heart of Monmarte. I loved everything about it. The breakfast is great, super clean and there is a doggy that is in the lobby most of the day. I recommend very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: henhenhenners
Reviews.Content: The hotel has such a lovely location in Monmarte - even the walk to the Sacre-Coeur was shorter than I thought! The room we had was a good size, clean and tidy - everything we wanted for our overnight stop in the city. Online offer from their website made it even more appealing, and I'd definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “It's Paris in my heart...”
Reviews.Author: loveisparis
Reviews.Content: It is not the first nor the last my trip to Paris. I love Montmartre and I feel completely at home there. This hotel lies in the heart of it, with all these wonderful Parisian roofs above, cozy and hilarious Place du Tertre and concerts of various craziest bands on Montmartre hill... Back to hotel-nice, cozy, homely and simply with self Montmartre's spirit all around...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: RussandMatt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts was an absolute find! My friend and I stayed for two nights. Once on the way to Switzerland and once on the way back. Our first room was INCREDIBLE in every way. Situated on the top floor the views were amazing and very peaceful. Our room on the second stay was tiny, but very clean and had everything you needed. It was a little noisey and our sleep was disturbed. However, it didn't spoil our stay and I would highly recommend this hotel. Very clean, seems very well run and made our time in Paris extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff in ideal and romantic location”
Reviews.Author: boyattheback
Reviews.Content: In short - this hotel is highly recommended and I'd happily stay here again. We stayed in Room 21 overlooking the narrow and attractive Montmartre street in early September 2009. While compact, the room was not too small. It was in almost pristine - certainly immaculate - condition, and very clean. Perhaps indicative of the long-since gentrified nature of this beautiful hill-side part of Paris, there is absolutely nothing down-at-heel or bohemian about this hotel. Which is not to say there's no character (though it doesn't have a great deal) - it just doesn't have an iota of the usual grime, wear and tear that passes for character in some hotels! The lobby, funky little lounge, spiralling staircase and surprisingly light and airy basement dining room (in spite of what the photo shows) were in similarly pleasant and appealing condition. There was no air-conditioning that I could see, which would only pose an issue if the weather was oppressively hot - leaving the window that overlooks the street open would mean intermittent noise of occasional passers-by or mopeds. Location-wise, it's just a few minutes walk up to wonderful Sacre Coeur and a couple of minutes to La Blanche metro stop (right by the Moulin Rouge). Within falling distance there's a wealth of bistros, bars and street-side cafes (including the fun and relaxed Cafe des Deux Moulins - which featured in the film Amelie, and does a great burger and fries). The staff were extremely helpful, with one searching the internet for the details to Paris's flea markets for me (there is an online Mac in the lounge for anyone to use, by the way). There is a strange rule regarding food being taken to or eaten in the rooms - so there's no room service. However, we snacked and drank what we liked in our room, unaware of this rule until the last evening without so much as a friendly word from the staff. Two issues I noticed, neither of which annoyed me but I guess they could be noted: in the spotless bathroom of room 21 there is no shower - there is a new showerhead on a flexible tube but nowhere on the wall to which it could be attached and no shower curtain to suggest that it once did hang on it. There wasn't any particular reason that I could see for this arrangement, but at the end of the day, it wasn't a problem in the least. Secondly was the safe. Digital and seemingly new, it was however fitted onto a small removeable shelf within the wardrobe and so would have been easy to take. Fortunately, this shortcoming was irrelevent as security at this hotel is not an issue - it feels and is quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: harmul
Reviews.Content: A very good value for money Hotel, good location near to two Metro Stops(Abbesses & Blanche). Room was a bit small but was spotless. Breakfeast was good with plenty of everything and friendly staff. One downside was that they do not wish you to bring any food to the room. I was rebuked for bringing fruit and juice from the dining room to my wife who was skipping breakfeast. But all in all a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: jaypeeq
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a long weekend in Paris and had a wonderful time. The Hotel met all our expectations and we would recommend it to anyone who wants a real taste of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, clean, great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: sreenname01
Reviews.Content: Montmare is a great place to go in August! It was my first time to Paris and it was only made better by the fact that Hotel Des Arts was well priced, friendly, quiet and accommodating. I wanted a comfortable room in the heart of a cool neighborhood, with character, internet access and easy going staff- that is exactly what I got. We had a top floor room with views of Paris. The hotel is surrounded by delicious cafe's and great markets.No complaints only compliments.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: ExNeddiesBoy
Reviews.Content: Come up the stairs at Blanche metro station and your vista is filled with Moulin Rouge. Go up the hill one and a half blocks and Hotel des Arts is in mid-block on your left. We had two separate 2-night stays here. The first stay was on the 2nd floor in a standard room. Everyone is right...the shower is a tiny 2ft x 2ft (0.6m x 0.6m), but it is an overhead shower. No tub. The room is plain. We could not understand why many reviewers make such a fuss about this hotel. On the second stay, they could not honor our reservation for a double bed. We were upgraded to the 5th floor where the rooms are a little larger and the bathroom has a tub. The shower is in the tub, with a flexible shower hose attached at the tub faucet. (In other words, no overhead showerhead.) (All rather odd.) We pushed the beds together, reworked the sheets, and voila, we had a double bed. The hotel itself did that the next night. (A common practice in France.) We liked this hotel, but we didn't fall in love with it like we absolutely have to stay there next visit to Paris. It kind of lacked a little soul, although that comment might be a little harsh.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous stay, great room and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: goudkamp
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Paris, around the Montmartre area in August is not a fun job to do. This is not our first trip this great city but we weren't satisfied with our usual hotel and so, we were looking for something new. And close to Montmartre is impossibile. Well, Hotel des Arts was JUST what we needed: great location, easily accessibile by car (free parking in August, in front of the door) and close to the Abbesses metro station, lively shopping street around the corner and, most importantly, a nice 10 minutes walk away from the Sacre Coeur. We had a Superieur room on the 4th floor (out of 5) and had the view on Paris's rooftops. Very quiet, very clean, nice and spacey. Going up by elevator and coming down by the marvelous stairs. Personel was very friendly. We didn't take the 10 euro breakfast (per person) but a bigger room instead and got our 'pain au raisons' just outside the hotel in a boulangerie on the square where you can also get coffee to go. In conclusion: we'll be certainly be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: PaulycMancheter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fantastic area with lots of Cafes and shops in the Montmartre area. The views over Paris from the Sacre-coeur (5 min walk away) are amazing, the Sacre-coeur itself is well worth a quick visit. The rooms are small, but I have family living in Montmartre and I can assure you that whole residential flats in Montmarte are no bigger than these hotel rooms! What do you need a big hotel room for anyway? Just request a room with a view as I did and youâ€™ll get a view over the rooftops of Paris, our room (63) even looked out onto the Tour Eiffel. There is free Internet access in the lobby. There is great access to the metro system, therefore the whole of Paris. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would defiantly stay there again (once the pound recovers!).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Natasha_1377
Reviews.Content: That was a greatest time in paris! Hotel is just wonderful, staff cheerful and always glad to help. Rooms are nice and clean, bath is great. I will come back there, for sure! Thank you, Alain!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - unspectacular rooms”
Reviews.Author: Siharris28
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb - we loved the Abbesses area, very quirky, great restaurants bars and superb neighborhood shops. Also conveniently located for public transport. So that was great. The hotel itself was fine, quite nicely done out, liked the pictures everywhere. The room was tiny though and the view wasn't much to write home about. Pretty good for the price but would maybe look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: littledutchgirl74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! First, all the staff were more than fluent in English, which was really helpful, and not so common in Paris. It was so close to the Metro, and of course in walking distance to Montmontre...which has tonnes of shopping, restaurants, the Place Du Tetre, and the Sacre Coeur Basilica. We had a main-floor court-yard room, and it was quiet, serene, and absolutely lovely! The courtyard rooms also stayed quite cool in the hot weather, while I heard the rooms within the hotel tended to get quite warm. Hotel Des Arts was so clean, quaint, and the perfect place to stay in Paris. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good location and great decoration”
Reviews.Author: miagucci
Reviews.Content: a nice hotel with a very good location, good staff, good breakfast, good internet. Slighty more expensive than others in the area but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Durrance_Bagale
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, peaceful, elegant hotel, well located in Montmartre. It was very easy to get everywhere on the metro, and was only four stops from the Gare de Nord. We stayed in a double superior room, which was huge by Paris standards and even had a bath in the bathroom, not just the usual shower. The room overlooked an internal courtyard and was bright and airy. Breakfast was included and this was great: fresh croissants and French bread, yoghurt, fruit etc etc every morning. There are lots of cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area, and it's only a 10-minute walk or so up to the Sacre-Coeur. In general the staff were friendly and helpful, and the room and communal areas were always spotless. The only (very slight!) sour note was the young lady who worked on the reception desk some days - she was aloof to the point of rudeness, but maybe she was just having a bad week, I'm not sure! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My wife was happy with my choice.”
Reviews.Author: SkeeterFrance
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The situation in Montmartre is excellent, being near two metro stations (Abesses and Blanche). As is true in many areas of Paris - you are in the city - yet in a residential area - with its own character. The hotel is small and quiet. Nice buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: SFvisiter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly in front of one of the best movie theaters in the world. It shows a great array of films, and has a nice bar inside. You probably saw a glimpse of it in Emelie. Anyway, the hotel is clean, updated, and the staff is helpful. The only draw back is that there isn't AC, which is rarely needed in Paris. It is often booked, so book ahead, or else you will be in one of the many dumps in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: NeilDunfermline
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and reasonably priced hotel. Breakfast all that one could ask for at this price. Staff helpful. Location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pyrokitty
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel des arts for seven nights. Location is excellent, staff very helpful and beautiful and clean hotel. I definitely would recommend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location & wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DawnonCalgary
Reviews.Content: My stay here started with a bit of a bump. After 9 hours on a plane, jet lagged & no sleep I arrived to be told by the manager that they were over-booked & I was moved to another hotel for 2 days. They paid for my taxi to Le Cardinal, a sister hotel of Hotel Des Arts. It was a nice hotel but I was put in a basement room. They also paid for my taxi back to Hotel Des Arts, and my room was upgraded and ready for me when I arrived. But it made my stay feel broken up & it took me a couple of extra days to get my bearings. After that though this was a wonderful place to stay. Cozy, comfortable, close to everything. I agree with evan1261, if you are traveling alone watch out for the stalkers!!! They also cruise the popular tourist spots & try to pick you up there, so just be smart. Kudos to Carolina & Karine at the front desk for sure. I was in a small accident & Carolina went above & beyond to help me navigate the French telephone & medical systems. I can't thank her enough! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: buttercup118
Reviews.Content: The hotel is incredibly well situated for a stroll around Paris in the Spring. Friendly staff, neat decorations, cozy rooms and just very clean, which is very important. I enjoyed the breakfast but it was free part of the Expedia package. I don't know if it was worth 10 euros otherwise. Plenty of cafes where you can have a solid breakfast for that amount. I was really impressed with the bathroom and layout of space. Free internet in the lobby to check your email and look up directions for exploring. Also, the area is very nice and as a 21-year-old female traveling alone, I never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisThePilot
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Des Arts. Very nice boutique hotel convientant to the metro...(Blanche station is closest) Smaller rooms typical of Europe but very well kept, Nice continental breakfast and free use of the internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful return to the Hotel des Arts”
Reviews.Author: ethics1412
Reviews.Content: Our fourth stay at this hotel and probably the best service and room of any of these. Helpful staff, especially Karine and a lovely room. While the price has increased significantly over the last 10 years it is still good value and the location with the metro, Rue Lepic shopping and village feel is memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Arts (Hotel Premium) - nice people but strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: evan1261
Reviews.Content: A mixed experience at this hotel. It's now called Hotel Premium by the way. The management were kind and very helpful but the hotel has some unusual policies and the area near the hotel is full of stalkers. Not recommended for women traveling alone. Housekeeping - We were asked to clean the room before the maid would come in and clean. So, each morning we had to go through and straighten up the room. Electricity - The electricity was turned off each night at 1am and then on again at 6am. This made getting up in the middle of the night problematic. Stalkers - The hotel is not far from the Pigalle area so there are several men who stand around the entrance of the hotel and will follow you around the area trying to pick you up. We were followed on 3 occasions by young Arab men and harassed for 2 hours. When we returned to the hotel, the men would attempt to enter the hotel and follow us to our room. The hotel manager intervened and forced the men to leave the hotel. They left but continued to loiter at the hotel entrance waiting for us. It made the experience in Paris very difficult as we had to plan our day around the stalkers.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the heart of Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: oldguyinseattle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Arts is a small, convenient, comfortable hotel in the heart of the Montmarte historic neighborhood. I believe it was once a dormitory for the dancers of the Moulon Rouge which is just down the street. It is half-way between Moulon Rouge and Moulon de la Galette, about half-way up the butte. It is a short walk (5-minutes) to two Metro stops on 2 different lines which makes it convenient for tourning the city. It has an unpretentious front entrance on a small quiet street; it is nonetheless only footsteps away from the hustle and bustle of Montmartre. Shops, restaurants, cafes, ATMS and just about anything one could need are literally footsteps from your door. The hotel is small (about 50 rooms) and caters to French and other European travelers but the few Americans who stayed with us were unanimous in their praise. The rooms were clean and the building and lobby were charming. The staff was very helpful and spoke English when our attempts at French became embarrassing. The breakfasts (which are included) were very good and we particularly enjoyed visiting with "Patrick" as he prepared the buffet every morning. I lived in France in the 1960s and I think Montmartre has changed very little since the times when Van Gogh, Renoir and Picasso lived and painted here. It is the Paris I remember and we will return. Hotel Des Arts is a great value in a city where everything costs about twice as much as Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aprilgirl415
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and a 15 year old stayed here for five nights in June. Everyone at the hotel was accomodating and friendly. We had no trouble with our internet reservation. The room was clean and the bathroom was more than adequate. There was a retractable line over the bath tub for wet laundry and a hair dryer was installed on the wall. (There is a laundromat in the neighborhood if you need one.) Our room had an armoire for our clothes, a small televison mounted on the wall, as well as black-out curtains. We booked a superior room for 3 people. We got a room on the second floor that had 3 twin beds (one had been brought in) which were comfortable. Even though it was a bit tight with the extra bed, that wasn't an issue since we were hardly there. The problem was the street noise. There is no air conditioning. It was hot during our stay and keeping the windows open at night was impossible if you wanted to sleep. Part of the charm of this neighborhood is that it is very lively. We were there over a weekend so naturally the crowds were making a lot of noise as they strolled - perhaps stumbled - around. I used ear plugs to get a good night's sleep. Here's my advice: This is a lovely little hotel that is run by a good staff. If you come in warm weather, get a room in the back or on the upper floors and, by all means, bring ear plugs just in case they can't accomodate you any where else but on a lower floor facing the street. We really enjoyed the neighborhood. The cafes are OK and the restaurants are fine in this area (hey, it's Paris!). If you want something more, there are 3 Metro stops in the general area - Blanche (closest to the hotel), Pigalle (sex shops and strip clubs - ooh la la), and Abesses (lovely square filled with children on the weekend). We so enjoyed exploring all the back streets and small cafes. We've been to Paris numerous times but had never stayed anywhere close to the 18th. We both would stay there again. For Paris, it's a good value. Some additional thoughts: We took the Eurostar into Paris and used the Metro exclusively for our transportaion with no problems. During the ride, you can buy a set of 10 tickets at the Eurostar's bar and avoid all the crowds and the resulting confusion at the train and Metro stations. When we left Paris we went to Charles de Gaulle airport via the Metro and the train. It was much easier than I had expected but beware: lots of stairs. If you have a lot of luggage or are out of shape, this way of getting there is not for you. We just had carry on bags so it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: burtoj2
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Spotless accommodation. Would visit again. Breakfast very good. Situated in quiet location of Montmarte. Five minute walk for Sacre Cour.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and friendly hotel in beautiful Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: IUtraveler22
Reviews.Content: This is the second summer I've stayed at Hotel des Arts and I plan to return again. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are small but very attractive, and the Montmartre neighborhood is a delight with many cafes and galleries. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends who want a real Parisian experience. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Onestarawake
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet and booked it for our honeymoon in Paris. The hotel is a ten minute cab ride from the Eurostar terminal at Gare de Nord (approx 10 euro). The location is fantastic, only a 5 minute walk up to Place de Tertre and Sacre Coeur, and a 5 minute walk down to Abbesse metro station. The hotel is a delight, bright and colourful and spotlessly clean. We had a double superior room on the fourth floor which was very spacious with two patio doors leading out onto a balcony oerlooking the street. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, preferring to check out the many cafes in the immediate area. The reception was manned 24 hours a day and the staff were always polite and courteous and willing to offer help and advice. I would definitely recommend The Hotel des Arts to anyone looking for a value for money trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: Trippingtripping
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HÃ´tel des Arts for four nights at the end of May. We booked a few months ago on the internet and got what we thought was a competitive rate for the stay. Our room was on the sixth floor, with a fantastic view over the chimneys of Montmartre as far as the Eiffel Tower and La DÃ©fense! Our room was not large, but had plenty of storage for our clothes and suitcases, and was cosy and well-equipped. The bathroom was compact, but very clean, with plenty of towels. The bed was comfortable, and although the weather was warm, the room had good-sized windows, so it was always a pleasant temperature. It was very quiet in the hotel, even on Friday night when the bars up the street were fairly lively! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, preferring to grab a croissant at a local boulangerie or cafÃ©. We know the area around the hotel, so chose it because of its proximity to bars, restaurants, food shops and boutiques. The hotel is also convenient for getting into central Paris, being five minutes' walk from Abbesses and Blanche mÃ©tro stations and the same distance from bus stops. All in all I would definitely return to the HÃ´tel des Arts. The service was efficient and helpful, the room was great and excellent value for money and the view was magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely as ever”
Reviews.Author: tyrwhittali
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on and off for nearly eight years now and it is as lovely and welcoming as ever. Handy location as there is plenty going on in Montmarte but has easy access to two separate Metro lines. Staff are lovely and friendly, even helped me find out the schedule of play for the tennis the next day. Rooms are clean and spacious/

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Hotel with tonnes of Character”
Reviews.Author: AliceToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel des Arts from May 8-17 with my 17 year old daughter. We had a great time. The hotel is very tastefully decorated with local art. Breakfast was a good selection, coffee was great. Everything was very clean. Staff was friendly and very professional. The area of Montmartre is great, exactly as I pictured Paris to be. We were on the first floor so there was a bit of noise when other patrons were coming in and out but it was minimal. This hotel is definitely worth the money and I doubt I could find something so comfortable at the same price. I'll definitely return to Hotel des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel at a lovely friendly price”
Reviews.Author: BlondeWanderer
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel - as quirkily pretty as the surrounding Montmartre area and so comfortable - the rooms bely the very reasonable price, being spacious, immaculate and stylishally decorated. All the staff were very friendly and always had time to chat or help. They helped my boyfriend and I, who don't have excellent French between us, sort out bookings and trips - and also helped me find a doctor when I was struck down with a terrible ear infection on a public holiday! There's only one criticism I can think of and it's a very small one indeed. Neither of the bedrooms we stayed in had a mirror outside the bathroom so I had to wait for my boyfriend to finish his shower before I could put my make up on and that meant that I then had to wade around on a puddly tiles while doing my face. The hotel's location's good, away from the touristy drag and close to the road where the hipsters hang out in bars and cafes. I would happily have paid much more to stay at the Hotel des Arts but I hope the staff don't read that as it would be a real shame if they were to put their prices up. As it is, they've probably got one of the best value hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lou89
Reviews.Content: My partner and me loved this hotel. We went with Thomas Cook who had free nights offers with most of their hotels and it was a tough decision to decide which one to go for. We went three star so that we were able to have a comfortable base from which to sight see. We saw little point in having a flashy hotel when we were going to hardly be there but the hotel was far better than we expected. We had TV and a fair sized en suite and the bed was lovely and comfy. In room safe was great for storing all our tickets, and the room was furnished wonderfully. The hotel itself is family run, very friendly and really quite cute and set in the heart of Montmartre. It is literally down the hill from artists square and there are an abundance of small cafes on the main street that the small street the hotel is on runs off. The street itself offers peace and quiet from the bustle of the city and is only a five minute walk from the Abbesses metro station. I felt the only thing that kind of nagged us about the location was the fact that you usually had to change on the metro to get to the main attractions, usually after only one or two stops and after taking the RER from the airport we had to change twice with our cases, but other than that, a wonderful location. Also, on our first sight seeing day when we went to the Louvre we got talking in the queue to a single man and a family from England, both staying at different hotels closer to the Louvre in the centre of Paris and both complained about the cost/ lack of value for money that the central hotels offered. The single man had less facilities than us but was paying double the price per night for his room, all to just eradicate five minutes off his metro journey time to the heart of Paris!!! The metro is not the most comfortable of transport admittedly but if you can handle it, its well worth going for more remote hotels and buying a visitee travel card!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: ilsameghan
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in the hotel for 1 night because we arrived a day early in Paris and already had a different place booked. We wished we didnt, as this hotel was wonderful! Staff was great, rooms were very clean and there is a computer in the lobby available for guests! Montmartre is a great area, wonderful cafes, bakeries and boutiques! The hotel is close to metro stations so it is a great place to stay and go see the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and hard to better”
Reviews.Author: SomersetDoc
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a short taxi ride from Gare du Nord and were immediately thrilled at the location and look of this intimate hotel. Staff friendly and no messing about filling in endless forms etc etc. Atmospheric interior attractive. Breakfast good but got a bit repetitive after a few days - would be nice to have a change of cereals! Room cosy and bed comfortable. Nice view from our 4th floor room. Lack of any mirror in the room a downer as was hand held shower over the bath with no curtain But we managed! Great location and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “The Location is the main advantage”
Reviews.Author: Habari02
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really great, right in the centre of beautiful Montmatre. This is the real Paris. The metro is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, very cheap and easy to use. The staff are not overly friendly but are very professional. The rooms are clean. We had a lovely view over the roofs of Montmartre from our full length window. I wouldn't recommend booking breakfast because it is lovely to choose a different cafe every morning for breakfast, all just around the corner, and sit outside and watch the world go by. Montmatre is an ideal place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and the perfect Monmatre experience”
Reviews.Author: Eva13London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street just a few minutes walk from the bustling centre of Monmartre. The room we had was on the top floor with wonderful views of the skyline of Paris. It also had the charm of seeing the rooftops of Monmarte all around. The room looked like it had been refurbished and was spotless, The beds were very comfy and the room was really quiet and relaxing. The staff were friendly and helpful. We could not fault the hotel in anyway. We would recommend it to any of ourf riends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Des Arts”
Reviews.Author: macrowe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this lovely hotel. Staff friendly, room, although small was clean and comfortable. The location is perfect, just a short stroll to Sacre Coure and only a 3 or 4 minute walk to Metro Blanche for access to the entire city. Plenty of good restaurants and cafes close by. Finally, for Paris this hotel offers great value. This is where we will stay on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Cheekywelshmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, weekend of 5th April. Its in a good location, close to the Basilique SacrÃ©-Coeur and Abbesses metro. The area has a really nice vibe about it and doesnt feel like your caught in a tourist trap. Just down the hill are many bars (the type Cafe Rouge try to copy in the UK). The hotel is spotlessly clean, staff were helpful and friendly. One minus point was they wouldnt let us have the room until after 2.30( we got there at 1pm) which was a pain after travelling since 5am, we really wanted to dump our stuff and shower. Breakfast was good, continental style. With the euro as it currently is against the pound Paris is extremely expensive. Starbucks costs at least double the UK!

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rothaiocht
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really great, right in the centre of beautiful Montmatre. This is the real Paris. The metro is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, very cheap and easy to use. The staff are not overly friendly but are very professional. The rooms are very clean with spotless bathrooms, unfortunately only a hand held shower and no bath curtain, which means water goes everywhere. We had a lovely view over the roofs of Montmartre from our full length window. I wouldn't reccommend booking breakfast because it is lovely to choose a different cafe every morning for breakfast, all just around the corner, and sit outside and watch the world go by. Montmatre is such a relaxing place to stay and I highly reccommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bobjimfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night at this hotel. Right in the middle of Monmartre, surrounded by interesting shops and restaurants. Staff were very friendly and offered local info. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotel des Arts”
Reviews.Author: lamboDundalk
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel des Arts for 23-26 March from good reviews on various travel sites. E-mailed hotel prior to departing and they replied that the booking was OK. On arriving was told that the room was been â€œrenovated!!â€� and that I was booked into another hotel in the area. On apology, nothing. Seemed like this was normal procedure for them.. On investigation on Trip Advisor forum it seems that this hotel is notorious for â€œwalkingâ€� people to other hotels in the area!! . This hotel seems to be a victim of it`s own success as it only has 30 rooms? . Be aware,book this hotel at your peril

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnywarwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2006 and although we loved the area the room was very tired and in need of a refurb. So in 2007 we tried another small hotel for the same price and it was the worst place we had ever stayed in...so this year, because the Hotel des Arts is in such a fab location we went back for more. What a great surprise...the room was lovely and obviously newly decorated facing away from the road with a view over the roof tops and we even had a bath tub (which we always request on city breaks and never get!) The staff are very helpful and professional. I would definatley recommend this hotel, especially if you like strolling around Montmarte and checking out the local restaurants. We think this area has everything for a weekend break with enough on your doorstep to keep you busy and entertained. Steps away from the Moulin Rouge ( you must go once, it's worth it) Art galleries,boutiques and loads of great cafes / bars. Our favourite restaurants all in walking distance are: 'Progress' for lunch on the junction of Rue y Le Tac/Rue Tradieu and Rue de Trois Freres. 'Mascotte' fish restaurant on Rue des Abbesses for dinner and a fab choice of oysters. Also a great trendy restaurant at night is 'Cafe Burq' on Rue Burq, the next parallel road from the Hotel. Continental breakfast is not the best for Â£10 which consists of cereals,bread,boiled eggs,yoghurt,toast,jam, fruit juice and most disappointingly...filter coffee! ( i would personally like some continental meats and cheeses) . An Apple mac is available for guests to use in the Foyer/lounge.We will definitely come back next spring!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noelsteve
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 great nights here in March.Hotel is very comfortable and warm.Very well maintained and spotless clean.Rooms are a little small,but all you really need is to sleep there because of the beauty of discovering Paris.Easy access from metro (Blanche metro is only 3-4 minutes walk).Staff are friendly and helpful.Monmarte and Hotel Des Arts is a unique and great place to be based for a visit to beautiful Paris.Looking foward to our next visit already.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Arts exceeds expectations...”
Reviews.Author: BriantoEngland
Reviews.Content: After much research on the net we booked Hotel Des Arts via Great4Hotels (cheaper than direct to with the hotel). Initial impressions on our arrival via the Blanche metro station were that we had chosen the wrong area (very "seedy" along part of the Boulevard de Clichy). These soon changed after the short walk to the hotel, which is on a side street off the Rue Des Abbesses. At the top of the street is one of the two remaining windmills in Montmartre and then a very picturesque street leads to the Place Du Tertre where you can admire the work of the local artists keen to sell their latest masterpieces. Amble round the corner and you arrive at Sacre Coeur with its marvellous views over Paris. All this, only minutes away from the hotel! This neighbourhood was our favourite place to eat,drink and relax at the end of a busy days sightseeing. No problems with our early arrival at the hotel - luggage was stored in a secure room and English was spoken. Our bedroom and bathroom were both larger than expected (room12). They were clean and had recently been refurbished. The room is on the first floor, directly above the hotel entrance but we had no problems with noise. The staff were polite and helpful. We cannot comment on the breakfasts as we chose to eat out - lovely boulangerie/cafe just around the corner on Rue Des Abbesses with a good menu at half the hotel price. Also on Abbesses, lots of tempting places to eat and drink although more expensive than Place Du Tertre. In conclusion a much better than expected (from the outside) small hotel in a great location. The neighbourhood was just what I expected Montmrtre/Paris to be and the metro at Abbesses and Blanche allow very easy access to all of the city. A great place to return to at the end of a tiring days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very cozy and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Mercury99
Reviews.Content: This was the highlight of our stay. the staff were wonderful, and helpful in any requests we had. location is wodnerful, 3 minutes walk to closest metro station. lots of shops close by Fromagerie, and delicatessen were amazing. hotel was very cultural, and made you really feel parisian. i cant wait to stay there again when i head back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with good staff”
Reviews.Author: Centurio
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights here. It was a perfect choice because of location and nice reception's guidance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a lovely location - Abi & Kate Manchester :)”
Reviews.Author: abi76
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this charming hotel.. cozy and friendly. The location is brilliant, just a short walk from the Abbesses metro station - Pigalle is also close by. We took the RER from the airport to Gare Du Nord which then linked to the metro. Moulin Rouge is a 2 minute walk away if you want to explore and so is the Sacre Coeur, a 5 min walk... this is a lovely area with plenty of cafe bars creating a buzz.. We would recommend to change money to Euro's whilst in paris it is a better rate.. 1.15 selling at whilst we were there. We checked out of the hotel at midday, however they held our luggage until later in the day for us. Would definately stay here again... it has everything you need on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “My little bit of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarmelSunnySE
Reviews.Content: This hotel always feels welcoming and friendly. I have stayed there three times now and I always wish I could stay longer.I go to Paris for the atmosphere and I always feel it from the moment I step into this hotel.I just wish it was a little less expensive and I could afford it more often.The staff are interested in you and they give a great service.I would like to be able to get a cup of tea at night or a small snack or drink when I come in tired after all the exploring.The metro Abbesses is quite close and so handy for getting around and of course Montmartre itself is one of my favourite places in Paris.Roll on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for 40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Bellamy
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay at Des Arts Hotel for our 40th Anniversary because of good reviews on Trip Adviser. It lived up to expectations and we even had a great view of the Eiffle Tower from our room.The hotel is a peaceful retreat in a lively and interesting area. Staff were friendly helpful yet unobtrusive . The breakfast is very good value and if you walk up the road a little way you can have an excellent dinner or a glass of wine at no.16 rue Tholoze.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stv_mcbrd
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and found the service and staff exceptional both times. Steve and Linda , Glasgow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Christonabike
Reviews.Content: In a fantastic location - the Abbesses/Rue Lepic area has a great neighbourhood feel. The staff at the hotel were friendly and accomodating, and the help-yourself continental breakfast was good. The room was really small, and the bathroom smaller still. I'd recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Lilmishabear
