Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel were stellar and claimed charming, etc. Not sure I saw that. Our room was the smallest we've ever stayed in, and I've stayed in a lot of hotels. The bathroom was even smaller. The tub, we didn't get a shower, was about half size, and the toilet was so close to it that we literally had to sit side-saddle to go...(you can figure that one out)...the staff was helpful if you pushed a little, but basically not terribly friendly...not mean, but just not 'Wow, Hi! How can we help?". (One gentleman did call a reservation in for us and told us how to get there, to be fair) The breakfast was ok, the coffee was about as bad as I get here in the States...the location was decent...the two metro stops were interesting...Blanche, if you have bags, you'll be hauling them up a fairly good hill to the hotel...Abesses, if the lift isn't working, count on about 10 flights of stairs to get out...then, you have to walk to the hotel. Overall, it isn't a bad hotel and if you're looking for a basic place to lay your head and clean up, then it might be for you. But I think we'll look for other lodging when in Paris again...It just wasn't the 'charming' we'd been hoping for...

Reviews.Title: “A real treasure in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Robbie1403
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the centre of Montmartre, just a short walk away from the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur and close to plenty of shops, bars, cafe's and restaurants. Easy to find too being conveniently only about 5 mins walk from Blanche Metro station. The staff are welcoming, helpful, and friendly, and speak good english if your french is a little rusty! The hotel itself has a small and cosy feel and is spotlessly clean and smart. The rooms, although not large, are well appointed. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is continental and a little basic but plentyful. The dining room is a little small so if you leave it to the last minute to arrive it can be crowded and a bit chaotic. We had a room on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel and this benefitted from a large balcony (only two rooms at the front have balcony's) that was sunny during the morning. Although we didn't spend much time in the hotel during the day we did appreciate being able to sit out for a while in the sun and watch Parisien life going on in the streets below. All in all, and finding agreement with what the majority of others say about this hotel, I think it would be hard to find something better for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mim666
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 5th floor to the rear of the building, after a long day travelling with flight delays / cancellations etc we eventually arrived at the hotel just before midnight, we were quickly booked in, the room was maybe a wee bit on the small side for a double room but you didn't notice when you have one of the best views of the eiffel tower when you opened the window, it was lit up and with the frosty air it looked absolutely amazing, an image i will never forget. You are approximately a 10 min walk to the Sacre Coeur (all uphill) with more amazing views and deifnitely worth seeing, the few days we were here we walked up everyday through the Montmartreâ€™s Place du Tertre. This area doesnâ€™t seem to have been disturbed by time and remains much how it was when Van Gogh lived here. Lots of artists offering to paint your portrait, plenty of places to eat and drink. Walking down from the hotel you are less than 5minutes from Moulin Rouge, you pass some fabulous shops, very close to the metro too. I would definitley recommend this hotel as base for sightseeing for all of Paris The staff at the hotel are brilliant, friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, value-for-money hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Jim096
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Des Arts several times and always thought it wonderful. January this year was no exception. We intended to stay only 4 nights and try out an hotel in another part of Paris. However after inspecting the rooms and facilities at several what we thought were similar type hotels we could not do better than Hotel Des Arts for location, value, quality and staff friendliness. Alain kindly offered us a very acceptable rate for the reminder of our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First-rate hotel at an affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: Jordgubbe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the 18th arrondissement, quite close to Sacre Coeur. It is newly renovated, very clean, and quiet. The rooms, as well as the entire hotel, are small but charming with a very warm and welcoming decor. Cinema afficiados need only cross the street to catch a movie in a very intimate theatre. All in all, my wife and I and our extended family were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: bunny79_9
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, bars, shops, metro and delis close by. Accommodation was clean, comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect charming hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: elaine1733
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute gem of a hotel. It is in the ideal location on a lovely side street in Montmarte with several conveninent metro stops within quick walking distance. The hotel staff were so warm and friendly and the hotel room was immaculately clean. I booked directly through the hotel website and got an excellent rate for a 4 night stay over Christmas. I am so happy to have booked this hotel as a result of the positive reviews on trip advisor and agree with all of the lovely comments that other travelers have left. We will definitely be returning in the future for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: 2grlz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and secure. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. Only criticism is the room size - the staff were kind enough to upgrade us to a larger room when they saw how much luggage we had.....but I would hate to see how small the other room would have been, because the one we got was tiny! So if space is important to you, this may not be the best option, however, if your main concerns are cleanliness, security and helpfulness of staff it is excellent. I would definately stay here again - it was an excellent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Dhalia85
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris about 4 or 5 times a year. However, I stayed at the Hotel Des Arts for the first time at the end of November. It was one of my best trips because I stayed at Des Arts. You are in the midst of so much beauty in this charming hotel. The elevator doors are all painted with most beautiful pieces of art. The rooms are bigger than many Paris hotels and they are also impeccably clean. The staff is also very helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Des Arts Paris

Reviews.Title: “Sacre-Coeur!”
Reviews.Author: copperbottom01
Reviews.Content: This hotel took our fancy after checking trip advisor. There are so many horror stories out there and the reviews were good on the whole. On arrival we were upgraded from a double standard to a delux twin on the top floor. The rooftop views were great but found the twin beds small but comfortable. This was the first romantic trip of ours and that was unfortunate but no real complaints! The bathroom was dinky but very clean indeed although it was a shame there was no shower curtain. We managed ok though, cant all be perfect! Have to say the room at this level was missing Tea and Coffee making facilities....would have been nice. Breakfast was adequate with particularly friendly staff serving it. All in all the experience was a tad expensive. The exchange rate bombed over the time of booking to arriving and ended up being with breakfast, nearly Â£110 per night! Largely an exchange rate issue though. Finally, the area was lovely and full of restuarants and cafe bars if again, a little on the expensive side. We didnt expect much better value for eating and drinking closer to the city but it was. All in all, our stay was very good indeed. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fancygrl
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The area is perfect, very close to two metro stops and walking distance to the Sacre Coeur and the Moulin Rouge. There are hundreds of restaurants within walking distance, and the hotel staff were able to recommend several good ones to us. All of the staff speak English and were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are VERY clean, and neat. They are small, but not unusually small for Europe. The breakfast is good and very convenient. The bathrooms are clean and modern, with endless supplies of hot water. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day. The hotel has a computer with free internet access for guests, which was very useful to us as there is no free wifi access in Paris! I strongly encourage you to book this hotel, I had a wonderful experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Too many rules”
Reviews.Author: CircleStone
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews regarding both overbookingâ€™s and not so good rooms I sent 2 e-mails prior to our arrival asking for a room with a view and not to overbook me, neither got a reply. As I am a travel agent this did not instil me with confidence, anyone who works in a service industry should at least have the courtesy to reply. On arrival we were given the key to room 20, made our way up and found this to be a very small drab room, the view was the wall opposite so there was no natural light. I would have put up with it for 1 night but not for 4, so I went down to reception and asked to be moved. Eventually offered room 4 which overlooked a courtyard and we could at least see the sky. Unpacked our bags and settled in for our much awaited break. Had a look through the Hotel Information folder and was aghast to read that itâ€™s against Health and Safety to eat in the hotel room, were we staying in a hotel or a hostel??? One of the greatest pleasures of being in France is to buy a baguette and make your own sandwich using the good local produce on offer..,,,or a midnight feast after a few drinks in the local bars. By now we were really beginning to regret our choice of hotel. We went down for breakfast (it was included in the price) on the first 2 days of our stay. Bread, croissants, cold boiled eggs, cereals, yoghurts and tinned fruit salad were offered but were neither inspiring nor plentiful. No eggs or croissants on arrival on day 1 and no one seemed to be in a rush to replenish. The latter 2 days we got a Panini down the road for les than 5 Euros which was delicious. On our return to the hotel after our second day of sightseeing we asked for the room key and were told some items had been removed from our room as they had had problems before and would return them when we left. They had removed 4 nightlight candles from the bathroom which I had left on the tiled area of the bath having had a relaxing candlelit bath the previous evening. There was no shower curtain and they were at the opposite side of the bath to the towel holder. What a pathetic attitude towards guests. This is certainly how to ensure you do not get any repeat business as I for one will not be back, even to collect my candles! Oh yes and I did witness guests being told there were no rooms available, not sure if they were overbookingâ€™s or people trying to book on spec. I guess the former as they had luggage and looked really fed up. Avoid the â€˜Hostelâ€™ Des Arts; there are far better places to stay In Paris. I certainly will not be sending any of my customers there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for money - loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: BethLaw24
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Hotel Des Arts at the beginning of November with 2 of my best friends for a girlie weekend. The hotel is in a fantastic location in Monmarte - there is a busy street with restaurants, cafes and shops but the hotel in on a quiet side street. The Abessess metro is a 2 minute walk away and Sacre Coeur is a 5-10 min walk away. We felt very safe in the area. The hotel staff were really friendly and recommended exhibitions and bars for us. The rooms were comfortable and clean with en suite bathrooms. A big plus is the yummy breakfast provided each morning. Would definitely stay at this hotel next time i go to paris - fantastic value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: GasladyLeeds
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel has been our 'home' in Paris on every occasion we have visitied the city - it was in fact first recommended to us by a friend. It is conveniently situated a few minutes walk from 2 Metro stations in Montmatre, in the middle of a number of bars, restaurants and shops - it really feels as though you are one in with the locals rather than a tourist. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean; the rooms, although smaller than 'chain' hotels, are simply and immaculately furnished. Bathrooms are very clean and the daily service is superb. The reception staff are friendly, extremely helpful and spoke English far better than I can speak French! Breakfast is adequate, but I would recommend you skip it in the hotel and rather walk 20yds down the road - here you can join the local Parisians for coffee and a croissant at one of the many cafes. (We really don't want too many people to know about this place - we don't want it to be fully booked when we next want to go, which cannot be soon enough!...) Thank you again for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just one more thing to love about Paris..........”
Reviews.Author: Frenchmillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Arts for 6 nights in Sept. Lovely experience. Rooms were sufficiently spacious, althought the bathroom was very, very small (but I was told to expect this in Paris!!). Staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Close to 2 Metro stations and right in the heart of bustling Montmartre, I would definately recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chickabee
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel - spotlessly clean, staff very friendly and helpful and loved the little breakfast room. Great value for money and especially enjoyed the view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. As we arrived in Paris early in the morning, we were very grateful to the fact that we could leave our luggage in the hotel's "luggage room" and go off until it was time for us to check in - that's great so you don't have to drag heavy cases around! If you are looking for a place to stay in Paris where you become a part of the community, this is it! There are fabulous little bars and restaurants and the people of Montmartre make you feel very welcome - it's a little village within Paris. The hotel also arranges airport transfers at a very reasonable rate. Thanks Hotel des Arts - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billsf
Reviews.Content: Great location for a short stay in Paris, and perfectly adequate for tourists who do not require all the luxury trappings of a fancy hotel. I wouldn't recommend for a long-stay or business travellers. Highly recommended for romantic getaways, or (in my case) introducing your parents to the delights of Paris Our first impressions were set quite well by the amazing girl at the front desk who seemed to smooth out the travel arrangements of 15 people in 4 languages simultaneously while taking telephone calls as well. Our rooms were ready on arrival, quite modern and impeccably clean. The interior is simple but fantastic in subtle detail. One minor issue was one of our rooms had a stand-up shower while the other had a standard French half-tub (sorry, don't know the name for it). While I'm fine with the half-tub, it would have been difficult for my parents to use, so some notice of this would have been appreciated, especially for older travellers. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: Wee_El
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 night stay here. Room was nice and clean, only moan was that bathroom was a bit small, but great shower made up for it. Breakfast was just what was required and the breakfast room was lovely. Surrounding area was really nice and lots of restuarants to choose from. Metro was also quite near and so getting round Paris was no problem. Would highly recommend both hotel and area

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: deniseandwaldek
Reviews.Content: we just stayed here for 1 night at the start of our holiday. the location was ideal and the room was lovely. it was spotlessly clean and quiet. the staff were very friendly and i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilySomerset
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a short break in Paris with 4 friends and we have been very pleasently suprised by the Hotel Des arts. Good value with helpful staff and breakfast included! Lovely clean rooms and comfortable beds with very nice fluffy towels. Only down side could do with a mirror above the dressing table. Location is ideal and monmartre is an ideal base for seeing Paris. It is lively with lots of great restaurants nearby and feeling very safe. Recommend the Zebra which is just round the corner. look forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “Merci Beaucoup”
Reviews.Author: bevcardiff
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel to be informed that they had double booked but with the help of Karine we were directed to another hotel that she had booked for us. We returned to Hotel Des Arts for the second day and the rest of our stay. It was centrally placed and safe to go out in the evenings to nearby bars. The staff were helpful and courteous. We had room 26 which was overlooking the courtyard. It was lovely to be able to open the big windows as the weather was better than expected. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but was suprised at how expensive everything was in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: spartania
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel des Arts from August 1 to August 8. I was first in room 1 on the main floor which was not ideal. The room is right beside the front desk and it was loud and noisy through most of the night. Fortunately I suffered from jet lag so I slept through *most* of it. After asking to be moved for the rest of the week to another room, the staff was accommodating and moved me to room 50 on the fifth floor. It was a sweet little room - clean and comfortable. Not much of a view (the room across) but I didn't mind. The bed was firm and the bathroom was clean and recently renovated which impressed me. Wake-up calls were easy and reliable. I had the breakfast included with my hotel stay which I enjoyed - a good selection of yogurt, cereal, juice in addition to coffee, tea, croissants and boiled eggs. The hotel is located in the middle of Montmartre - close to shops, restaurants and markets. I fell sick with a cold about midweek and the staff directed me to a local pharmacy to purchase some medication. I particularly like the free internet service the hotel provided which helped keep me in touch with home. Merci pour une vacance formidable!! I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurWag
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Arts is brilliant. Our stay in the hotel was the pick of the bunch when we recently traveled UK, Italy and France. I would easily return, and probably will! The staff were very pleasant and more than willing to help when we had a question, such as how to get somewhere. Our room was sensational - a roof top panorama of Paris with the tip of Eiffle Tower in the background. The location was central and not far from the Metro - an easy walk, particularly through the gorgeous streets. Restaurants and cafes in the near-by streets were very good, and stolling around the Montmarte area made it only more spectacular Highly recommend staying!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jss697
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel has clean rooms and wonderful staff. The location is perfect for exploring all of Montmartre and the rest of Paris since it is near a metro stop. Reserve a room in the back because the street noise reaching the ones in front can be really loud.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: damashtho
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of a friend. We found it to be clean and comfortable and well situated in Montmartre. Having booked well in advance we secured a top floor room of a good size with terrific views to Sacre Coeur and beyond to Paris. The Metro was within easy and enjoyable walking distance and the surrounding restaurants and patisseries were of a good quality. We found the service efficient and professional. The staff were helpful and thoughtful with regard all aspects of our stay and there was no hesitation in the use of conversational English. This is a small, well run hotel in a busy area offering a good standard of accommodation and a pleasant environment. Thank you for making our stay in Paris easy and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: curlyhairedgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel des Arts in June 2008. I was travelling on my own in Paris and found the staff were very friendly and really went out of their way to be helpful â€“ with advice, tips, assisting me with organising day trips etc. The hotel was very clean, welcoming and cosy. It was excellent value for the price and my room was very comfortable, quiet and a good size (particularly for a single room). It is certainly in a great location, in walking distance to the metro station, close to many of the charming streets of Montmartre, with a fantastic choice of bars and restaurants nearby. Breakfast in the hotel is very convenient and also offers a wide variety of things to choose from. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Paris, and Iâ€™ve already recommended it to many of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: gr1785
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on 15june 2008. it is a lovely hotel and the breakfast is really nice - quite a big selection considering this hotel is quite cheap to stay at. the room was lovely and very clean, which was all we were looking for and big enough. the staff are very friendly and helpful. there are lovely bars and restaurants close by so we ate out there each night instead of going into paris. there is a metro at the bottom of the street and we did all our travelling by it - we got a 5 day ticket that extended to disney parks as well for about 40 euro. i would recommend this hotel and will be returning again some time.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Nicke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son and my parents (we booked a double room each). The location is fine, in the centre of Montmartre. The view of parts of Montmartre and Paris from our small double room on the 5th floor was OK but not spectacular. It was 29 degrees outside so we really needed some air conditioning which there was none. So I left the window partly open during the night and had my sleep disturbed several times by the sometimes loud traffic down below. My parents had a double room facing the backside which was more quiet. I avoided the 9 EUR hotel breakfast, they had a rather boring breakfast buffÃ©t room in the basement. Instead we had one for 4.45 EUR each in a cosy cafÃ© nearby. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom clean with lots of fresh towels. There was a combination locker safe in the room which I used. There were magazines for disposal in the corridors on each floor which I appreciated. The reception staff was helpful but not very friendly. Parking was impossible! Well, perhaps not impossible, in Paris parking is never impossible as long as you break the traffic rules and park wherever you want... this is what I had to do. I rented a car before check-out and needed to park it nearby the hotel, and to find the hotel! That was an adventure... Hotel des Arts is not a bad hotel but despite its name it did not impress or inspire me either.

Reviews.Title: “total disaster”
Reviews.Author: ImogenBendigo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel based on guidebook reviews and some tripadvisor reviews that referred to it as a friendly well run hotel representing good value in Montmartre. The rooms on the website looked fine. Despite having booked directly with the hotel nearly 5 months earlier we were told on arrival that they were overbooked but we could be accomodated elsewhere in Paris for the night. I had heard of this scam before and had it tried on us in Rome only to find on insistence that there were indeed rooms available1When I insisted that we stay where we had booked the reception manager was aggressive but gave us the room next to the reception desk. We were on the last day of a 7 week trip and already had a shuttle bus booked for return to the airport next day so we had no choice but to stay there. The room was so tiny, extremely noisy(all conversations at the desk could be heard) and the window opened out onto the rubbish area. The bed did not even have a bedspread or cover over the blanket. The whole experience was upsetting and totally disapointing and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone despite the appearance of the website rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charming location”
Reviews.Author: budge185
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Europe, I stayed in Paris on two separate occasions for 3 nights each. To make the most of it, I chose two different locations - St Germain/Latin Quarter and Montmartre. I stayed at this hotel on my second visit to Paris and loved it. Montmartre is on the edge of Paris so it's a bit of a trek to other sightseeing locations etc. but it's a nice, unique area to stay in and enjoy for the atmosphere. The hotel is an easy walk from the charming Place des Abbesses metro station and the main street that you walk up (Rue des Abbesses) has lots of bakeries/shops/bars/restaurants and is quite lively till late in the evening. I know some parts of Montmartre are quite seedy but staying at Hotel Des Arts you would never know you were near the red-light district (Pigalle, Blanche etc.). I was staying here by myself and felt safe all the time. The last remaining windmill Moulin de la Galette is just up the street and the whole area is so picturesque and lovely. The hotel itself is great too - my room was clean and comfortable with a big double bed and bath. The only problem was i was given room no. 1 which is literally right next to reception, which was a bit uncomfortable. The breakfast (included in the room rate) was really nice and the staff were friendly and polite. I was allowed to leave my luggage there before check-in and after check-out without any problem. Definitely a good choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swodaem
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Des Arts in April with my girlfriend and my parents. We all agreed it was a great choice and excellent value. Reasonably priced, well located, well presented and clean - it was just what we were after. The staff were very friendly, and the buffet breakfast at 8 euros was good value for money - it set us up nicely for a day of sightseeing! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “You'll want to move to paris”
Reviews.Author: LukeandMarie
Reviews.Content: A fantastic little hotel in the best arrondissment of the best city in the world. we've just spent 4 days at the Hotel and we adored it. It is essentially next door to everything including two metro stops, the Sacre Coeur and the best cheese shops in Paris. This Hotel is a true gem

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: schiocco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Des Arts with my boyfriend this January on a recommendation from my sister. We had a wonderful time!!! It is in a perfect location within Montmartre and is on a slight hill, but from Abessess metro station it's hardly a five minute walk. We stayed in one of the rooms on the top floor and had a fabulous view. Granted, you had to lean out the window the see the Eiffel tower but it was still amazingly romantic with a little juliette balcony. We didn't have breakfast (we spent the money on the room upgrade instead) but there is a nice bakery on the way to the station (along with LOADS of greengrocers) which sold lovely pain au chocolate etc. Easy to get around Paris and we never felt 'out of it' in Montmartre as it's so busy (even in Jan) and the metro is so quick and frequent. Nice staff and always clean. Great value for money. I would definitely go back if I was in Paris again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: adventurerol
Reviews.Content: Although the ground floor rooms were a bit noisy, the hotel moved us without a problem to a room which was faultless in quality. The room was well lit, nicely decorated, sufficient in size and had a comfortable bed. The bathroom was immaculately clean and tastefully furnished. Location was excellent for Montmarte; the Metro station was very easy to find and only 5 minutes away, Sacre-Coeur only a little bit further. Breakfast was slightly below average for a hotel of this class but still adequate (no cheese or meat). Staff were friendly, always willing to help and extremely welcoming even at past midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Very good and central hotel for life in Montmatre”
Reviews.Author: Gordonberkhamsted
Reviews.Content: Following recent updating very good hotel only round corner from the busy streets with real shops at foot of Montmatre. Clean friendly and good value I would recommend. Breakfasts basic but good serve yourself. Only short walk from 2 metro stations we had 3 great nights. Would go back. Local restaurants good but very busy with locals at weekend. Le Durer 19 Rue Yvonne-le-Tec family run good basic food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PaulHarris
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Eurostar from London and transferred via "Blanche" Metro station. The hotel is about 15 - 20 minutes walk from Gar Du Nord, but with bags etc. the Metro was fine (albeit it involves one change of line). Check in was quick and easy (we had booked in advance directly with the hotel). We were allocated room 45 (fourth floor) which turned out to be very nice. We were at the back of the property with a nondescript (but not unpleasant) view over the rooftops from our two windows. The room was comfortable, and obviously recently refurbished. Our bathroom included a bath with hand held shower over, and a "programme yourself" type safety deposit box. The TV was a small traditional type 14 inch set on a wall bracket. The channels included BBC World, Eurosport and a music channel. The hotel is well located, about 10 minutes walk (uphill) to Sacre Coeur, or 20 minutes down to the River and Louvre. Paris was lovely - we walked about 12 miles in two days looking at everything, and were fortunate that we coincided with free museum Sunday (first Sunday of the month) for our visit to the Louvre. We also climbed the 700 steps to the second tier of the Eiffel Tower and visited Notre Dame We had one breakfast in the hotel which was fine (8 euros) and otherwise ate out at cafes. At night we went to "Le Basilic" (nice fixed price 25 euro menu) down - the road and to the right, and "Chez Marie" (15 euro fixed priced menu) up towards Sacra Coeur. All in all an ideal weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HantsEngland
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel, it made for a perfect romantic trip to Paris on a budget. Booked only a week before as part of a eurostar deal. Easy to find from the Gare Du Nord, only a 15 minute walk. This hotel has a great location, 3 minutes from the Sacre Couer and 2 minutes from the beautiful and very Parisien Place Du Tertre. Our favourite district of Paris because of the character and cobbled, but steep streets. The hotel staff were all very welcoming and helpful with good local knowledge. It was clean and warm and the breakfasts were super. Cosy rooms cleaned daily, small but full of character. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: LindylouBerkshire
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel, in a fabulous lively area. It was close to everything. The room was clean, warm and quiet (room no 6). The continental breakfast was good, bread and croissants very fresh. The staff were friendly and helpful. Especially the breakfast waiter, on his recommendation I went to Pere Lachaise cementry which was huge and very interesting. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. All the local cafes and bars were friendly, lively and good fun. All in all a great find for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy & Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Diego118
Reviews.Content: This small affordable hotel is right in the centre of Montmartre. It is located close to the Abbessess Metro Station. The rooms are smallish but very clean. Who lives in a room when in Paris?? The breakfast room in the basement is quite unique with its stone walls displaying interesting art work that is for sale. Plenty of choice for a Continental breakfast buffet. The staff are very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris that is not looking for 5 star accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “No scam - just a good basic tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveJC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some really interesting places in Paris before, so I am a bit wary, but the Hotel des Arts, Montmartre caught my attention and I did my homework and found out all I could about this hotel and booked it! Check-in was swift and friendly. NO SCAM HERE. The second floor rooms were basic, clean and comfortable, we had rooms 20 & 25 both only having views into lightwells, but then you don't go to Paris to spent the holiday in a room? The bathrooms were a bit primitive with no shower enclosure and no wall-mounted shower attachments, but the shower was easily controlled. Breakfast was in a tastefully finished basement and pretty good as Continental Breakfasts go. You are in the heart of Montmartre with hundreds (I do mean hundreds) of restaurants, cafes and bars around you. The hotel is in a steep road, but then what roads in Montmatre aren't steep? After all, it translates as the 'Hill of Martyrs'. Not only do the staff make you welcome, but so does 'Caramel', the Hotel des Arts resident brown laborador - he loves being stroked and fussed over!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Bunnah
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for 6 people and when we got there the first night there was only 2 rooms available. After trekking it from London that morning we were just happy to be there after figuring out the trains so four of us shared a larger apartment for one night which was fine and then we got allocated another room the next day. It was a lot better than I expected as accommodation in France is quite expensive and we went budget style. Rooms were clean and a perfect spot near the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Hurley2rise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days in October 2007, celebrating our Wedding Anniversary. This trip coincided with the Rugby World Cup, when Paris was full of fans and hotels were very busy. Given some of the comments on this site, we were somewhat concerned about the possibility of being moved elsewhere, especially since we did not arrive until after 9.00 pm. Our concerns were unfounded. We were allocated a room on the top (sixth) floor, quite small but comfortable enough, with the added plus of views over the city from our window. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly; the breakfast was absolutely fine and the cost (95 euros per night) really good value for a hotel in Paris. Best of all though is the location of the Hotel. Don't be put off by the somewhat seedy/tacky video booths etc at the lower end of Rue L'Epic near the Moulin Rouge and Pigalle area, instead take a two minute stroll up the street and wander around Montmartre and Sacre Coeur with real atmosphere and loads of bistros, small shops, street artists et al. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a surprise”
Reviews.Author: inpitlane
Reviews.Content: With some of the reviews on-line I was a touch apprehensive when we went to check in. The situation wasn't improved by the attitude of the guy at reception who was totally indifferent to the fact that we had just travelled all the way from Australia and we were desperate to get into a room and rest. But once we finally got into our rooms from then on things couldn't have gone better. Wonderful location although if you have heavy luggage take a taxi 'cause the haul up the hill is a killer. 'specially after a long flight! Sadly like almost all French hotels there is no fridge or mini bar but there is a vending machine although, again as seems typical in Europe the drinks are served way, way warmer than we're used to in Australia. Would I stay there again? Providing the price doesn't change too much, definately.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: journeyman99
Reviews.Content: A small and friendly hotel which is clean and comfortable with en-suite rooms. We stayed on the sixth floor with a full view of the Eiffel Tower. Situated in Monmartre, the old part of Paris, with it's very attractive narrow streets.Close to Gare du Nord and Sacre Cour a five minute walk away. Comfy bed and good breakfast. Thank you for a very enjoyable stay and good value. Planning to return next year. Bob & Jan

Reviews.Title: “superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: picardiehomeowner
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed for one night at the Hotel des Arts Montmartre and found the accommodation and location to be above that expected for the price quoted. The hotel has been decorated to a really nice standard and the bedroom, although not large, had everything that you would expect from a higher graded star hotel. Hairdryers, flat screen television, really nice curtains and bedding and comfortable beds. We stayed on the top floor which was really quiet (compared to other hotels in Paris). The low price is not an indication of the quality of the hotel, and we were exceedingly impressed with the service we received. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good standard of accommodation, in a nice position and who appreciates good value for money. Perhaps it might be nice to have tea/coffee facilities in the room or maybe a hot drinks dispenser in the public area, but with so many cafes nearby and local shops, it isn't difficult to buy a bottle of water or a capuccino. Well done to a Hotel that has tried to be competitive in an expensive area. NB. The view from the top floor of the Eiffel Tower is impressive, although not every room would be able to see it.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Soulman007
Reviews.Content: Booked the trip through the Eurostar site before I'd read any reviews then found all of the negative comments here and in other places. Was a bit reticent about the stay but from the moment we arrived I knew I'd made the right choice! The staff were friendly and the hotel itself was spotless. Although the rooms were quite small they were immaculately kept and we had a wide-screen TV and a new bathroom. The hotel is a very short walk to Sacre Coer and The Moulin Rouge and the Metro stations of Blanche and Abbesses are very close by. We ended up spending most of the weekend within a fifteen minute walk of the hotel as it it SO well situated. On Sunday morning you can hear the bells of Sacre Coer and other nearby churches although these did not disturb us al all. I would highly reccomend this hotel, even if you can afford a more expensive one! Although this hotel only has three stars I think it deserves more! Spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: PHIL93800
Reviews.Content: I booked on the net a superior room with room. The room is very nice and the view is amazing looking over Paris and the eiffel tower. It's my second time at the hotel and for myself they are improving the hotel in the good way. The quality is better and the rate is ok. We booked for 95 â‚¬ a night. Breakfast is Ok but they can do better I'm sure. But the hotel is very clean. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “They've tried to scam us twice!!!”
Reviews.Author: katep98
Reviews.Content: We first booked this hotel in July 2005 through an agent, when we arrived we were given a story about flood damage on 3rd and 4th floor and were sent to another hotel down the road. Thinking this was unfortunate we booked the hotel again through expedia for one night in July 2007. Between booking and travelling we saw the reviews mentioning about the flood damage scam -- so we were prepared. Nevertheless we were still total gobsmacked to arrive at the hotel to be greeting with 'I have bad news and good news'. The reception seemed slightly shocked when we said ' let me guess you have flood damage on the 4th floor'. We told him in no uncertain terms that we didn't believe him, that we'd paid for a room in this hotel and we'd appreciate him finding us one. At this point he tried to turn it around on us and ask why we booked with expedia if we'd been (or in our case tried to have stayed) with them before. We were not impressed. On our return a couple of hours later to find they had 'found' us a room we found a note apologising, thought not admitting to any scam, and we told we'd been upgraded. Though to a room that you still couldn't swing a cat in but if you craned your neck out the window you could see the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of Montmartre, but considering they clearly carry out this scam on a daily basis they don't deserve the rave reviews they get -- this has been going on for years!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Improvement”
Reviews.Author: SunitaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at this hotel's website before seeing the various posts warning of the "bait-and-switch" scam. The warnings so unnerved me that I immediately sent an email to the hotel, asking them to confirm my booking. In response, I got....nothing. I sent another email to the void, then finally called up the hotel. A receptionist told me very briskly that their booking site had been down, which is why she had ignored my emails but that she would be book me a room and send me an email. Several days later, having not yet received email confirmation, I called back and spoke to a different person who confirmed my booking. And, finally, finally, I received email confirmation. After all this back-and-forth for a simple confirmation, I was convinced that no room would be available when we arrived. However, to my relief, all was in order. From that point on, our stay was reasonably pleasant. This is a very basic hotel. It is clean, moderately priced, and quiet. Though the size of the room borders on this side of tiny, it was comfortable after a long day of walking and the bathroom featured plenty of hot water (a plus). Best of all is the location, right in the heart of Montmartre, surrounded by fantastic bakeries, bars, restaurants and public transit options. Montmartre is charmingly "Amelie-esque" and an inexpensive yet colourful base from which to explore Paris. Despite these pros, I am not sure if I would return to this hotel. The trouble I had to go through to receive confirmation, coupled with the horror stories posted on this site, really make me wonder if it is worth the effort. This is a shame because the hotel itself is perfectly fine as budget accommodation (in fact, I spent two nights in another budget hotel in Montmartre that was comparatively priced but not nearly as nice as the Hotel des Arts). I do hope the hotel management takes the time to look through these postings and work on improving their reputation, otherwise potential customers may be tempted to take their business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's a scam!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeyP
Reviews.Content: Booked two months in advance with lastminute.com, then got fobbed off with the "water damage" story as seen in other reviews here! Amazed that they keep getting away with it. They offered a place in the Kyriad hotel, but when checking the rooms, found it to be awful, so demanded another hotel elsewhere. After about an hour of phonecalls, finally got placed at the Carlton. This is obviously a common scam. BEWARE WHEN BOOKING. If you still choose to take your chances, be prepared to be sent elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in room 15”
Reviews.Author: lizziemiltonkeynes
Reviews.Content: Booked a two day trip for myself and husband through expedia on eurostar and picked this hotel before checking out reviews on this site. Was a bit apprehensive that we would not get a room and now wish we had been moved... The area round the hotel is really nice with lots of cafes and shops including about 3 bakeries.. The hotel entrance is ok and the staff were quite friendly and helpful but the room "oh dear" The only way I can describe the size is think of a shoe box... we had two single beds that I am sure were only 2ft6 and very hard, a small table fixed to the wall, a wardrobe and french windows opened into the room so then you had to climb over the beds to get to the bathroom, no mirror in the bedroom only on the bathroom door. As for the bathroom it was even smaller, if you stood in the middle of the bathroom you could touch the both the walls it was so narrow, the walk in shower was ok apart from the handle on the shower rail was broken so you had to hold the shower while trying to wash... the shower door did not close properly so the bathroom floor got soaked. As for the breakfast weak coffee, stale bread, and your are given one glass of orange juice and a croissant. Breakfast was included in our package so it was not so bad but I would not pay 7.50 euros for it better off going to one the the cafes nearby. As we were only there for a couple of days and were out most of the time it wasent too bad but I suggest you pay a bit more and stay in a better hotel. Paris was beautiful and we would go back again but definatly not this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked a Eurostar weekend break at this hotel. All I went with was an email confirmation for both hotel & the Eurostar so I was anticipating problems but the whole trip went smoothly. Hotel is basic but clean and tidy. The staff were friedly and approachable. Breakfast, again basic, but did the job before a days sightseeing. I think the 45 min walk we were quoted by Reception to the Eiffel Tower was a bit ambitous, it took us more like 2 hours but this could be down to the numerous cafe stops en route !

Reviews.Title: “Do not book at Hotel Des Arts: plain fraud!”
Reviews.Author: Sedlak
Reviews.Content: It's the classical bait and switch scheme. These people will accept your booking and once you show up the receptionist will do his little spiel about the stupid trainee who messed up your booking, the computer that crashed, the water pipe which burst, the electrical fault, the unexpected renovations, etc. Fortunately, he has got a solution: there is an alternative hotel (you need to get there on your own, they will not arrange any transport) which is even better than Des Arts. Once you get to the alternative hotel, you find yourself in a dump. Of course you are paying the rate you agreed on when you booked Des Arts - and, surprise, surprise, that rate is somewhat higher than the dump would warrrant. I know this trick, and I speak French, so when the receptionist started his "I am terribly sorry, but there is a little problem with your room" I offered to finish his story for him. When he realised he was found out, all of sudden the problem with the room was solved, and we were given the keys. Apparently they do have rooms for people who insist. The hotel itself is nothing much, just a plain thirteen in a dozen hotel, none too clean, rather noisy. Location is good, though. By the way, the positive postings about the hotel are at least partially put there by the management of Des Arts themselves - I caught the receptionist doing this as we went past to get our breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Higher the floor the better”
Reviews.Author: nibe
Reviews.Content: We booked as part of a Eurostar trip very good value as we got the the whole trip 2 (nights)from London cheaper than booking Bed And Breakfast direct.The hotel is in a side street with a few bars and restraunts .The local shops have plenty of choice for bread ,cheese,fruit etc and drinks the area is up and coming and is pleasant.From the metro at Blanch it is a three minute walk up hill.The local electric service bus goes all around Montematre it is a circular one way system but it has great views and is a quick way to get to know the area. The hotel is on 6 floors all the top floors have an airy feel while lower down feels cramped.Typical 3 star smallish Paris rooms.Pillows are a little thin so request another on arrival, this was no problem to them .The bathroom was small but clean,trowels soft and fluffy. Breakfast was good and plenty of bread and jam ,cereals and boiled eggs. This is a good value 3 Star Parisienne Hotel for Â£70 per night for two. We walked down to Rue De Faubourg Montmartre(15 minutes) to eat ,its good value at Chez Jonathons (a littlejewish place) and of course at Chartier(a big Magriet moment) at both you can get 3 courses and drinks for 25/35 euro for two and its good fun. At the bottom of the road near the Moulin Rouge there is the metro station and buses to the city centre.To get around use the metro and buses but buy 2/3 day ticket as you can go any where on the Ile De France all day ,great value. If you get up early ,walk up to Sucre Ceour and look over Paris in the early light before the crowds and the view gets hazy.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint place in quaint town...near Sacre Couer”
Reviews.Author: seplin2003
Reviews.Content: Just be aware that there are 2 Hotel des Arts in Paris. We found the room through a guidebook and booked through hotels.com but didn't print out the confirmation. We were looking for it through the address in the book and couldn't find it. When we called the hotel from the number in the guidebook, they didn't have our reservation. Finally, we found internet service (it's everywhere until you need one) and got the correct address. As the taxi drove through the redlight district right past Moulin Rouge, we were like oh great. But the hotel is 2 blocks up the hill and the immediate area is surrounded by your average bakeries, butchers, etc. The hotel itself is nice. We didn't get breakfast so I can't comment on that. The room was quite large, especially for European standards. The heater didn't quite get as warm as we'd liked but it wasn't too bad. They have a bunch of rules like no drying clothes on the radiator, no hanging clothes off the balcony, no eating in room, etc. We broke every rule. I could understand that they didn't want us hanging our clothes on the radiator due to fire hazards and eating would make a mess, so we only hung our clothes while we were in the room and cleaned our mess after eating. We later took a walk down by the red light district but didn't feel fearful at all. There was a huge crowd of tourists waiting to get in Moulin Rouge and we got some attention by some guys near a porno theater but nothing threatning. It's an all right place but the only thing of interest near by is the Sacre Couer which is beautiful but I don't have to be staying near it again. Oh yeah, be wary at Sacre Couer. There's all these guys trying to stop you on the way up and trying to tie bracelets on your hand. I'm not sure what they were doing but we just ignored them and walked away each time. After awhile though, it gets really irritating. We didn't even go all the way up because I was getting so annoyed. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “great Montematre hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathcoll
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great neighborhood of Montemarte, this is it! Staff are wonderfully accommodating. Rooms are well maintained and clean. The beds are comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty though the selection was the same every day. Before we travelled I found that the booking agent I used booked us in a double despite my request for 2 beds (I was travelling with my adult son). I was frantic until my emails to Hotel Des Arts were answered. They were very reassuring, helpful and accommodating. My meager attempts at a few French phrases were met with kindness and fluent English spoken by staff. They have great online deals if you book directly through their website.

Reviews.Title: “just got break..great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toyah1
Reviews.Content: Just got back today, we had a lovely stay at this hotel! We got given one of the two court yard rooms, room number 6. Felt alittle strange as we were not in the actual hotel, but it was lovely. Yes rooms are small,but had a lovely room with the warbrobe in then another with the bathroom. One thing was the room was paper thin, so we heard most of what went on in court yard room number 5! Breakfast was lovely, the location was excellent with the hotel being a 5 minute walk to Blanch metro station. Lots of things to do, and places to eat in the area. all in all we had a lovely two night stay, excellent for the cost of the trip..We had no problems at all..

Reviews.Title: “runaway, FRAUD -- TO BE AVOIDED”
Reviews.Author: eml71
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GO HERE. Husband and I were subject to fraudulent practices. Hotel Des Arts ook our money and our booking [through last minute.com], got there, told us room wasn't available and tried to send us on our way to crummy 1-2 start dump down the street, which we walked to on our own and had graphiti in the lift. Suprising, or not, it was owned by the same guy as Hotel Des Arts. Gather he pays for renovations on that dump by kicking people they over booked to the crummy place, but charging them 3 star fees. Went back to try and just get our money back [they wouldn't hand over] and they tried to kick us to a hotel in the suburbs. Really *impressed* when someone in the lobby gives us a document off a website saying this 'water damage' excuse for lack of room and shove off to cheaper out of the way digs is common occurance and to be aware!! Pursuing complaint with LastMinute.com and customer protection agencies as this seems to be a pattern.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back - One major Problem !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bermudian
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is as basic as they come. That is not to say it was unpleasant. The hotel and rooms were clean, but the room did smell of cigarette smoke. Breakfast was the usual continental and was enjoyable. Staff were polite, and quite helpful. Bathroom smelt of bleach. There was no holder on the wall for the shower head to go. The area is Montmartre. You either like it or you don't. I always felt safe though. It is a hilly area and the metro station at Abessess was shut so we had a trek from Pigalle past all the red light stuff to the hotel. I would recommend the Hotel des Arts if you're just after a room to sleep, in an area loaded with character, and you are not too fussy. Also, buy the AA Paris travel guide and do the Montmatre Walk - it was great. But DO NOT book the Parishuttle with France.com, they didn't pick us up from the airport, and were unpleasant. If I had known how easy (AND CHEAPER) it is to get the RER into Paris (it joins the metro in central Paris), I wouldn't have even considered them. Careful not to miss the hotel - there's not a proper sign with the name up for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “never stayed at Des Arts”
Reviews.Author: RichardJohnstone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked into Hotel Des Arts via our local travel agent who found this hotel from Escape who are based at Manchester. We travelled from Charles de Gaulle airport on the Air France coach to the AF bus stop and then travelled on the Metro for five stops only to be be told when we arrived at the hotel that due to flooding there was no room for us and that they had booked us in a hotel nearby. The hotel they had booked us in was five Metro stops away. It all turned well for us as the hotel was near the Arc de Triomphe and was more central. The hotel we stayed was called Hotel Niel on Rue Leroy and was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: P_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Sorry to be another traveller to have a bad experience to share about this hotel but my advice is, do not touch it. We arrived at the hotel only to be told by the desk clerk Alain, that the hotel had problems with electrics, water, you name it and that we would have to be given alternative accommodation. Needless to say he was charming at this point. The alternative was absolutely dreadful and when we went back to the Des Arts and said it was unacceptable, Alain became very hostile and rude. He eventually got us into another hotel but he basically told us to like it or lump it as it wasn't his job to find us alternative accommodation. Literally we were left with no choice. I would say that Paris is a great city and with so many other hotels to choose from, it would be best to give this place a miss. Apart from anything else, who wants to stay at an hotel with the track record this place has for problems with water, electrics, computers crashing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel....”
Reviews.Author: ruthzmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 weeks ago. It's lovely little hotel, right in Monmatre and close to cafes etc, but also quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our only problem was that the temperatures were in the high 30's for our stay and we were on the 5th floor with no aircon or even a fan... I thought we would die!! They assured me Aircon is on track for next year!!! I would certainly recommend for a Paris Break, good value. Rooms small, but what you would expect for the price. As much as you can eat breakfast, buffet style.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for my parents, they were very happy!”
Reviews.Author: Lutece1717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Paris not far from this hotel. My parents were coming to visit us, and wanted something under $100 US, so I searched around and was able to book this hotel for about $100 per night including breakfast through a UK company called Tourquoise Tours. My parents also said they wanted breakfast, but didn't want to pay extra for it, and this company actually includes the price of breakfast in all their rates, so it was a good fit. I had read here about overbookings, etc. with this hotel and it became my primary concern. I went to visit the hotel and everything looked nice. I went ahead and booked on the internet through the company (not the hotel) and was given a confirmation voucher. I went and visited the hotel a few weeks later to see if they had my parents's names on record as having a reservation, and everything was fine. They checked in about a week later and received a quiet room, as requested. There were no problems with the room. It was quite clean and the bathroom was large for Euro standards, as far as I'm concerned. My mother was very happy with the breakfast, which was important to her, and included much more than just the regular baguette, croissant and coffee. The room they had was not facing the street, and I can imagine there were perhaps larger, prettier rooms in the hotel, but my parents' concern was that it was quiet, and the hotel definitely met their needs. The front desk personnel were very nice and did speak English, and were very accomodating to my mother, who had a few special requests. There is also a lovely chocolate lab dog in the lobby named Caramel - what a sweetie! My parents stayed two nights and were satisfied all around. I was glad there weren't any problems, and saw no signs of any people unhappy when we were there to pick up my parents. I would book other visitors there again without question. It is an excellent value for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers, we too fell victim to the overbooking problem. On arrival for a 3 night stay, we were told that the room was flooded, but not to mind as we were to be directed to another, better hotel nearby. As it turned out, the better hotel was a grotty hotel miles away from Montmatre on a busy street. And we weren't alone, 3 other couples had been directed to the same grotty hotel. The staff were unapologetic and wouldn't provide for a complimentary transfer to the second hotel. All in all a very disappointing, frustrating experience. It seems as though success breeds complacency for this hotel and I wouldn't trust that they would honour any future bookings.

Reviews.Title: “NO over-booking problem, very very welcoming, will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from having spent 3 days and 2 nights at HOTEL DES ARTS. What a magnific little gem of Paris!! I must confess that having read all the terrible reveiws and problems with over-bookings, I was really concerned. But I thought I'd give it a chance as the area seems really lovely and the price is in my budget. Before booking directly from the hotel's very own website (see below), I sent them an email asking info about the rooms. To my surprise, "Caroline" wrote me back very quickly and was very helpful with the info I'd inquired. Then about over a month before my departure, i made the booking for 2 nights on their website and paid the full amount with the credit card. I got a confirmation within seconds. Then A week before my departure, I called for a friendly reminder and a confirmation of my reseravaion. I got to speak with Caroline and she reassured me that everything is in order. Still feeling very unsettled with the reviews i had read on this site recently about this hotel, I called them again THE DAY before my check-in and asked for directions. This time Caroline nicely address me by my name and even mentioned the date of my arrival before i said anything! I find that very pleasant and reassuring. The day I arrived, it was like checking in at a friend's vacation house! She knew me already (and probably thought that I was such a paranoid guest!!!). Everything went perfectly. I got a room on the 6th floor with a magnific view all the way to Effel Tower. The room, though small in size but not suffocating, was neatly arranged, the bathroom especially the bath tub impeccably spotless. Everything was just perfect. The "quartier" was busteling with all the typical parisien shops, boulangeries, Ã©piceries, cafÃ©s, bars. The hotel is not far from the metro station to get you to cthe city center or even to the train station. Just so convenient! The check out time is at noon but you can even leave you bags at the reception and walk around until your departure time. Great! Ok enough of all the compliments. I'd just like to mention a few draw backs (so not to appear so biased), my room had windows that opens on to the school playground. So it got a little noisy during break time. Nothing serious. Another draw back is that there's no fridge in the room! And my room cost 110 Euros! Well that's just about all folks! I had an absolutely fantastic weekend at Hotel Des Arts. I strongly recommend booking DIRECTLY from their website. Sometime there's even interesting discount! Here's the url [--]

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews that warn of the hotel switching scam!”
Reviews.Author: M_Bermingham
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the Easter weekend for a romantic break for my girlfriend and myself. Booked about a month in advance, initially through a website called Parishotels. I paid a deposit, but recieved no confirmatory email. I then contacted the hotel direct who told me that everything was in order. However, as I wanted to make sure everything was going to run smoothly, I checked again in both French and English to be sure there was no misunderstanding, a week or so later, just to be sure my booking was confirmed, and was reassured that it was. I then recieved an email from Des Arts two days before we were due to stay there (bearing in mind it was the Easter Bank Holiday, a busy time in Paris to say the least) telling me that due to 'renovations' our room was unavailible, so was it OK if we were moved to another hotel? They gave me the name and address of the proposed replacement, but I was unable to find the place reviewed or even mentioned anywhere on the net, so I asked to cancel my reservation rather than be palmed off with somewhere awful for our supposedly romantic weekend! I booked and paid for another hotel via the lastminute website and we set off to Paris. When we arrived, I tried to withdraw money and was unable to as not only had Lastminute charged me, but so had Des Arts for the booking I had already cancelled!! It has taken me 2 weeks to sort this out. To be fair the people at Des Arts have been unfailingly polite, but ther ewould have been no problem if they had not a) tried to palm me off with another hotel b) managed to actually cancel my booking when I asked them to and they confirmed that they had. there are too many other similar reviews out there for this to be a conincidence, it may well be a very nice hotel, but in my book if you cannot rely on your booking to be honoured they are not worth using.

Reviews.Title: “The same old story”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked for easter holydays for two nights with two months in advance and the day before my leaving from Italy I called them to know if everything was ok: they said YES !. At my arrival the man before me was destinated to another location because of problem at the 5th floor...I began to get angry and when I reached the reception Alain told me :" don't worry everything is ok....but you should go to another hotel !!!". I replied:" WHAT ? I called yesterday, I paid advance with credit card and now you say that I have to go to another hotel ?" fortunately when he told me the name of the other hotel I remember that it was better than Des Arts (it was The Cardinal) and so I accepted told to Alain that if there'll be only a little problem I came back immediately to him. It's anyway an habit of Hotel Des Arts, but in this case i think that I gained in quality. My response is forget Des Arts and I suggest to chose others.

Reviews.Title: “Fine budget choice but be careful”
Reviews.Author: Eltel6
Reviews.Content: Having read the many bad reviews I was actually curious to see this place with my own eyes. I booked directly through their website, one day before I travelled, and got an immediate email confirmation which I printed out as instructed. They offered me a discount rate - 58 euros per night for a single room, although they sneakily added on a 5 euro "booking fee" (a common scam for all kinds of internet business, as it costs them next to nothing to take internet booking). When you add in breakfast - which is often included even at budget hotels - you're not saving a lot of money compared to nicer Montmartre hotels - such as Regyn's or L'Ermitage. I took a risk with this hotel because I knew there were other hotels in the area with rooms available - and I would be arriving early enough to walk out and find another if they tried the swap scam. I arrived in Paris exceptionally early - 7.30 am - and decided to test their reaction by going straight to the hotel. Alain was a bit surprised, but after a bit of negotiation he offered me a smaller room that was already empty - if I would pay an extra 29 euros as an "early check-in fee" (they do like their extra fees....) I could have waited until 2 pm for a bigger room - but the offer was too tempting after an overnight journey. In the end I was never charged the extra - Caroline checked me out and I think its obvious they have a communication problem. Clearly it sometimes works to the traveller's advantage! Interestingly, at check-in Alain sifted for ages through several piles of paper and asked me when I had booked ("Was it two months ago?"). The same look of slight surprise when I told him I had booked the day before. The room itself was fine but nothing amazing. A comfortable bed, warm and clean, the nice bonus of a television with English channels. My view was of a ventilation shaft, the bathroom was incredibly tiny with a few cracked tiles and a useless hairdryer, although very clean. More or less what you would expect from any decent budget hotel in Paris. Breakfast is a bargain - worth the extra 7 euros as you'd never get so much choice for the same price at a cafe. And the lobby IS very pretty, and the location is excellent. But I'm afraid to say that there do seem to be some dodgy practices going on there. If you are coming to Paris at a busy time of year, or after a long trip from America - or if its a special occasion or a romantic trip - don't risk it. If you have your heart set on staying in Montmartre, save your sanity and book at the slightly more expensive Regyn's or L'Ermitage. I haven't tried Hotel du Moulin or the Utrillo but they're more reliable and the same price as Hotel des Arts. If you don't need to be in Montmartre, try Hotel Chopin - its lovely. Would I come back here? I would if I could be guaranteed no scams, but its not special enough to take a risk.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisien Gem”
Reviews.Author: Vicki Ottaway
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel Nov 2005 for our stay in Jan 2006, all done over the internet, with a confirmation and we didn't have any problems when we checked in. Our room was on the sixth floor and we had a view over the rooftops to the Eiffel tower, perfect. This was our second trip to Paris in 2 years, previously we stayed at a large 4* hotel 200mts from the Eiffel tower, and although there is a difference in the standard of accommodation and price (as you would expect) we preferred this hotel. The location is great a few steps from Monmartre and the metro station, and the area has all the restaraunts and bars you could wish for. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and the room contained everything we wanted, good bathroom, hairdryer, towels etc. Opposite the hotel and slightly up the hill is a fantastic French restaraunt, La Galerie. Very small (approx 20 tables) but very welcoming, the owner serves at the tables himself and the food is great. We paid EUR 69 for 3 courses for two people including a bottle of wine, highly recommended! I booked this after reading the feedback from other travellers on this site, and have used the site since to book a hotel in Budapest for a trip in March, I hope our experience there is as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: DanielTration
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Des Arts on my way from London to Spain. I booked the room over the Internet and got a great rate (direct from Des Arts). We caught the Eurostar from London and then the metro to the Monmartre stop near The Moulin Rouge. A quick walk up the hill and we were there. Check in fine the room although small was fine for two of us it was recently re-decorated and my favourite of the holiday. We stayed for 4 days and found the price location and service perfect. Pay the extra for the breakfast. Make sure you go up to the top of the hill for sunset and watch the Eifel towel light up. We say the Moulin Rouge & The Lido ( if you can see them both go for it if you have to chose it HAS to be The Lido this was the BEST thing I have ever seen Las Vegas and all). PS Don't fly Ryan Air what ever you have to do. . . .the worst experience of my life !!

Reviews.Title: “Tried the scam but relented”
Reviews.Author: newgrange
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for four nights beginning tonight (December 8th) for my brother and his partner Helen. I just texted him to see how check-in went - he replied "Alain tried to tell us we had to go to another hotel, but Helen gave him what for, and we got our room'. This is obviously a regular scam they try and pull, but insist and hopefully you will get your room too. The hotel itself is good he said.

Reviews.Title: “double booked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite booking a 4 night stay well over a month in advance, when we arrived we were told that due to a computer crash a week before, the hotel had lost all it's booking details. We were told that they had tried to contact all the agents they deal with, in order to find out who had booked and to be able to notify them. We were not contacted and had no prior notice. We find it very difficult to believe that efforts were made as we had booked the holiday through Eurostar, which you think would have been one of the first on the list. Very disappointing as we were transfered to a hotel some considerable distance away, not of the superior standard promised and on a busy and noisy street. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes we were also "stitched up" - our first trip overseas to Paris. Unfortunately I left Paris as soon as I could from this experience. After about 19 hours travelling only to find that the room was not available was not very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aufanvi
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review because of other reviews I have seen posted about Hotel des Arts. I orginally booked the reservation through Bookings.com, after I booked I read that some people had been bumped to other hotels, so I emailed them directly in advance and Caroline assured me everything was booked and fine. Still apprenhensive as we arrived, I found everything in order (3 doubles) as requested. The rooms were very clean, the staff so helpful; Caroline even called three days in a row to see if Versailles would be open (there was a strike going on). The location was wonderful, close to everything we needed or wanted to see in Montmartre but still a very quite hotel. I just wanted to rebut some of the negative reviews I have seen as we will definately return to Hotel des Arts!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tripster
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend here. Glad that our room was there when we arrived. Didnt complain that they had givin us a twin bedded room and not a double as requested. Just relieved that we had a bed each! Hotel was clean and quiet and is in a great location, a bit of buzz about the place. Near to the metro but not bad walking distance either. So altogether not bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Booked direct and still bounced”
Reviews.Author: Vicki S
Reviews.Content: Do not go there! I booked this hotel for my husband, our ten year old daughter and myself 3 months in advance. The booking was made directly by me via email with the hotel - in French.I made it explicit that we were travelling with a child. We chose HdA because friends had stayed there in the past with their daughter and really loved it and its location. We were booked for a week and arrived to be told computer problems and room flooding meant our room was no longer available - but that we had been booked into Hotel Andre Gill "in the centre of Montmartre", a "more expensive hotel but offering the same price as a special favour". Needless to say HAG was in a seedy location, incredibly noisy at night with incredibly uncomfortable beds. payment was rudely demanded in advance and we were told we had to take the 7 nights or nothing at all. This is clearly a scam run by the hotels. A disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “"a rude reception"”
Reviews.Author: kmillinor
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a twin room through GTS Travel for this hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm - after long trip from US. The receptionist informed us that our room was not ready and would not be ready until 2:30pm. We sat for awhile and overheard a lady inquiring about the hotel rooms asking to see one. The receptionist stated that the rooms could not be shown until tomorrow at 11am; the lady became insistant saying that she expected to stay from 10-15 nights. The answer was still No! My friend and I went out for awhile returning at 2:25pm and asked to check in. Caroline, the rude receptionist said No! - must wait 5 more minutes. Meanwhile she checked in 2 people who came in after us. Finally she checked us in to a tiny room with a double bed. I returned to Caroline and showed her my prepaid voucher copy requesting a twin room. She said that it was my fault for not booking through the hotel; also she did not have another room available. I then asked her why no one replied to the multiple emails I had sent and she said that I must have sent them to wrong address or her "colleage" must have deleted them. This woman, Caroline is probably the rudest, meanest person I have ever had to deal with in my world wide travels. My friend and I were embarking on a barge trip the next day and returning to Paris in a week for another 7 days. Needless to say, we did not return to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Yes, they are dishonest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The stories I am finding here sound all too familiar. We arrived in the afternoon, booking in hand, and were told that they had had a terrible problem when their computer crashed, causing them to loose all their reservations. Unfortunately, among them was ours, so would we mind being upgraded to the Hotel Du Casino, a three star hotel instead of two, and just a ten-minute walk from Des Arts? Unsuspectingly, we agreed, only to find ourselves farmed out to a run down place, about a twenty-minute walk away (with luggage) on a busy street. This seems certainly their way of operating: the owners run Des Arts as a flagship, and syphon off the bookings to less desirable hotels. I will contact our travel agent and suggest they discontinue doing business with these crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: MalGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Booked a double on the weekend of the France v England Rugby International through Eurostar 'Short Breaks'. Staff said that they expected us the following month and shifted us to another hotel in Rue Amsterdam. Determined to stay at the Hotel des Arts I booked on the internet a few months later. On arrival I was told that the hotel does not deal with the company through which I had booked and I was, again, moved to another hotel. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Cindymunky
Reviews.Content: Despite booking well in advance through a reputable travel agent (Thomas Cook Signature), we too were shunted to another, far inferior, hotel for our first night in Paris. I had read about the booking scam on TripAdvisor but never thought I'd be unlucky enough for it to happen to me. I couldn't have been more wrong! On arrival at the Des Arts the bald receptionist Alain (who seems to have featured in other poor reviews...) told us that due to a computer crash they had lost our booking and had no room for us.
