We put up a fight but he insisted that we stay at the Mont Dore, their sister hotel, which he described as 'charming, more expensive' and even told us they would give us their best room. However, we arrived to a teeny tiny room on a busy road well outside of the centre of Montmartre, which is where we specifically wanted to stay. Luckily, we'd told Alain that we'd return in the morning and expected our room to be ready and to our surprise they complied! Once you're actually allowed through the door, the Des Arts Hotel is a lovely place to stay. Fab location and great rooms. The rest of the staff were lovely but Alain never apologised! My tip for anyone considering the Des Arts, is simply don't! It's not worth the risk if you don't fancy being sent to another hotel. If you do have your heart set on it though, I advise you to be ready to put up a fight to get their next available room and then you might only have to spend one sleepless night on a rock-hard bed next to a busy road outside Montmartre. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bounced Again”
Reviews.Author: JudyHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and I booked a 2 night break at this hotel on 14 May 2005 via Air Miles (to be taken in September). One double and one single room were confirmed. Reading of the alleged scam going on at HdA, I contacted Air Miles who were unaware of any problem and, in any case, said the hotel had the contract with them and they thought it was unlikely I would be bounced and, therefore, reassured me. However, when we turned up, the receptionist told us there was a problem "because Air Miles had made a mistake with the booking" and because there was a big event in Paris, they had overbooked and they had no triple rooms for us (this was the first I heard of a triple room being booked by anyone). The young lady said she had "searched Paris" and found us accommodation at Hotel Batignolles which was an allegedly, "3 star" hotel 15 mins walk away. The receptionist, who said nothing when I had asked why my e-mails concerning the booking had not been answered, said she would refund 80 Euros to Air Miles which we should reclaim in points. After futile discussion and the fact that our short break was ticking away, we took the map she gave us and went to Hotel Batignolles. Hotel Batignolle was definitely not a 3 star and the charming receptionist had never heard of us! She went to the office and an older man returned, whom we assumed was the manager. He said HdA had telephoned that morning to book us a triple room. I said we did not want a triple room and he said it was actually two adjoining rooms and was very large. The `adjoining' rooms had no door betweem and, although clean, my brother had to walk through our bedroom to get to the loo, were not suitable. However, we felt we had no choice. purely on the constraints of time. We also were never asked to register. From reading the various reviesw of HdA, many peoploe have had bad experiences and, in my view, this outrageous practice should be stopped. My advice woulod be that HdA should be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Happier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for the price. But we did not realize what a wonderful location it was. It was such a nice neighborhood but close to everything. We were just a few blocks from the train station. The room was small, but we were not there to be in our room. It was very clean and well kept. It was a great experience. Just a tip, we booked thru the hotels website and paid upfront, which led to a great discount.

Reviews.Title: “Completly satisfied with the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked 3 nights at this hotel and after reading the reviews, was concerned that we would be moved to another hotel. I emailed the hotel and had an email back telling me that the booking was confirmed. The hotel was clean, in a great spot, near to Montmatre, two metro stations and lots of cafes and restaurants. We were very happy with the room and the service and shall certainly be booking again next year.

Reviews.Title: “cheating continues at hotel des arts Avoid !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through a well reputed dutch travel agency (Sunair). After reading the many reports about overbooking I sent them an email 2 days before our departure asking a confirmation of my booking. Sine I did not get a reply I called them one day in advance. The guy from the reception replied that I had a reservation for 4 nights, so I assumed that everything would be OK...NOT! Upon arrival the very same guy I talked to on the phone (a young bald guy called Alain, watch out for him) STILL came up with the usual story about the "inexperienced employee who had made a mistake" . As a result we would have to spend the first night in another hotel. I got furious and there followed a long and unfriendly conversation. I made it clear that what upset me most was the fact that he had clearly been lying to me the previous day. When I confronted him with the many complaints about his hotel he mentioned that this was caused by "americans who book through the (infamous) website". I am however not american and I booked through a well-known travel agency. His reply "In every professional organization mistakes are made." I did not accept this and called Sunair at once. A very helpful hostess immediately got in touch with customer-friendly Alain and after this we were moved to another hotel (hotel du moulin, rue fontaine). Apparently this is a better hotel (the rates were higher anyway and they had one * extra) and Friendly Alain remarked to us that he "lost money on us"since Hotel des arts was to pay the bill (at least some comfort for us). He did not botrher to arrange a taxi for us. The sunair hostess also told us that she had found many negative remarks about this hotel in the database of professional travle agencies and that she would inform management about this, advising them to stop co-operating with this hotel, in short AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “overbooking scam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To be realistic I cannot write an accurate review of the Hotel Des Arts itself seeing as I was unable to stay in it. Upon arrival at the Hotel I was very pleased. It look warm and clean, if quite small, and was not disappointed by its appearance. I had read reviews of the Hotel warning tourists about the over-booking scam and though I was wary, I did not believe it would happen to me. However, after giving the Hotel our details they told us that they has accidentally over-booked due to 'a new receptionist' (presumably the same 'new' receptionist that over-books everyone else). I knew immediately it was a scam but due to a language barrier I could not really do anything. We were relocated to a so-called 3star hotel. Yet the new hotel was dirty and badly situation and definately NOT the kind of place you would like to stay in. After much arguing with the tourist board we were moved to a much nicer hotel. However this does not take away from the utter scam that is to Hotel Des Arts. To those who have the same (foolish) attitude as me that is 'it will not happen to me', then do not take that risk. I have no doubts that the Hotel itself is lovely, but in booking there you run the risk of not getting the holiday that you expected at all. I am ashamed that they trick people on their holiday and my only advice would be to NOT BOOK THERE so they cannot continue scamming innocent people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Paris which was amazing. The hotel was in a great location but the staff where all very rude. We had problems from as soon as we arrived at the hotel. Being quite sick and exhausted from an 18 hour flight we wanted to check-in as soon as possible but we weren't allowed into our room until 3:00pm even though it was ready when we got there just before from 12:00pm. There was no compassion at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in picturesque Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: kayman
Reviews.Content: Based on mostly negative reviews on this site, it seems I was one of the few lucky ones that actually got to stay in this hotel. As such, I have to be fair and say this was great value and an overall positive experience. I booked this as part of a flight/hotel deal for several nights, everything pre-paid, all of which may count in their honoring the reservation. LOCATION: perfect, in picturesque Montmartre, on a narrow quiet street at the top of which is one of the only two remaining windmills in the neighbourhood (the other being the Moulin Rouge). Very close to two metro stops which will get you anywhere in Paris with maximum one change. Neighbourhood dotted with pretty small boutiques, specialty shops of all kinds, cafes, restaurants, etc. Place du Tertre/Sacre Couer only 7 minutes away walking, although a bit uphill. ROOM: Not as small as the sheer majority hotel rooms in Paris; simple, clean. Bathroom very small, but very clean, with comfortable size shower booth. Front desk helpful and courteous. ONLY DOWNSIDE: poor air circulation and no ventilation - have to keep the window open and ask them not to shut it after they clean the room, otherwise it can get pretty stuffy. Anyway, I took the risk, I was lucky and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Downright deceitful practice still ongoing at Hotel Des Arts...2 years on!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catastico
Reviews.Content: The practice of being shunted on to other hotels in Paris is alive and kicking at Hotel des Arts - interestingly no longer a member of Logis de France! You could well find yourselves in the shoes of many travellers before you if you book this Hotel. Do so at your peril!! My son & daughter gave my husband and I an all expenses paid visit to Paris including the excellent travel provided by 1st Class Eurostar. We arrived in Paris on May 6th for 3 nights. After carrying our heavy baggage from Gare du Nord and using the Metro we then walked to Rue Tholoze and to the hotel. On arrival we too were given the pathetic spiel about the 'new & inexperienced receptionist' and shunted off to Hotel du Mont Dore - this hotel being inferior and way out of Montmartre! The room we had was on the main road and for two of the three nights we stayed was very noisy, meaning we had to sleep with the windows closed, therefore the room was very stuffy. Alain and Caroline were unconcerned we had to change hotels and we insisted they provide us with evidence of their moving us to pass on to Eurostar. We are now pursuing a refund and Eurostar are investigating this matter. Come on Alain and Caroline, your old chestnut stories are wearing thin, think up some new excuses. I'm sure the British public with their strong sense of humour could conjure up a few for you! If you too, have had a bad experience at Hotel Des Arts, I would urge you to please complain. Hotel Des Arts MUST be brought to account and an end put to the deceitful and utterly unacceptable manner in which they are operating. Don't let your dissatisfaction go unnoticed, please help us in making potential customers aware of all these very dodgy 'scams', in the hope people travelling to Paris will think twice before leaving themselves open to yet more disappointment!!! We have heard that the owners of Hotel Des Arts have several hotels in Paris â€“ could it therefore be then that this hotel alongside HÃ´tel Pavillon de Montmartre* with their undoubtedly inviting websites are indeed â€˜flagshipsâ€™ perhaps, luring unsuspecting customers at the outset and catching them hook, line & sinker on arrival - bumping them off to some of their less desirable hotels in less desirable areas? I think so!!! *For your information, according to the official website for Hotel Des Arts, HÃ´tel Pavillon de Montmartre is a sister hotel of Hotel Des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the bother!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were sent by taxi to another hotel (Hotel du Mont Dore) with very little explanation and no apology. The man on reception mumbled something about a new receptionist messing up, but I've since read a review on this website of exactly the same thing happening to someone else last year. It seems to be a regular scam. Not the best start to a weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking Fraud - Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No matter how good this hotel sounds, its business practices are outrageously dishonest! Although I had read some of the negative reviews in advance, the positive descriptions of the hotel were so compelling, I took a risk. Big mistake. I booked this hotel through a reputable website - one which I have used to book many other hotel rooms in France and UK. I have never had a problem. When I showed up at Hotel Des Arts, my reservation had clearly been separated in a pile with a couple of others. I was told my reservation did not exist, that the hotel booking website was disreputable and had simply booked me into Hotel des Arts though a reservation was never arranged there. The receptionist made a big show about booking me in another hotel up the street - a shoddy, run-down Comfort Inn with few amenities ie. no internet access, and the rate was 5 Euros higher than what I had agreed to pay Hotel des Arts through the hotel booking website. Fair warning: if your travel plans are contingent on having guaranteed reservations, avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking continues! Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through a travel agency (NS Travel) in Holland. We had already read reports on this and other sites about the overbooking problems associated with Hotel des Arts but booked anyway in the assumption that booking through a travel agency would make a difference. At first we believed this assumption to be true because after arriving on sunday at 2 PM we got our room. But when we checked out on friday afternoon we witnessed the overbooking with our own eyes. Another dutch couple, who had booked with the same travel agency were given the old and known excuse that an unexperienced hotel employee had mistakingly overbooked the hotel and that they had to move to another hotel. We talked to them (in dutch) and told them about the overbooking reputation of this hotel and advised them to contact the travel agency in Holland before agreeing to another hotel. The hotel clerk at first refused them to make a phonecall to the travel agency and actually got mad and abusive because we had talked in a language he did not understand. Finally they could make the call but still had to move to another hotel. We had to leave (the taxi was waiting) and they told us they would file a formal complaint to the travel agency when back in Holland. Conclusion: If you want to be sure about your hotelroom and don't want to be moved around to a location you haven't chosen yourself: Don't book Hotel des Arts in Paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations - "All a bit too dodgy!"”
Reviews.Author: Cpoulter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in September 2004 through Eurostar Holidays direct. After reading reviews on this website, I emailed the hotel directly to ensure that they were aware of our booking and asked them to ensure that we wouldn't be bumped. They replied promptly and ensured us that there would be no problems. On Thursday December 9th, we arrived at the hotel about midday to leave our bags. The receptionist informed us that they were overbooked and that they had no knowledge of our booking and we would need to be moved but not to worry they would get us a taxi. I explained about the email but unfortunately hadn't taken a copy of their response. After a lengthy confrontation they assured me that we could remain in that hotel and to come back and check in after 5pm. I was then upset, angry and tired. On a happier note, I got engaged to my boyfriend on the Seine that afternoon, unfortunately this whole episode overshadowed the day and I was worried all afternoon about what would happen when we got back to the hotel and where would we be staying that evening. Upon our return we were indeed put into Hotel Des Arts. All very strange. If you manage to stay in this hotel it is clean and the staff helpful. Although the breakfast room is small and crowded in the basement and you normally have a wait for a table. Personally I wouldn't gamble staying here. There is something a bit dodgy going on with the bookings!

Reviews.Title: “Please read this-it will affect your booking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked on January 14th for a stay of 3 nights commencing 26th April, my wife and I were looking forward to our first trip to Paris. Upon arrival at the "Hotel", we were told that our reservation had been cancelled that morning ( whilst we were enroute ) because my credit card was invalid. It was not, we used it several times whilst in Paris with no problem. We booked through Active hotels and I must say they have been very helpful when we complained about the way we were treated, they have even taken the hotel off their list ( try and book !) We did however find a lovely hotel just down the road and we would recommend it, they even accepted my invalid credit card. Hotel Regyn's Montmartre was the name and it is very similar in price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rhn6369
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia, and in accordance with the rave reviews that have been posted. My partner and I, after a long transatlantic flight were given the same line that a new receptionist had over booked and we were being transferred to the Timhotel a few blocks over. When I informed them that I had spoken to the reservations dept the previous day and reconfirmed our reservation, they became hostile and rude, for no reason at all. They proceeded to inform me that they do not make money through travel bookings such as expedia and if I did not book directly with them, they were under no obligation to honour our reservations. When I brought it back to them that the new receptionist story was an untruth, they wrote down the name and address of the new hotel and told us to walk till we found it. Needless to say, we had no choice but to depart their property for fear that there could have been potential retaliation. The Timhotel hotel, Montmarte was extremely kind to us and gave us a great room with great service. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Please be careful when booking this hotel especially if you booked through other means than their website. They were most unkind but thankfully not a reflection of the rest of the citizens of France, who were great.

Reviews.Title: “No trouble, regardless of what other reviewers say!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel as it was recommended by a British travel writer as one of the top 10 hotels in Paris for under 100 Euros per night. However, I read the reviews on this web site not long before travelling and became slightly concerned. I emailed the hotel and they sent back a swift reply stating that they did not have a policy of switching guests to another hotel and that my booking was confirmed. I suggest that if you are worried about your booking, email the hotel and get confirmation. They were very helpful. I booked two rooms at the Hotel - one for me and my partner and one for my parents. My room was fantastic, with a balcony, reasonable amount of room, decent bathroom, and some limited views. However, my parents' room was considerably smaller, with only an inward looking window for ventilation. It might be an idea to specifically request a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony. Although, these rooms are on the 4th floor and the lift is small and slow. We didn't mind running up and down 4 flights of stairs every time we arrived back at the hotel, but you may feel differently! The only other complaint was that I had booked a double room for my parents, but the hotel put them in a twin room - even though they turned it into a double on the second night (pushing the beds together and double bedding) this was inconvenient and certainly not as comfortable as a double room. However, the rooms were quiet - even my room that opened up directly onto the street was quiet in the evening. And apart from the minor issues raised here, the rooms were adequately decorated, very clean, and generally pleasant. We found the reception staff to be helpful and friendly. Although we speak a little French (badly), the staff all spoke English, and didn't mind helping us out with language issues! The area was picturesque, and easy to navigate, with good access to the Sacre Coeur and easy access to Blanche metro station, although the walk back to the hotel from the Metro is uphill and a bit cobbled - again, not a problem for me or partner, but maybe an issue for older or physically disabled visitors. We found the surrounding area to be very 'young' feeling and met people easily in the local bars. While the hotel is close to Pigalle and is basically half way up the Montmarte Butt, the street it is in does not feel 'red light' at all. I would recommend this hotel, as long as you don't mind hills and stairs. You may also like to specifically request a room with a balcony and you may wish to confirm your booking if you are nervous about the reports on this web site.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Arts is a winner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a hotel in Paris that wouldn't be too expensive, since we wouldn't be there much, except to sleep. After shopping around on the internet, I located, in the centre of the action (Montmartre), a quaint little hotel at a very reasonable price. The rooms had recently been renovated, the bathroom was impeccably clean, and the breakfasts were super: all-you-can-eat style (but you only get one delicious croissant) with eggs, cereal, yoghurt, bread, fruit salad, juice, great cafÃ©, etc. Our two week stay here was wonderful; they had assigned us a room overlooking the street, but I switched it on arrival to an interior room (with window opening onto a common innner court). It was truly quiet and we slept like logs every night. Only downside: plastic glasses, not enough shelf space in the bathroom, no chest of drawers for long stays. Also, you're not supposed to eat in the room (but we kinda cheated...) A bonus for us was the decor in the hotel: a mix of 'art nouveau' and 'art deco'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel thanks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a trip in paris in hotel de arts in montmartre. It is a lovely place to stay ! The decoration and the location is the best point o the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trevorl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the internet on the hotel's own website. charged 87.60 euros for one night and thought fair enough....it looks like a nice place to stay with my wife for a romantic night in Paris. Arrived Saturday 2pm to be told they'd had an inexperienced member of staff who'd overbooked and that we were now staying in a "more expensive" hotel in the same road - Comfort Hotel. Needless to say our experience was so bad I've posted a sperate review of this other hotel which, incidentally, charges 60 euros per night!!! Now having read the various comments posted on here PLEASE DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL as you too may never get past Reception. What's more you'll be overcharged in the process!

Reviews.Title: “** Most Romantic Hotel **”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: can not say enough nice things about this hotel. The staff was super friendly, the neighborhood the best in paris, the rooms clean and nice, a metro station a block away, most major attractions within walking distance, and shopping galore right out the front door. It was a perfect end to a perfect trip and we can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another smuck scammed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fortunately we had only prepaid for one night at this hotel through expedia (who have lost my custom for good). The lobby of this hotel is indeed lovely. We were told that whilst they couldn't accommodate us they were sending us to an even better hotel! Indeed the entrance to the grand hotel de normadie does appear nice (presumably to lure those who think they are getting a three star hotel - come on french tourist board stop stuffing your face with croissants and go past the entrance to these places!). This hotel is a ----hole (excuse my french!). The rooms and stairways reminded me of a student squat, and a poorly faciliated one at that (At least my student squat many years ago had a working TV). Don't go to either of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to Scam us too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris at Easter and having booked the Des Arts in January (through Expedia) thought we would be safe. I have to be honest and say that i hadn't really looked into the hotel with any great detail. It looked nice from the pictures and suited our budget. (besides double booking rarely happens...right?) We were greeted after a long hot walk with our cases with the same 'New receptionist has over booked' speil that seems all too common. The 'Heavy snowfall' excuse i have later read is a classic! We were being moved to the Grande Normandie, a 3 star hotel so we were told, in the Opera district but this was no good to us as we specifically wanted to stay in the MontMarte district. After much complaining we gave in and waited for our free transport to the hotel, at this point i asked the receptionist for his name. He reluctantly told me and when asked i pointed out it was for my records...he then made a brief phonecall and a room was miraculously found for us. We were also offered our money back if we wanted to spend the rest of the day looking for a hotel! The hotel itself is fine and in a great area, just be wary when booking! We certainly won't be booking the Des Arts again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy Practices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this Hotel on the evening of Sunday 20 March with my two travelling companions, we were quickly told by the man at the Reception Desk that our booking was not for this Hotel despite us having full documentation to confirm our booking. No reason was given to us for our booking not being able to be honoured. I have since read about the practice of "bumping" guests taking place at this Hotel on Trip Adviser and feel it should be highlighted to would be guests that my party were subjected to a situation that appears to be fairly commonplace at this establishment. The Hotel we were sent to, whilst being fairly decent, was situated in Pigale in the heart of Paris' red light district, an area of the city we certainly would not have booked through choice. I am sure that few people will view this type of situation as ideal. When you book and pay for an Hotel through a universally respected medium such as Expedia, you expect to stay in that hotel in the part of the city you have carefully chosen, not somewhere else in a seedy district of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - excellent service !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent from the first day we checked in through the entire 8 days of our trip. Our room, though small, was well decorated and the bathroom was large. They can be very slippery when wet. The location was fantastic and very easy to get to the Metro. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We too as some other people had reserved and payed for a room at this hotel for our last night in Paris. We were supposed to be celebrating my partners newly passed doctorate and my pregnancy. As we were living in a hotel nearby we went to have a look at hotel desArts the day before, I thought it looked sweet and was really happy since we had spent four nights in an avarage hotel and this looked like an upgrade. So as so many others when we arrived we were told that there was a slight problem with their Hotel and that we would be sent to a better one and receive breakfast. Sounded good so we were Ok about it. But what we got at Hotel Grande Normandie, was just awful. It was on a busy street in an awful area. The room was ---!!!!!!!! Much worse then the 2 star hotel we had been staying. And since we had to leave early in the morning we did not have time for their breakfast anyway. Being pregnant I got really hungry at night and wanted some fruit really badly and the only thing we could find was a yoghurt and a fruitsalad in a cheap and nasty fastfood joint around the corner, whilst we knew that in Montrematre fruitstores were on all corners. They should not be able to sell rooms that they do not have. I would not have payed for what I got, would rather have spent it on something better then sleeping in the squathouse we got!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Verydissapointed
Reviews.Content: This is an awful place. Despite pre-paying, our party were dunted to another hotel. I suspect there is a system in place where a group of hotels advertise through Expedia with one hotel (this one) over book and shift people. This avoids advertising charges for them. When we arrived the guy at reception said that shifting us was OK!, he was obviously used to doing so. This establishment is not trustworthy, avoid at all costs...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing This hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just return from my weekend in Paris. I have only one advice to the others travellers this hotel is cheap clean cosy and the staf is nice with the guest. I book online with the own website of the hotel. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed Scammed Scammed.”
Reviews.Author: Teenieedinburgh
Reviews.Content: Its simply happening far too often to be anything other than a systematic scam. We had booked for 3 nights through Expedia and on arrival late on the evening of 20 March our party of 3 were advised by the receptionist that there wasn't a room available but that we had been shifted to a better hotel. The receptionist claimed not to have much English and was quite unsympathetic.No explanation was given as to why the prepaid rooms had been relet and we were told to come back the next day and see the manager if we were unhappy! Having read Trip Advisor I had prepared my colleagues for the possibility of the bumping scam however it doesn't make it any better when it happens to you. We were moved to the Carlton Hotel at Pigalle and whilst the hotel itself was clean and the staff helpful it is in the heart of a very seedy area (similar to Kings Cross in London) and certainly not one that many visitors would choose voluntarily. I don't see how reputable companies are continuing to use this Hotel - its the equivalent of you turning up at the airport for your flight to Paris and being told you are going to Rome instead and that Italy's a better country to visit anyway !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, the decoration is very nice and the people helpful. I book directly online, on the own website of the hotel. It's my thrid time in this hotel and I never had any problems. The web site of this hotel is great and I get discount all the time. I will come again to visit this wonderful city which is Paris. The location is great I love Montmartre with all the shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great moment in this lovely Hotel - Montmartre is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm from South Africa. For myself the two star hotel are most of the time not very nice. But this two star hotel is very nice and the staff is very helpful with the stranger like me and my family. If I can give an advice to the others travellers come to visit Montmartre, this district is so lively during the day and at night. The hotel des Arts is very nice and the room are not big but a correct size. THe rate is very attractive. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Bonjour From Paris - Amazing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For my stay in Paris I decide to book on line with the official web site of the hotel. The hotel is great and the staff is very nice. I do not understaff the other reviews who are saying bad things about this hotel. I sure if you book direct with them you will not have any problem at all. The hotel is located in the heart of Montmartre closed to the metro Abbesses. This hotel is very cheap but the quality is very high. The hotel quality is amazing and I will come back. I will booked direct with the hotel and I'm sure I will not have any problem. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a short break in Paris.I have stayed two night in this hotel and I this is the best stay I have never had in this city. This hotel is amazing. It is definitely the place to stay if you intend to visit Paris! It is charming,extraordinary clean,well decorated with lots of local painters and the staff is so helpfull ! I read some reviews about overbookings as well. my advice:book directly throuht the hotel's official website(lots of promotional offers!) and not throught a ghost unknown internet travel-agency.

Reviews.Title: “This is a perferct Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrive at this hotel for the first time. The loby is great and the staff was very nice with us. If I have to suggest an hotel that this one. I'm traveling since a very long time in Europe and the des arts hotel is very clean and room size is very good. The breakfast si Ok. I will come back for a romantic week end in Paris in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm coming at the "des Arts" since 5 years every weeks and i don't understand what's happening with all this reviews. This hotel is very good, clean and the familly who is running this hotel do that since 1966. Request the room on the 5th or the 6th you will have a view all over Paris.

Reviews.Title: “And again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room several weeks before the arrival. However, as I got to the hotel, the receptionist told me that parts of the hotel was closed because of the problem due to an unexpected amount of snowfall. They assigned me another hotel, whose owner is the same as that of the Hotel des Arts. I suppose that the hotel intentionally accepts the researvation that exceeds their capacity, and gives the customers to the other hotel. It is a disgusting policy and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to be get scammed!

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the last review”
Reviews.Author: Robin01
Reviews.Content: My family and I were also turned away on the first night of a short holiday we had booked in advance and sent to another hotel nearby which was certainly of a lower standard. We were allowed back for the last 2 nights, but it was clear that the hotel management had overbooked and were sending unsuspecting foreign tourists elsewhere and saving themselves some money. Apart from that the hotel was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were scammed too....We risked booking at the the hotel despite all the warnings. I phoned the hotel prior to arrival to confirm they had received the booking - which they had, so I felt quite confident we would be ok...big mistake!. On arrival at the hotel we were told that our room had been flooded. So, we were bumped to another hotel (the comfort inn, sacre couer) which was ok but quite small. We paid ??20 a night so we were not too unhappy, but if your heart is set on staying in a really nice hotel, it may be best to avoid this hotel....be warned and good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation and great area”
Reviews.Author: cheshiredave
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 years ago with my workmates, in mid-December. (Xmas treat.) The hotel is fine, and good value. Smallish rooms, but lots of Parisian budget hotels are like that. Breakfast was also fine - the usual croissants, coffee, cheese, juices, cereals. Taken in the basement. Montmarte is a great village area and NOT isolated, as you may think from looking at a map - the Abbesses / Blanche metro stops take you everywhere very quickly. Get a 3- or 5-day pass. Moulin Rouge is 150 yds down the hill, and Sacre Coeur is 10 mins to the left (as you face down the hill) - or go UPhill to the remaining windmill and turn right, down the interesting backstreets.Good for its price. Comfort Hotel Sacre Coeur, nearby, is similar, probably not quite as nice, but probably a little cheaper.. As lots of Parisian hotels, these are places to lay your head at night, and not places to see and be seen in, but that suits me fine. Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “We were scammed too - why risk it?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked tripadvisor before booking and decided to risk being bumped, as those who actually get to stay seem to like it and the location is great. Bad move! Arriving 6 Dec 04 we were spun the same lies about a new receptionist overbooking. The Paris boat show (quite a minor event) was said to have caused a hotels crisis too. Like the others we were dumped outside Montmartre, in a hotel with small rooms in a nondescript area. "Upgrade" it was certainly not! The pattern of the same lies spun to others repeatedly over a long period shows that this a systematic and deliberate overbooking scam, not an accident that just keeps on happening again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value - Lovely hotel In Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you need to find a very good hotel located in the heart of Paris, visit the hotel des arts. I found this hotel on the newsspaper the times. The satff is very nice and the room are well decorated. For my first stay in Paris it was very good, and the montmartre district is very nice and the shops and restaurants are typicaly french (you feel the paris atmospher). See you a next time

Reviews.Title: “C'est terrible! They overbook purposefully!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations 2 months prior and got a confirmation from the hotel, to no avail. When I arrived I was told the room had been overbooked and was put in another hotel which was not nearly as nice. I am very disappointed; the hotel looks great but the management is at the least incompetent. I do not accept their explanation that this was an oversight; I think they purposefully overbook and then deliver their guests to other local hotels. Look at how often overbooking occurs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and friendly staff (and dog)”
Reviews.Author: allwrite
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have a tendency to overbook so beware! They put us in a nearby hotel for one night which was GRIM! However the Hotel des Arts was everything the other hotel was not. Friendly staff and small but very clean rooms and bathrooms complement a fabulous location. Add to these a decent (continental) breakfast, a very friendly dogand a high standard of maintenance and hygiene. There are 2 Metro stations nearby (Use Abbesses station so you don't have to climb the hill from Blanche) and a battery powered bus which shuttles around the area. Lastly, there are many good restaurants nearby to suit all pockets (even my legendarily shallow ones). All things considered, as a base for visiting Paris on a budget, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another disappointed customer”
Reviews.Author: duthduck
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on tripadvisor.com about this hotel, I decided to book it anyway. It seemed like those people who booked and actually managed to stay in the hotel, were quite satisfied with the hotel. But it seemed like they did have a habit of overbooking the hotel, and shunting people off to other hotels out of the Montmartre neighbourhood. I decided to take the risk! Bad decision. After a day of driving 3 hours from Liverpool to Luton airport in the UK, then catching a flight to Paris, then an RER train into Paris and then 2 Metro lines to the Moulin Rouge, and then a walk up the hill to the hotel, we were given the bad news. Unfortunately their new or inexperienced (I can't remember which explanation we were given) receptionist had accidentally overbooked the hotel, and there was no room for us. And there was also a problem throughout Paris with accomodation being available. But never fear - they had found an alternate hotel for us, and would give us money and put us in a cab and send us off on our way. I was seething. I don't speak my mind very often, but on this occasion I couldn't control myself. I told them that I knew that they had a habit of doing this when people arrived, but they denied it. I couldn't believe it. The hotel we ended up going to was fantastic - a brand new hotel called Suite-Hotel near Porte de la Chappelle metro station. The rooms were huge. Unfortunately the location was nothing compared to Montmartre. And because we hadn't already paid the 78 Euro per night rate that I booked Hotel des Arts for over a month beforehand, the new hotel cost us 92 Euro per night (but the 4th night was half price). It was a bargain for that price, but I was still very annoyed with the way Hotel des Arts seem to regard their customers. Just as an aside, the taxi seemed to take forever to come and collect us, and in the meantime the chocolate labrador decided to hump my fiancee's leg in the waiting area. The perfect end to a perfect day!

Reviews.Title: “Please remove this hotel from your list !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is true that this hotel has bad service. Try to book this hotel for a longer stay, and you will feel it ! We booked this hotel at the beginning of September 2004 through a famous travel agent in Tokyo. We booked it for 4 nights, but we only stayed there 2 nights. The first day we arrived, they bumped us to other hotel, which fortunatelly better than this hotel. We thought that this is a little strange, but we still can accept it. They told us to come back to Des Arts at the second day, and we stayed there for two nights. Then at the forth night, the unbelievable thing happened. We still have our luggage being kept at this hotel, but the receptionist said that they don't have any room for us, and bumped us again to another hotel. This time is worse because the hotel was very small, dirty, and certainly the price is lower than what we paid for Des Arts. I noticed there was also another couple with the same condition, and they angrily told the Des Arts' receptionist that they fill like inside pigeon hole. I don't know whether it is usual for hotels in Paris to do this kind of unresponsible thing...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had such a pleasant stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were most helpful and professional. The room was clean and comfortable. Excellent accommodations, quite affordable, and convenient location. Would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des arts was a quaint little hotel with friendly staff and nice, clean rooms. We had a few problems on arrival but they were sorted, also do not stay in room number 2, it is a badly situated room, me and my boyf were placed in there and complained and then we were moved the next day. It is ideally located with easy access to the metro system and all major monuments are never more then 30 minutes away. The hotel has a peaceful atmosphere, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A charmin little Hotel - Very good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Nice place located in Montmartre. Nice Hotel. Nice Satff. i Will come Back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Montmartre is a worderful district and this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, the staff is very helpfull and the rate for a stay is very cheap (78 â‚¬ a night). This hotel is two star but it could be a three star hotel. I will visit you an other time

Reviews.Title: “worderful hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used a hotel chain called Premium Hotels. This hotel is a great deal, very good price for a very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Located In a Very Nice District”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, he hotel is very good and the staff is worderful. I will come back to visit you again.
